Reviews.Title: “Orient Express - Istanbul - Good value your Money”
Reviews.Author: F M
Reviews.Content: First of all, Istanbul is a city worthy to visit. The are where the hotel is located is quite touristic and close to many sightseeings. Despite the level of quality (****) might not be the same as in other european countries, you will received good value for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Stuff & Location”
Reviews.Author: AbO_eLsHo2
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start with repeating that the Oriental Express Hotel has an excellent, friendly, and attentive staff that treats you like old friends of the family. I've never meet such professional & friendlly hotel stuff. Positive: - Location: 5 min. walking to z left to Gulhane tram station & 8-10 min walking to z right to Sirkeci tram & train station. "Tram passes by the hotel's door". - Very good diversified breakfast. - Small pool was a nice touch to a long tiring day. Negative: - Small rooms. - Small TV with no children channels. Briefing, I recommend this hotel & will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal hotel for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: Personnel in this hotel is very helpful and kind. You are not a number in this hotel. Breakfast was diversified and tasty. The rooms are a bit small but very clean. The location of the hotel in the old historic city center is perfect. The restaurant on the 7th floor not only has a superb view on the city but also very good food. Value for money. For a city trip this is an ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mikel123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the attractions such as th e Blue Mosque and to far to the Grand Bazaar. Outside the hotel is the tram. Lots of great shops around the area ( better prices compared to the G bazaar).

Reviews.Title: “The staff were the key”
Reviews.Author: Kaz64Zurich
Reviews.Content: Some holidays are made or broken by the attitude of the staff at one's hotel, and here the holiday was definitely made. They were always cheerful, happy to oblige and couldn't be more helpful. We did a number of tours, all of which they organised for us and even arranged for a sheet and blanket on my bed instead of the hated doona (duvet). Tram didn't bother us really. Room was smallish but as other reviewers have said, very clean and adequate. We loved the central location and access to the tram which was very easy to use. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would definitely go there again on another trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: stephfromlondon_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now, and while there may be more glamorous places to stay in this fantastic and increasingly fashionable city, the Orient Express is a relaxed, low key and friendly place, ideally situated just south of the hubbub of sultanahmet. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace are all just a stroll or one tram stop away. Rooms are quite basic by the standard of more boutiquey places, but very clean and perfectly comfortable, with good powerful showers in the bathrooms. There is a small but really nice swimming pool in the basement a bonus. There is free wi fi, and two computers in public areas for guests to use, fresh flowers on tables in the bar. Breakfast is lovely buffet style stuff including an entire honeycomb for guests to hack at! The staff are incredibly nice, even by the standards of this very hospitable country. Nothing too much trouble, genuine warmth and kindness and a gift of a box of turkish delight on departure. There is a fantastic restaurant on the top floor which must be stunning in the summer when the french doors are open, the view is wonderful. One minor gripe - I had asked for a first floor room (lift phobic!) and this was willingly accommodated, as was my fussiness over the first room offered - but all rooms on this floor are smoking rooms and there was a lingering 'fag' smell in the room. But a small gripe indeed, generally much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice very central hotel in old city”
Reviews.Author: CHRISTOS_GR60
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel when arrived turkish delight waited for us. personal very polite and helpful. room beautiful but small. old type small tv very clean rooms quite good breakfast,but i missed some kind of turkish pastries. excellent central lokation all in all very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality at its best + Great Location = A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: Heed the reviewers who noted this TOP NOTCH staff!! They are absolutely correct. The Oriental Express Hotel has an excellent, friendly, and attentive staff that treats you like old friends of the family. We stayed for 4 nights with our 6yr old (rather rambunctious) boy and could not have asked for a more pleasant stay. The room was surprisingly large for an Old Town Istanbul hotel and we very clean. The daily cleaning staff surprised us every day with some nice personal touch in the room (even a bottle of wine with a â€œHappy Easterâ€� note!!). The staff were always available to assist and answer my never-ending questions â€“ even when I had to make a last minute change to my room reservations. In fact they were much more attentive than another â€œ5-starâ€� hotel we considered, and the (to me) was the difference. Service - friendly and helpful service. The manager had even left a welcome note with his mobile number (which we did not need). Perfect size (heated!) pool that my son could not get enough of; a nice respite from the busy streets of Istanbul. The breakfast was very nice yogurt, small baked goods, and the honeycomb was a nice touch. The breakfast staff was very professional and clearly loved children (always a giant plus for me when traveling with my family). Finally, the location of the Oriental Star is ideal. Easy walk to all the Old Town sites (Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Sultanamhet, etc.) as well as the ferries to the Asian side, the Galata Bridge, and the New Town. Our last day in town turned out to be rainy and cold so we stayed close and shopped the local merchants. Good bargains to be had a very friendly merchantsâ€¦and the longer you chatâ€¦the lower the prices. Really good restaurants literally right out the door and a baklava shop that will haunt my waistline for weeks. We will stay here again. Period.

Reviews.Title: “close to main area”
Reviews.Author: nomad4838
Reviews.Content: close to sea,close to main area,but it is a bit noisy because of tram ,

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: rbphilip
Reviews.Content: From the pick-up at the airport to arranging my ride back to the airport for the next part of my trip, the staff at the hotel were wonderful. The top floor restaurant has a fantastic view and the breakfast was perfect. I found Istanbul a little overwhelming, and the hotel was a convenient, quiet escape from the hustle and bustle. The room was spotlessly clean. I really have nothing bad to say about this place. Great value for money and perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel--Would highly recommend Orient Express or sister hotel Erboy”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternParent
Reviews.Content: I am going to post this review on the Erboy Hotel site and the Orient Express site since they are sister establishments, had a lot in common, and we stayed at both. I enjoyed both of these hotels and wouldn't hesitate to recommend either of them. To me, their prices seemed very fair for a large urban city. I had reserved a couple of nights at the Erboy just to start our journey, and then when I went back to add more nights, the Erboy was booked so I added some nights at the Orient Express. First, the desk staff has had excellent training and is just terrific. Upon arrival at both hotels, the front desk staff provides you with a map and helps you determine where to go if you are sightseeing. The desk staff is consistently friendly and helpful at both hotels and willingly answers questions. Second, at the Erboy, you are given apple tea upon arrival--it's great. At the Orient, there was Turkish Delight left in the room. Third, the rooms at both hotels were sufficiently clean and nice. I reserved a triple (3 twins) for two people online at Expedia at the Erboy just to have extra space, and when we first arrived, we were upgraded to a quad (one double, two twins). The room had no real view but was very quiet and comfortable with a flat screen TV with remote. I had reserved a twin at the Orient Express and it was a smaller room which I expected. The beds were pushed together but there was room to move around, and I hadn't asked for a larger room. The TV was older but still had a remote. I preferred the larger bathroom at the Erboy but I suspect the Orient Express has rooms with larger bathrooms as well so I am comparing apples to oranges here. We had hot water at both hotels. Fourth, the location of both hotels is terrific. The Erboy is up a hill about 2 blocks from the Orient Express. You walk down a manageable incline street (with restaurants and shops along the side) to reach the Orient Express which is on the tram line with the access to the tram a short distance away. The Orient Express was on a busier street but I had requested a quiet room and got one. Both hotels are within easy walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, the Haigia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. There is also shopping within walking distance. The tram line only costs 2 TL and is very easy to use. (Get some 1 TL pieces and put them in the automated machine for a token at the access point.) Both hotels are also within easy walking distance of the Sirkeci train station. We caught a suburban train which also cost only 2 TL one way (uses a different token but uses same method to get a token). There was a convenience mart across the street from the Orient Express to buy a soda or bottled water. There was probably one nearby the Erboy as well. One night I couldn't find a small bill to pay for the water and the propietor of the shop across from the Orient Express was going to let me take it on credt--wow! I did finally find a small bill to pay. Fifth, both hotels had wireless which worked and had two computers for guests to use near the lobby with internet access and a printer. Sixth, the breakfast at both hotels was very similar--lots of fine bread, cheeses, cucumbers, olives, at least a couple of hotter items, tea, etc. I have no complaints about the breakfasts and enjoyed them. Seventh, the Orient Express had a nice looking pool that we didn't use. I would recommend either hotel wholeheartedly. They are at least as good as any Holiday Inn Express I have stayed in and actually have better breakfasts, more services, and more outstanding staff than I usually encounter at hotels. Each hotel also had a restaurant although we didn't have time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Medsta
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is walking distance from some of Istanbul's must see sites. But there is also a tram station close by to go further. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The staff were all very helpful in recommendations or helping with bookings etc.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further for Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ericfever
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights 15-18 March. Friendly and very helpful staff. Very clean. Lower floored front rooms do suffer from a bit of tram noise but not excessive. Normally we do not eat in Hotel restaurants as we like to try local restaurants but the view was so enticing we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed food and staff were excellent. No car needed most tourist locations within 20 minutes casual stroll. Will certainly recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Linger_backpacker
Reviews.Content: Good hotel! With small swimming pool full of people, clean and silent rooms (our room was on "garden" side). It was warm in the room in march. Breakfast is not perfect but good enough, just ordinary turkish breakfast. Polite stuff explain us everything we ask. It was very nice to find a plate of turkish delight in the room. One poor moment: this hotel doesn't have own car park, and it would be a problem to park close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAFF AND SUPERB HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: strudledoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 night to attend the world indoor athletics,the staff were amazing from the moment we booked hotel till the moment we checked out, we ha rooms 703 and 704 which was the highest accommodation floor,only the restaurant was above,I had been concerned about noise from previous reviews but there was no need as the noise was minimum and stopped at around 10pm. Reception staff gave us information about places to see and the easiest way to get to places. The imbat restaurant was divine,food cheap and amazing quality,chef made me special meals as I'm allergic to milk,nothing was to much trouble! We arranged the hotel transfer from the airport through Lori and that was fantastic! I personally didn't like the shower screens in the bathroom as it made the room seem small but the other people in the group thought they were great! All in all this is a lovely little hotel right in the heart of everything and if you don't want to use the tram pretty much all the main sights are within 20mins walk

Reviews.Title: “A week In Istanbl that could not have been Better”
Reviews.Author: Walt1910
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at the Orient Express Hotel very conveniently located in the Old European section of Istanbul just a 10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and other attreactions. This was my first trip to Istanbul and a combination of tourism and business conference. From the moment I booked the trip when I asked for a room looking north over the Bosphorus, til the hotel arranged pickup at the airport and my arrival at the hotel, all went very well. The staff welcomed me and later my friend who joined me, was helpful on answering any questions I asked, and went out of their way to make both of us welcome. (Even the maid offered a cherry morning greeting when I left my room.) I took advantage of the cash discount on the room charge which I paid in dollars saving me a lot of money,and also the discount at the roof top restaurant available for those staying at the hotel where the meals, view, and service were excellent. I would defintely return to the Orient Express and recommend it to my friends as the place to stay in Istanbul at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: nadinegil
Reviews.Content: I booked another hotel but got upgraded to the Orient Express upon arrival to Istanbul and i couldn't recommend a better hotel. It was spotlessly clean, great breakfast, and wifi throughout. The staff could not be more helpful, they gave great advice on places to see and do whilst we were there. The location is also perfect for all the best sites of the city. I couldn't recommend this hotel more and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Welcoming Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hilz57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently & found the staff welcoming & extremely courteous & helpful. The hotel is clean & comfortable & the breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice. Would certainly recommend the hotel, plus, it is very central for Sultanahmet & sites. Also try the 'Hand Made' restaurant a couple of doors away from hotel, friendly staff, good food & reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hooboox
Reviews.Content: We were for a weekend in Istanbul (january 2012). We actually booked another hotel, but because of renovation activities, we were offered to stay at the Orient Express. The location is great and the hotel interior is classical, but neat. Very friendly staff and a decent breakfast buffet. Probably not a unique hotel in the city area, but definitely a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: marianneBL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Very warm welcome and must say that the staff was absolutely fantastic. Rare to find ALL members of staff so nice, smiling and helpful. Room a bit small but clean. Breakfast good, free wifi works well and 2 computers and printers available. Perfect location on the tramline which can make it a bit noisy if you have a room to the road and sleep with windows open. Nice swimming pool with long opening hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to visit Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GJW37
Reviews.Content: Orient Express is an excellent place to visit Istanbul. Located in walking distance from major attractions: Hagia Sophia, Topcapi palace with harem, Grand Bazar, etc. 100m from a tram stop, 300m from local railway station and 500m from ferry terminal. The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated in the style of the Orient Express train. We have got a room reasonably equipped: small bathtub with a shower, hairdryer, TV (old, but who cares?) with local and sat channels, tee/coffee maker, large comfortable bad (with somewhat hard mattress). If you force me to find something to complain about, I could wish to have an armchair and more shelves in the room. The staff is very friendly and always ready to help. Asking about ferry time table or museum opening hours I got the answer immediately or they tried to find it out for me. Swimming pool is excellent for a couple of people. It needs some discipline if a handful of people want to swim, but hotel is rather small and in practice most of the time we were alone. We decided to visit Istanbul in February to avoid crowds. We were more successful than expected, because the temperature was about zero with clouds and snow. We enjoyed visiting the most famous sites without queues and crowds, while we relaxed in the worm (very warm!) hotel room between the visits. Another advantage of this period is that we have got an important discount, so we could afford this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abla J
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had a great time at the Orient Express hotel. The warm professional treat & great by the hotel staff made us forget about the very cold weather in Istanbul, we recommend this hotel as it is clean,neat , friendly English speaking staff, very good food, near all the sights , reachable from airport by metro & tram. Our next stay for sure at this hotel. we called the Orient Express hotel ( Hotel SWEET hotel) for we had a great time there. Regards, Rizek & Abla Abu Judom Amman - Jordan

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: llady_ann
Reviews.Content: It was a while ago when I have been to Istanbul but I still remember that trip and Orient Express Hotel. Everything was excellent! Perfect location, extremely welcoming and helpful staff, spotless room (and we saw Golden Horn gulf out of our window), breakfast was diverse and delicious, free 4 oâ€™clock tea and snack were nice too, and those small presents (bottle of wine, sweets and souvenir) all of these just made our stay remarkable. I will definitely stay there again. And I highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nana S
Reviews.Content: The hotel in excellent position , it.s close to most importent attraction in Turkey , you can go by walk to the blue mosque , sultan castle and others , also the train tram 2 minutes walk , also many shops , cafee and restaurants and many things also the area very nice , clean and safe . The staff excellent from the cleaner to the manager very nice face very helpful friendly , they are amazing really i don't wan to leave the hotel as it was very comfortable to stay also nice , clean amazing breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel where the staff couldn't do more to help”
Reviews.Author: Rodster13
Reviews.Content: This is a very sweet hotel, with accommodating, helpful staff who look to make your stay enjoyable. The location is good for the key tourist sites, and the pool a pleasant respite for the kids after a stint of sightseeing in bustling Istanbul. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: PDX79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orient Express for about 5 days and this hotel, the service and the location is awesome. It' was my first stay in Istanbul as well as it was for my friends. When we were looking for a good located hotel with an interesting name we found Orient Express. This sounds very ottoman and we checked the comments here on Tripadvisor. Regarding to the positive comments we decided to book our accommodation in this hotel. We all were unsure about Orient Express but when we left we promised to come back because the Hotel kept what Trip Advisor promised. The first impression of a hotel is the front desk and the front staff. This impression was very good. We got a very warm hello and welcome and felt like home. We asked for good and cheap turkish food and they recommended us some georgious places. We felt in love with Doner and Kebap. They also recommended us the most important sightseeing places like Ayasofiya and the famous Topkappi palace. Istanbul is a very interesting and unbelievable city and we were really lucky to have good educated front desk staff in our hotel who were like a library. They always knew what we were looking for. I would like to say thank you again in the name of my friends and myself to Orient Express especially the front desk guys and to Trip advisor which is a good channel for finding the right accommodation with correct conditions. Orient Express and Istanbul - see you again hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NARBOROUGH2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January for my husband's birthday. On arrival we were greeted with a bottle of wine in the room wishing him Happy Birthday. Our room was on the 7th floor and gave us a wonderful view over the Bosphous and the bridge which spans it. The room was good with a seating area, shower and bathroom and wardrobe with adequate hanging space. We ate in the restaurant for the first night and couldn't fault the food, service or view. We would have eaten there again if we had been longer than the three nights but wanted to try other restaurants. Breakfast was good with a fair selection of items to choose from and again the service was very good and friendly. The location of this hotel is excellent - it is within easy walking distance of all the main tourists spots and the tram network. There are many restaurants and bars in the area to choose from. Overall we had an excellent break which was made better by our stay in the hotel. We would certainly return to this hotel if we were to re-visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay !”
Reviews.Author: cliffordius1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay at the hotel. What can I say ? The Tripadvisor reviews were correct as usual. Excellent location, friendly service, decent breakfast, smallish room, nice bathroom, awesome views from Imbat Restaurant and delicious food from there as well. All amenities provided as well- free wi-fi throughout, indoor pool, computers, printer, Skype headphone, luggage room for late departure, air-con, pub etc. The furnishings are slightly dated, but hey, it's not supposed to be a super-luxury hotel and I seriously doubt you could get better value for money. You certainly won't find a better location or nicer staff !!!! Wholeheartedly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel and restourant in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sezgin77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the 11th important place to see in Instanbul. Ith very good located with exellant restoarant and services.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location - the rooms are no good”
Reviews.Author: Danish_traveller2
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days at the hotel - with mixed feelings. The good things first. The level of service from the staff is EXTREMELY good - probably some of the most serviceminded and smiling staff I have ever met - and that means a lot. Further more the hotel is located very central - you are close to all main sights in Istanbull. And finally - the restaurant on the top-floor is very good!! But the rooms did not live up to our expectations. The rooms facing the street are both small and very noisy (e.g. the tram makes a lot of noise - all the way up to the 5th floor) and the draft from the windows are quite intense (why also the noise are not kept out). If you are situated in a room facing the back of the hotel - the rooms seems to be a little bigger, but a lot of them is just facing a wall, which make them very dark. So overall we were not satisfied with the room quality - but very happy about the people working there. If I was on business I would never stay there (no proper working facilities and to little sleep at night due to the noise) - but if on holiday (as we were) it is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Kelkhaz
Reviews.Content: We booked our 2 night trip here because it was rated #1 on TripAdvisor for places to stay with kids and it did not disappoint! I called the night before to ask about travel from the airport to the hotel and request an early check in. They recommended a car service for â‚¬25 and said a taxi would be â‚¬20 so we opted for the car because they also arranged for a car seat. When we arrived at the airport, the driver was incredibly friendly and we were really happy with the car service. When we arrived at the hotel, we were also thankful that the staff were able to accommodate our early check in as we got to the hotel at 8:30am. We had our 13 month old son with us and the staff were very warm and friendly. They made great restaurant recommendations and were very helpful. I would stay here again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ulla T
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Walking distance from main sights, tram line outside the door. The staff was very helpful and friendly. A hotel I will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the rooms are a little worn”
Reviews.Author: Turbofletch75
Reviews.Content: The staff and location are wonderful, but the rooms were VEY small and worn. We only stayed one night and moved to another hotel. The staff were very accomodating, so we felt kind of bad for leaving early, but we were glad we did once we arrived at the next hotel. Great view from the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Makes your staying unforgettable!!”
Reviews.Author: emiljano k
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Orient express for 4 nights, and i can say that it is the best hotel i have stayed so far. The staff was so friendly and caring and also they created you a lot of comfort and support in terms of visiting best places in Istanbul. I would suggest to everyone to stay at this hotel if you want to have an unforgettable staying in Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Travelbecause
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express Oct. 2011 for a week. The other reviews were correct. The staff are so warm and friendly and really go out of their way to accomodate you. Upon arrival, there was a lovley candy dish on the bed filled with Turkish Delight. Yum! I was up early a few days and they would go over and start the pc in the little bar as soon as they would see me coming. The restaurant was such a nice retreat. One afternoon we had it all to ourselves. Hard to imagine in a city of 15 million people. It was a warm sunny day and they brought an umbrella over and we just sat there, ate meza, drank wine and enjoyed the view of the Bosphorus. One day I arrived bacak and aske where the afternoon tea was. My mistake, they didn't have one. I thought I had seem one on the website. Well, I had and that evening the desk staff made sure to let me know that it was one of the sister hotels and that they wold call whenever I wanted to go. They really went above and beyond. The location is great. Right on the tram line and midway between the Blue Mosque and the harbor. Everyplace was walkable from that point. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cinzia03
Reviews.Content: We went to Istambul for my birthday, and the hotel was my partner's present to me. And making me happy it is not easy task ... ;) but he successed! My first priority is always the location of the place where we are staying, and the Orient Express is the most beautiful hotel so near to everything! And I mean, everything! The reception is always staffed excellently, and additionally there is a nice lady who can give you advise on various excursions in many languages. We did not go to swimming pool, so we can't comment on that. As for some comments about the noise, we were at the 5th floor, so the noise did not really reach us. The bar on the ground floor is really quiet and pretty. Management noticed that it was my birthday during our stay, and presented me with a gift on the day - very appreciated. Finally, the view from the roof top is of course exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “great service, handy location”
Reviews.Author: Frances R
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express is a very warm, welcoming hotel where the staff really make you feel at home. I stayed there then came back a couple of weeks later to be welcomed like an old friend. It really makes a difference in a large city like Istanbul. The restaurant is amazing value for such beautiful food and such a great view. The hotel is convenient to most places, being on the tram line and right by Topkapi Palace. You are greeted to your room with a container of turkish delight and a letter telling you how important it is that you are happy while staying there. Despite being on a busy street, it never seemed noisy in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: Coming to Istanbul can be slightly unnerving when you don't know prices, places etc. But we got lots of good advice from the staff. Very friendly and helpful. The restaurant on the roof is really quite exceptional, wonderful food, great views over the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an exceptional hotel you will not forget.”
Reviews.Author: jduford
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I decided on this hotel because of the location and great reviews. Thinking that it is a lot of hype I was not ready for such first class service and attention to detail in a hotel that was in my price range. From first entering the hotel everything was 5 star. The front desk clerk was ready to explain the city and when I informed him I had been traveling for over 24 hours, offered me a beverage and told me to relax, see my room and come down when I was ready and he would give me all the details of the hotel, area and sites. I have stayed at hotels worldwide and had what I would call artificial care and concern, the Orient Express staff were an exception with every need anticipated, an honest smile and greeting from everyone in the hotel and willingness to help with anything from dining choices and daily activities. One thing I will never forget, and have already e mailed friends about was an incident where I had commented about the juice at the morning buffet in a casual conversation with the front desk staff, the following morning a tall cold fresh squeezed oj was at my table, when I asked how they knew, they told me they had my picture and preference noted. They had my picture from when they took a copy of my passport, and were there to make my stay memorable.......it sure was. The buffet has enough selections to make anyone more than happy, from a rack with a fresh honeycomb to cut a piece from, to the flaky breakfast pastries. The morning newsletter with breakfast was a nice touch with weather, suggestions on activities and Turkish facts. The breakfast staff is also excellent and there to get you whatever you may want. The bartender in the lobby bar could keep you in there all night with his smile and personality. Fresh flowers on the towels laid on the bed each day, cleaner than my own home, I would like to get that housekeeper to take care of my place at home. Turkish delights in the room daily, slippers, coffee and water in the room, more than I expected. I will be staying here when I return to Istanbul, and this hotel has made it a place I want to come back to. My only complaint is that this hotel group does not have hotels in other cities because I would use them exclusively. Make sure to visit the Red River Saloon, also owned by the same group for comfortable dining, and drinks in an atmosphere more like your local pub at home than miles away. The staff in the saloon is also great and will keep you stoping by more than once if even for an afternoon cappachino or a few beers. More places in the hospitality industry should take example from the Sirkeci Group.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and great location!”
Reviews.Author: KH_ETSU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Orient Express Hotel for three nights on our first trip to Turkey & Istanbul. We were very much satisfied and pleased by the level of service and hospitable attitudes of the staff at the hotel. When we changed our flight from Izmir to earlier one, thanks to Turkish Airline, we were impressed by the promptness & attentiveness of the hotel's re-organizing the airport shuttle service. The good supply of hot water in our bathroom was also impressive. It would be particularly appealing to Japanese guests, like us, who tend to love hot water bathing at the end of each day. The wireless internet connection was good enough, although it might be more reliable if the signal strength is higher. Unfortunately, rooms were not very spacious, but the size should be more or less standard in old sector in Istanbul and we did not bother it. The hotel location is great. It has convenient walking access to most notable places in old sector of Istanbul, as well as Sirkeci station, the corner stone of nostalgic Orient Express. It is also close to Eminonu ferry harbor, where you can get easy & nice access by ferry boats, letting you enjoy nice sea breeze, to places around "Golden Horn" and towns on the Asian side. Another great benefit we found from the hotel's proximity to Eminonu harbor was it enabled us very easily to purchase & re-charge "Istanbul Card", which gave us pass to every public transportation in Istanbul. In fact, thanks to the card, we did not have to use taxi at all but still moved around in the city very efficiently. We traveled a lot around the world both on business and private occasions, and definitely find this hotel as one of our best choices. We will not hesitate to choose it at our next chance to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Roger C
Reviews.Content: Just been for another visit to Istanbul and for the second time stayed at the Orient Express. Definitely my preferred hotel in the city. The hotel itself is extrememly good with very pleasant and helpful staff, good and clean rooms and an excellent buffet breakfast with a large choice. The rooftop restaurant has great views over the Bosphorus. The other restaurants belonging to the same group of hotels, all nearby, also serve lovely food of various Turkish varieties. The Orient Express is very well situated, being on the tram route close to Sirkeci station, and so makes an excellent base from which to explore all the areas of this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Welcoming, excellent facilities, great location”
Reviews.Author: S W
Reviews.Content: Orient Express Hotel Sirkeci is excellent - staff are warm and welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. With such good facilities in the hotel, including the roof top terrace restaurant, great food and well appointed room together with its fantastic position in the heart of the Sirkeci area of Istanbul, we have had the most wonderful holiday and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: We had just completed a 15 day tour of Turkey staying at large named hotels but none had the warmth and friendly atmosphere that we experienced at OEH. Location is key as that is very difficult to change and it's proximity to the important sites is fantastic plus being on the tram route to the other side of town. Hospitality - well the named places could learn a lot from the team at OEH. Lori was our first contact and her warmth and friendliness was without peer, plus her sincerity for our stay to be enjoyable, not to mention her local knowledge, Lori had plenty of helpful tips and suggestions so as to maximise our time in Istanbul. The hotel lobby, bar and restaurant were clean and well presented as was our room - complete with Turkish Delight. Our member of the housekeeping staff was only too pleased to be of assistance and was most helpful and accommodating during our stay, as was every member of the staff that we dealt with. If and when we return to Istanbul, this is where we will be - not at the Conrad our previous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Reensx
Reviews.Content: We had been upgraded to here as our booked hotel (Hotel Ilkay) had a leak at no extra charge! We took a bus (E10) from outside the airport to the port, then a ferry was 2TL each and walked 15 minutes to the hotel, I'm sure there are easier ways to get there but were young and cheap ;) We stayed for 4 nights and were shown to our room, bed was nice and big and not 2 single's stuck together! The rooms are small but they are clean and enough for a city break and comfortable for when you get back from a long day sightseeing. There was also a nice dish of turkish delight waiting for us which was a nice touch. Rooms were cleaned each day and the rooms have a tv, fridge, hairdryer, some toiletries & wireless internet. The internet wasn't the best, dropped a lot. I'd say the hotel is in the perfect location for a trip to Istanbul. It is close to all the main sites and in the middle of lots of shops and things to see. Breakfast was very nice and lots to choose from and changes each day. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the prices were reasonable and there was nice views. We didn't experience any personal attention but saw it was someone's birthday and they had arranged a cake for her and gave guests nearby a slice. We enjoyed our stay and would return if visiting Istanbul again :)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful exemplar of Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: N T
Reviews.Content: The high levels of service offered by the friendly, polite and caring staff at this excellently placed hotel transformed our stay there from more than just a place to stay, but rather a place that we looked forward to retreating to at the end of the day. Nothing was too much trouble and we both felt that staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was as pleasamt and comfortable as possible. Our room, although it did not provide the best view, was spotlessly clean with a great shower to ease tired muscles at the end of a days sightseeing. We ate in the roof-top restaurant on the first night (again brilliant service) enjoying delicious food with great views. Location wise it was also spot-on, being both within easy walking distance of the Old City sights and also the Bosphorus with the potential to take boat/ferry trips to the European quarter and Asian side. I hope to return to Istanbul one day and to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best - perfekte Gastfreundschaft”
Reviews.Author: wenckebach
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in the very middle of almost everything you might want to see in Istanbul, optimal connected to the main sights, very short way to public transport. Hotel itself is nice, well maintained, breakfast absolutely satisfying. Nice indoor pool to relax after the sightseeing walks. But what really makes the stay in this hotel an excellent experience are the people working there: I have never ever met so helpful, nice, willing and friendly staff in any hotel I have been. The warm welcome with all necessary information in a personal talk (not in the usual leaflets) is a good example of what the staff provides: Personal assistance and a hospitality that is often promised in hotels but seldomly seen. If you want to feel at home in a fascinating but loud city: Stay in this house!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good customer service”
Reviews.Author: gobluego
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Orient Express Hotel. The service was quite good, with a concierge dedicated to emailing me detailed directions from the airport and sitting me down with a map and offering me info and advice when I arrived. She even emailed me after I had left Istanbul to make sure I had a good stay. Further, the staff was kind enough to make available a breakfast for me when I got in just after the breakfast had ended. The front desk crew and tech guy graciously helped me figure out how to work the tv remote and the front desk quickly accommodated my late night request for a new room when the one on the lower floor facing the street proved to be far too noisy for me. The doorman/bellhop made sure to get the door for me as often as possible and always had a warm greeting. In terms of location, it is right by the Gulhane tram stop, a very convenient place to be for close proximity to the ferries, the mosques and other tourist spots. The drawback to that is that the tram comes along regularly right in front of the hotel and you can hear it, horn honking and all, from your guest room if you face the street. The call to prayer is also pretty loud but maybe if you are used to hearing it at the wee hours of the morning, then it isn't so bad. The breakfast was okay, comprised of some fruit and some cheese and bread. A typical Turkish breakfast. The towels were nice and thick and big although the shower/bathroom was a bit cramped. A fridge is located in the room, however you are asked to sign a form that says you won't bring any food into the hotel. Also, you must sign that you will not bring any people in to the room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: LalaClare
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are so friendly and helpful! we really enjoyed out stay. The rooms are perhaps a little small, but comfortable and clean, and it's not like you will spend an awful lot of time in there when there is so much exploring to do! The roof top restaurant has nice views and the food is good. there is a tram station close by and the hotel is in walking distance of lots of attractions. would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RFHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orient Express for four nights with my 8 year old son. We had a big nice room and were very happy with the service at the hotel. Everyone was very nice and helpful. They even had a car to pick us up at the airport. It proved to be really nice as our flight arrived quite late in the evening. The hotel is well located in the old town and seems to be kept very clean. We ate two times at the restaurant and liked it, too. When my son didn't like the adult food he had ordered he was served a new "child meal" without extra charge which I thought was really kind. My son enjoyed the pool as well. We had a really nice time in Turkey and at the Orient Express and would certainly like to visit both again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - just as good!”
Reviews.Author: Dohfar
Reviews.Content: I don't usually send in a second review if I return to a hotel, but the Orient Express Hotel is such a great place I decided to make an exception. At first it seems like a fairly standard mid-range city hotel, with small but clean and comfortable rooms. What really sets it apart from other hotels I've experienced is the friendliness and care shown by all the staff. This was evident from the moment we arrived in Istanbul, as the hotel sent a driver to meet us at the airport. Then when we got to the hotel we were welcomed with a glass of cay (tea) and an interesting briefing on what there is to do in Istanbul. Throughout the stay everyone we came into contact with - reception staff, chambermaids, waiters etc - did everything they could to make our stay as good as possible. For example, there was a trivial mix-up over a restaurant booking. At most hotels in my own country (England) the staff would probably just have shrugged their shoulders and mumbled an apology. But here the staff seemed genuinely to care and made a huge effort to rectify the problem immediately, and next day the issue was followed up vigorously by hotel management. As well as the great service, the hotel has a fine location in a busy and interesting street, the breakfasts were good and there is a top-notch restaurant (Imbat) on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “The Cameron's”
Reviews.Author: Barriebernie
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and value for money - We recently visited Istanbul and stayed at this Hotel. We took our OAP with us and the hotel staff did everything to make them and ourselves confortable. Lori met us and spent some time explaining the necessary about the hotel and Istanbul to us. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and accommodating in every possible way, always smiling. The hotl is ideally situated and just a short walk to the Spice Bazaar and other attractions and one change from the airport by tram. The tram stops just 1 block from the hotel. The breakfast was great and a huge variety to chose from. The locals were all friendly and kind and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We intend to return to Istanbul as 3 days was not enough time to see what we wanted to and we will certainly return to this hotel. Thank you everyone for making our stay pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: Where else in the world could you receive a bowl of turkish delight on your bed (it was replenished each day). The other thing I appreciated was having a sheet and cotton blanket on the bed - the weather was quite warm, and that was more than sufficient for me. I find doonas of almost any thickness far too warm in a climate like that. Very comfortable, very pleasant and helpful staff. Great location, and the roof top restaurant was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: papalovesraki
Reviews.Content: Thebest location, near all historic sights and communications. Very warm and welcoming staff that greets all guest with a big smile. Small but clean rooms. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location/good service”
Reviews.Author: pg2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walkable to lots of sites and very convenient to the tram. The personnel are friendly and the breakfasts buffets are delicious. Room size is smallish as you would expect in Europe but spotlessly clean which is more important (at least to me). One of the nicest features of the hotel is their rooftop restaurant which is good value and has beautiful view at night.....we are normally not tourists who eat in hotel restaurants yet we ate there twice. All in all, a great choice for your stay!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: matahari0000
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location, is close to all historic sights, short walk to Topkapi palace. This is very nice hotel with friendly and available staff. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. Breakfast was delicious and varied every day. Great place and i will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for us. I walk with a cane so we wanted to be close to everything and it was a short walk or tram ride to all of the most important sites. The room on the back side was very quiet which was what I wanted. When I was working, I stayed in many of the most expensive hotels in Europe and never had a cleaner room or better service from the staff. The breakfast was very good and was really a brunch as it had so many different items. We enjoyed the dinner and the beautiful view from the roof-top restaurant and thought the pool was great. I would be happy to stay there again and would like to thank the staff for making our trip so special!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, welcoming so I'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Halah A
Reviews.Content: We went on a family holiday to Istanbul and chose this hotel. It was fantastic and the rooms are a good size and we were given complimentary turkish delight. The staff were very welcoming and held a suprise birthday party for my sister as they found out her birthday from her passport; it was very thoughtful. We were also given a lot of information about the tourist sites from the staff which really helped us get the most out of our experience. The hotel made the trip to turkey a fantastic, relaxed and easy experience!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Zainab A
Reviews.Content: Orient Express is a beautiful hotel and all the members of staff were very friendly. My family and I felt very well looked after. During the holiday it was my birthday and the hotel gave me a birthday present and a birthday cake; they were very kind. The hotel itself has an excellent location with it being close to Topkapi palace and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is also very close to a metro station making transport around the city easy. The rooms in the hotel were very clean and the beds were comfortable to sleep in. The television had a wide variety of channels and the air conditioning was powerful and kept the room cool. The restaurant on the roof had delicious food and a beautiful view. At breakfast in the morning there was a large range of different foods catering to all tastes. Overall, the hotel was excellent and if I return to Istanbul I would definitely stay in the Orient Express again!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay for several days”
Reviews.Author: Anna K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel for three days only. I should say that I was surpriced by the reception and attitude of the hotel personnel. They are very well-wishing, honest and sincere, which is in opposite to that I saw in Antalia region. Regardless only three days (two nights) stay I have been congratulated with my birthday (while in Italy and Bali even with two weeks stay, nobody paid attention to my birthday and the fact that my husband and I were honeymooners). The rooms are clean, a bit small, but agreeable. For longer stay I would suggest to book the larger room. Breakfast was qiute good. I was well surprised by Turkish delight and fresh honey in the comb. The hotel is good located, 5 to 10 min walk from the key attractions. In general, I would say it was "value-for-money".

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the hospitality and we love this hotel , we'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: Zauberer C
Reviews.Content: This most I like this hotel : - extremely convenience, it is right at the center of main street. Very easy get around the city even by walk . - I remember upon my arrival, the manager immediate explain to us where is worth to visit - very care their customers, when I check out and found the camera case missing. The manager try all the ways to find for us, since we check out already and other customer already in the room, They can't get in the room, The manager promise to check out the room for us .This is the most I appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: AusTravellers7
Reviews.Content: Have just left the Orient Express Hotel. Very impressed. We had a rear room on the sixth floor. No real outlook but that is not necessary. Rooms are a little small but very clean with a very good bathroom. All facilities are there including tea and coffee. Breakfast was served until 11.00 am. Choice and quality astonishing. Best feature was the staff. Uniformly polite and very helpful. Good rooftop restaurant as well when price is taken into account it is difficult to imagine doing better

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect services, in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Fr D
Reviews.Content: Orient Express hotel is perfectly located (near the tramway, with an easy connection to the airport). From the hotel, the visit of the city is very easy, since most monuments are accessible either by foot or by tram. The staff is very dedicated and eager to provide an excellent service. We had a dinner in the restaurant, which has a splendid view over the city. The service was very quick and the price was reasonable. The only disappointment refer to the swimming pool, because of the too high percentage of chlore, so that we could not stay more than 10 minutes. For a reasonable price, the hotel provides a bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: Psnaporaz
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews stated, this is a great place to stay in Istanbul, with very helpful staff, nice rooms and breakfast. From what I could gather, the location is simply the best in town, within walking distance to the major sites and the ferry station, essential to get around. On top of it all, it has a fantastic restaurant on the roof, with very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at a spendid location with a very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Emmen188557
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orient Express is located in the old city in the vicinity of most places of interest. It even has a small swimming pool in the cellar. Very friendly staff. It was a pleasure staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff and best terrace restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: ripnruth
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 teenage kids. We stayed for 3 nights and found the Orient Express a jewel of a hotel. For the price the rooms were fine, always clean and very quiet despite overlooking a busy street. There is a gorgeous rooftop terrace restaurant overlooking the Bosphorous with superb and relatively cheap dishes - rare for a hotel restaurant. The most outstanding feature though were the staff - they sat us down on arrival and talked us through the sights and places to go, they had humour, and an attention to friendly service which was outstanding. I have not bothered to write a review ever before so this is an indication of how good we found the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: guy2600
Reviews.Content: I stayd here with my girlfriend for 3 days while visiting Istanbul. Room was clean and quiet. The shower did leak when using but it was a minor inconvenience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The biggest plus of this hotel was the location. EVERYTHING was within walking distance - Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand & Spice bazaar etc. Location is safe on a street with great restaurants and public transportation. I would stay here again. A few tips: skip the bosphorus boat ride or at least save it for last on the list (nothing noteworthy), Aya Sophia is a must, contrary to what the guide books say, Spice Market is better than the Grand Bazaar. If you find something you love, buy it. I found a great wall hanging but held off because I thought I'd find it cheaper in the smaller towns. I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: “What a super hotel!!! Very nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Pat1960
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with HOSPITALITY choose the Orient Express Hotel. The staff is very nice: from the roommaid till the receptionist till the waiter and waitresses from restaurant. They all give a very good service. The swimmingpool is an extra bonus fot the hotel. The restaurant on the roof is super!! Very good meals. The hotel is in one word SUPER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted. Good service.”
Reviews.Author: pcwbangkok
Reviews.Content: This was the first of a series of "non-big name brand" hotels we asked our travel agent to book for us on a two-week trip from Istanbul to Vienna. The Orient Express fitted our requirements precisely: it was well located for "playing tourists"; it was comfortable with simple, clean rooms; the pricing was reasonable. The most important reason we would recommend it to others was the service: we were very pleasantly surprised by the way requests were handled. Even when front-office staff members were struggling a little with English, they still sorted things out. And here's the really pleasing thing: the staff were experienced enough to anticipate as in "if you want to do this, then you need to consider that..." OK so one has to consider a couple of quibbles: breakfast in the a dingy basement -- well, that's normal in small city hotels -- but dreadful coffee (please invest in a proper coffee machine); second, the maintenance staff need to watch the chlorine/chemical levels in the small swimming pool: they were far too high on one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with first class service”
Reviews.Author: Bill T
Reviews.Content: This was a first class holiday experience. My wife and I enjoyed the hotel and the city of Istanbul enormously. The location of the hotel was superb for all the main sites. The roof terrace restaurant overlooking the Bosporus has to be seen to be believed and the overall experience was one of very great pleasure. We were looked after extremely well by the hotel staff and customer relations. On departure we were given a complimentary box of Turkish Delight which was a very nice thought. We were also contacted after leaving the hotel to check we had arrived safely at our next destination. Wewould very highly recommend this hotel to other travellors and very much hope to return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First rate service”
Reviews.Author: sanrafa2
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a modest hotel, small but comfortable, with an excellent location. What makes this hotel stand out from the rest is the service. It is a five star hotel when it comes to service. Everyone from the waiters, front desk, breakfast waitresses, etc are truly professional in the way they treat you. You will feel welcome and will be treated like a king. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rogerluck
Reviews.Content: Well-located and comfortable. The staff were delightful, warm and friendly. The room was cleaned every day. The weather was really hot so the pool was very welcome. You will not be disappointed with the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Puthar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Hagia Sophia (walking distance). A tram stop is 100m from the hotel. The street of the hotel is full of shops and there are plenty of restaurants all around. The welcome was very cordial ; they offered us a drink and a very pleasant young woman gave us all information about the hotel and also about the city. We found that our room was small so we requested another room. The receptionist was very understanding and helpful. The next morning he proposed us a room more according to our expectations. Everything was done with a great sense of service and hospitality. In fact, the rooms are small, due to the fact that Istanbul is an old city and so are the buildings in this area. But it is very clean. The matttress and pillow are very comfortable. The breakfast is average, but the coffee is excellent ! The dinner can be served on the terrace on the roof : the view is beautiful, the food is more than excellent and the service is very friendly and efficient. If we go back to Istanbul we will definitely choose this hotel : it is a place where you feel very much at ease, where people are doing their job with heart and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed Orient Express Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: IoanaBeatrice
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice hotel and very good services. It was really a pleasure to stay at Orient Express Hotel in Istanbul. Placed in the heart pf Sultanahmet area, very close to main attractions and very close to the Galata bridge. The reception personnel was very helpful and if you need some information (like very to eat, how to reach specific destinations) they are very happy to help you. We will come back at Orient Express Hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Pekka56
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at Orient Express Hotel in Istanbul . We enjoyed the good service very much. The location is excellent when visiting Istanbul as a tourist who wants to see the most interesting places. We selected this hotel due to its location and as it reminded us of our fantastic Orient Express Train trip from London to Venice ten years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Many plus points, can overlook big minus”
Reviews.Author: leevidaga
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Group, owner of this hotel and others in the area, knows the drawback of this property. You will know it right away after you check in - the small rooms, it reminded us of cabins on ships. But you have to give Sirkeci credit for going out of its way to make up to the guests. The staff will do everything in order to please. There is free and powerful wi-fi everywhere. My husband was especially appreciative of the cold air conditioning system, which makes a relieving difference after being out in the summer heat. The high quality, but reasonable, roof top restaurant Imbat offers very good food, the best views, AND 10% discount to guests (as does all the other very good restaurants in the group). The management takes pain to survey customers opinions during breakfast time. All these are signs that customers are treated seriously for parting their money with Oriental Express.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Orient Express”
Reviews.Author: rcmreichert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orient Express for a week while visiting Istanbul and surrounding areas. The location was great, within walking distance of many popular sites, and with very easy access to the tram system. the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The room was a bit small, but we were there to see Istanbul, not our hotel room! The breakfast was great, with lots of choices, and we enjoyed two delicious meals on the terrace. Big plus...the staff noted that my husband's birthday was the day after we arrived and left a very nice gift in our room. He was very pleased. They also allowed for an early checkin (at no additional charge), as our flight arrived at 5:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OhRobbo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in Serkeci. It is one minutes walk from the Gulhane tram stop, about 10 minutes wak from Haghia Sophia, 15 minutes from the Blue Mosque, and about 20 minutes from the Grand Bizarr. There are plenty of restaurants within a couple of minutes walk and a shop opposite which sells bottled water. Upon arrival a member of staff gives you an overview of Istanbul and of how to get around. This is NOT a sales talk and is very useful, they also bring you a glass of apple tea which is very welcome after travelling! All of the staff were very friendly and spoke good English. The size of our room wasn't massive but it was clean and comfortable. We stayed around the back of the hotel, the tram line runs outside the front of the hotel so that may be noisy for some of the lower floor rooms. There is free wifi on every floor. We used the room service a couple of times - it is very reasonably priced (cheaper than going out!) and is very tasty! The pool isn't massive but is perfectly adequate for a dip to cool down (lockers and towels are provide). Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel within in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: hareends
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights with my girlfriend and it was a pleasant stay. We took public transport from Sabiha Gokcen airport as a cab would have cost us 100YTL. We spent 12YTL each for bus E-011 to take us to Taksim Square. We used the funicular railway costing 1.75YTL each to Kabatas then the tram to Gulhane costing another 1.75YTL each. The hotel is a 2 minute walk back in the same direction you come from. The hotel is in amazing location, within in walking distance of all the important historical sites such as The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia & Topkapi Palace. The reception staff are very friendly and always willing to help with any queries. We were given a city map on arrival with a brief about what to see. I do recommend buying yourself a guidebook as it will help with where to go to eat good food at cheap prices. We were slightly disappointed with the size of the room, very small with a small wardrobe which meant most of our clothes stayed in our suitcases. The saving grace was that we had an air conditioned room and we had a small dish of Turkish Delight waiting for us on the bed. It was slightly noisy as our room was facing the main road and the tram runs until midnight, but it is not bad at all as the windows are double glazed. Another helpful aspect was the free wi-fi available on each floor which was very fast. The breakfast was plentiful and lovely we had a small leaflet on each table detailing what was happening in the city that day and helpfully what was closed. I would recommend having dinner in the terrace restaurant which overlooks the blue mosque, which is beautiful at night. Overall this hotel was very good being a 3 star hotel rather than a 5 star hotel which made our stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We all loved our hotel staff and were feeling at home.”
Reviews.Author: ahmedaahakim
Reviews.Content: The staff were extreemly friendly and professional, they guided us perfectly and efficiently and saved us alot of money. The hotel is very clean and well organized, pool is relaxing and the food was really amazing and delicious in the terrace. But, rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: caoli
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful terrace viewing the Bosphorus, meals are quite delicious and most of all workers are really nice, helpful are hospitable.I really enjoy time I spent there especially, my birthday celebration with my friends at the terrace restaurant Imbat.I will always keep their birthday present as a memoir in my cabinet.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Freedom3187
Reviews.Content: Loved the place, we felt safe and comfortable. The view from the rood top restaurant is stunning (one of the best views to dine with) the food very good and great value. This hotel was booked as part of a tour and I expectedit to be basic but far from it. Location is great and tram almost at the door, can walk everywhere. Rooms are a bit small but well appointed. Couple from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Brian-Sue
Reviews.Content: A central hotel so the rooms were a bit small but were very clean and all with en-suite facilities. The rooftop restaurant had stunning views and the food was a very high quality and good value. On our last night we were caught up in an incident in the city - the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful or accommodating in assisting in our "recuperation" even though they were in no way responsible. Good variety of hot and cold Turkish food for complimentary breakfast with free daily newsletter of what was open/closed that day. English language newspaper available. Free internet access and printer. Free pool and fitness centre, with inexpensive treatments and massage bookable. Clean decor with "Orient Express" themed posters and artefacts on display. Desk staff (24/7) would phone to make reservations at restaurants, arrange trips and book taxis on request for no charge; all spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: DominiquePhilippe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights with our adult children. Great location to visit, between St Sophia and Bosphorus. Kind and helpful staff. Clean rooms, a bit small like most hotels in this area. Imbat restaurant is great, amazing value for money, beautiful view. Belgian family.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all my boxes”
Reviews.Author: Tyketourist
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of Blue Mosque and Sophia, as well as docks makes it an excellent location for the first time traveller, which we were. The hotel staff are superb ambassadors for Turkey and it people, being very friendly and knowledgable about the City. I needed a Bilitex office and was given exacting directions which were so eaqsy to follow. Tickets were for concert at ICEC and we were advised by staff to set off early bt taxi. Thankfully we did, as it took one and a quarter hours in the evening rush hour for the normally 10 min journey. My birthday meal was in the terrace restaurant, and the meal was excellent, followed by a cake and a birthday song from the staff. Our room was on the third floor of seven, but with two lifts we never had to wait. Just down the street a few metres is the Red River Cafe, where we had good value lunches and light evening suppers. Took a 10lira a head tour of the two Bosphorous Bridges, but without commentary., which was not really necessary anyway. Would we go back? Definately.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: kandySydney
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Orient Express. The rooms were charming and very comfortable, the breakfasts were generous and healthy, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Lunch on the terrace at the hotel restaurant was a highlight and the swimming pool is a great advantage. The hotel is conveniently located to all the most popular sites. I'll certainly stay here when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nobel Price for Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: NetherlandsBacchus
Reviews.Content: Hundreds of tripadvisor praising comments made us choose for this hotel. Yet, experience surpassed our expectations. Indeed, excellent location, small but comfortable bedrooms, generous reception, five star breakfast, a fabulous restaurant. But most of all: exceptional hospitality. The Imbat rooftop restaurant is worth a detour. It is many years ago we experienced such a dedicated, professional, yet friendly and helpful staff. Serving original and very tasty Turkish dishes, with superb Turkish wines from all over the country, many of them using authentic Turkish grapes like the emir, sultanye, bogaskere etc grapes - a most surprising treat to any connaisseur. And at very affordable price. We found the restaurant so good that we took dinner 5 out of 7 days stay, it became a real wine tasting experience as we never had it. The staff became warm friends who never imposed themselves but were always available. Meanwhile enjoying the beautiful views of Topkapi, the Bosphorus and the Golden Horn. Eventually, there was now and then a little present around, a glass of sparkling, a plate of fruits, turkish delight... No matter the little attentions. Our memory will retain the warm and generous people, carriers of ages of oriental hospitality and a great civilisation. We therefore move the candidature of the Orient Express Hotel for the Nobel Price of Hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Just an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacwilliams11
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in. Beatiful ambience. Restaurant on the roof terrace spectacular. We had a very warm welcome from all the staff who went out of their way to make our stay so special. All the sights are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Warm fuzzies!”
Reviews.Author: arabants
Reviews.Content: We arrived, somewhat wearied from an overnight train journey from Bulgaria, and emerged from Serkeci station into the noise and busyness of a day in the life of Istanbul! We had a short walk to the Orient Express hotel which, at first, was unassuming in revealing it's whereabouts but, once found, not forgotten. It was delightful to enter into the small but peaceful ( at the time anyway ) lobby and be warmly greated by the staff and immediately attended to. Our bags were organised to go up to our room and Meric welcomed and seated us and, with the first of our Turkish apple teas in tow, provided information on the local places to visit, how to get there etc and happily answered our immediate questions. For the duartion of our 3 day stay we were impressed and appreciative of the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff and the general atmosphere and decor of this older but charming place. Our room, though not large, was adequate in size, clean and comfortable. Loved the welcoming covered dish, resting on one of the beds, that contained a selection of Turkish Delight! We appreciated the well stocked bar fridge even though I think it was only the water we used. Also the in room tea and coffee making facility. (Throughout our subsequent travel, we found that this is not always available.) Given that our room overlooked the street we accepted that there was going to be some noise until the trams stopped running at around midnight so if you are desperate for sleep you might want to try and get a quieter room. My sister found her mattress a bit too firm but subsequently encountered that elsewhere too. The rooftop restaurant had a great view over the harbour and city and the food was well prepared and presented.The chef and manager even invited constructive critique to improve the dining experience. I did find a couple of the dishes a little too salty but enjoyed everything apart from that. Breakfast, downstairs, was plentiful and a good start to the day. The hotel is a central location with easy walk or transport to places of interest. Was good to have internet that worked. This hotel seemed very popular with returning guests.We enjoyed our stay, very much and would also return again. Highly recommended. Thank you to all the staff !

Reviews.Title: “"Very Accessible to Many Tourist Spots"”
Reviews.Author: seph68
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, staffs were helpfull. It was our first trip to Istanbul to celebrate our 10th year wedding anniversary, Ms. Meric helped us to make it especial. We asked for slippers, Mr. Jihad provided us immediately two pairs. One day we went out while the rains started to drizzle, Mr. Alih had given us umbrella unfortunately we lost it somewhere, since the rain had stopped it made our time busy catching views and taking photos forgetting the umbrella... on our check - out we thought we are going to be charged for that, amazingly no! We even received good deals with our wedding anniversary package, due to some slight problems that can be passed, no big issue at all. Meaning Orient Express Hotel management and staff really know how to satisfy their guests and know when to bend and stretch their rules and regulations not to the extent of sacrificing the standard of the hotel... they are really flexible! Room is really clean, bathroom, drapries and towels. I know because my wife can easily feel itchy and as if something is crawling all over her body if the bed, linen and etc. are not clean.. but she did not experience that. Well some says the room is small, for us it was ok! LOCATION of the hotel is no.1 for us, we did not even bother to ride taxi to reach historical places. It is easy to locate areas coming from the hotel. Tram station is very near so no hassle at all when we went to Taksim and to the airport when we came home. Amenities are normal, besides we went there not for the amenities but just to have a secure and comfortable place to rest. My wife and I liked all in the Orient Express Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Jorgen036
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the first time during the weekend April 29 â€“ May 2. It is a great city. The Orient Express Hotel did our time even more enjoyable. All the staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The location was in the centre of the major tourist attractions. Our room was on the 7th floor with a view of the Bosphorus. We would without hesitation recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “we would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: metmig
Reviews.Content: Hello, we had a short city-trip in Istanbul for 4 days. We were in Istanbul for the first time, and it was a great experience!! The Orient Express Hotel is a great hotel with very very nice staff, good rooms,good breakfast and in the centerof all the highlights! We could arrange the transfer from the airport v.v. by e-mailing the hotel. The swimming-pool in the hotel is very clean and nice! We recommend a dinner in the hotel-restaurant: very nice food end a great vieuw. We would really stay there a second time. Greetings to all the staff, the lady who cleaned our room, and our taxi-driver!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed and warmly received”
Reviews.Author: Lin39
Reviews.Content: The location was very good for accessing the places we wanted to visit. The rooms were pleasant and the facilities adequate.All the staff were attentive and helpful and the roof restaurant was extremely good. The swimming pool in the basement was pleasant but there were some slippery areas near the changing room where caution was needed. We would be very happy to recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: Manzain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is themed on the famous Orient Express, although the rooms are a bit small you can not beat the location and its hospitality. Our room was on the 7th floor with a view of the Bosphorus The staff are very friendly and helpful and give good honest advice. The buffet breakfast has ample choice and the restaurant on the rooftop is exceptional. We had dinners on two occasions and found it a great eating experience, the food was excellent. It gets very busy and you need to reserve a table in advance. I would most certainly return and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as one of the best places I have stayed in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We were very well looked after”
Reviews.Author: JakefromLondon
Reviews.Content: The service here is excellent. The fact that you are given a note with the mobile number of the owner and told to call him personally if you have problems reflects on how well run this hotel is. Superb location, especially if you arrive by train as we did. The rooms are not that special and we didn't have a view but it didn't matter: in Istanbul you are out all the time or just relaxing when back at the hotel. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Twig
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in the heart of the old part of the city. The major sites are walking distance, and the trams and ferries make everywhere else easy to reach. The rooms are small, with very little storage space. I used the two tiny drawers and the wardrobe and my husband left his things in his suitcase. If you were staying for more than a few days it would be a problem. I found the bed rather hard on the first night, but then got used to it. The duvet was also small, so unfortunately my husband spent most nights feeling cold, as I apparently pull the duvet! The shower room was clean, and functional, but didn't have a bath, which might bother some people. The breakfast was good, with plenty of choices, especially the cheeses and cold meats and the fresh bread. Pity they choose to use awful fruit juice.
