We started each day with a swim in the pool, which was small, but very clean. The hotel does have a computer in a small room near reception if you don't have your own internet access. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, and their English was good. I'm very pleased we decided to stay in the old part of the city, we went over to Taksim, but didn't really like it. The hotels in the old city are obviously fairly small, and have to adapt themselves to the demands of the 21st century, and there have to be some compromises, but overall I think this hotel does it's best to provide everything it can for it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HJ_Korea
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5nights at this hotel and it was perfect. The room was absolutely clean and has good condition. Also the location was perfect(between Gulhane and Eminonu) and all staffs were friendly and helpful. I was very impressed their great hospitality and kind consideration. If I can visit Istanbul agin, I definitely will stay Orient Express Hotel agin. P.S: I also visited â€œImbat Restaurantâ€� which is located at top floor of the hotel, the view from there was good and food were very delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel location, with Great Staff, what else you need”
Reviews.Author: ferasroumani
Reviews.Content: I was told about this hotel by one of my friend. The location of the hotel is just great, in the middle of Sultanahmet destrict, and very close to the Tramway station, and 5 minutes walking to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The area nearby is just historical and lovely. The staff is very helpfull, and will not hesitate to provide you with all information required, and will even help you in getting tours. Rooms are clean, and really they did not miss any single thing. The hotel provides great Turkish breakfast. You try it and will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: dinsie
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the location because this was my main concern when I was going to Istanbul - Sultanahmet vs. Taksim. I am SO glad we stayed here because the hotel is walking distance to all the touristic locations, and the tram is literally on the doorstep. Taxis are very frequence, and the train is also a 2 minute walk (which we took to go to the outlet mall, if you're interested). Taksim has all the cafe's and shops, but when we went there at night all the shops closed around 9pm, unlike Sultanahmet which was awake and lively until midnight when we slept. There's a supermarket right outside the hotel, which was very important to us (with a one year old daughter), there were exchange offices, restaurants, and just about anything you needed right outside the hotel. The hotel itself was very clean, the staff incredibley friendly and helpful, and very hospitable. The rooms are a bit small, though ours were OK (we were told we got the biggest room because it was the only one that could fit a crib). Shower and bathroom were of good size. Breakfast was delicious, with everything you could ask for in a 4 star hotel (no ommlette station for example, but that was expected) and the rooftop restaurant had good food and a nice view. There's free wi-fi as well, you just need to ask the reception for the password. The one thing I didn't like, which didn't really have much to do with the hotel, are the tourist agency they deal with. We booked a few tours through the hotel and although they were punctual, I didn't feel they gave interesting information about the places we were visiting, and would usually ask us to find our way back to the hotel since it was close to the touristic sites and we usually booked a half day tour (couldn't stay out for too long with our daughter). If you're staying at the Orient Express, make sure you book your tours through another agency. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends, and would definitely stay there in my next stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Nace stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VitalySvetaylo
Reviews.Content: Here is a good place for a weekend to stay. A location is really excellent, all the sights are 5 minutes away walking to. We spent 2 nights and were really pleased. We had a well cleaned and maintained standard double room. They have Wifi in case you have a notebook. The staff at was nice and extremely helpful. There is a restaurant on the roof with a nice view but we never used it for anything except coffee break.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Telkontar
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the Orient Express from another hotel and was surprisingly pleased with the stay. The hotel is clean and well organized and the staff was extremely helpful and nice. The location of the hotel on the tram line and not far from the waterfront and Sirkeci train station on one side and close to Topkapi palace and other tourist destinations on the other side was a real plus. Food was close at hand with a kiosk across the street. The hotel has a restaurant, but it is expensive. I had a single room that was well maintained and clean. The staff at all levels was nice and extremely helpful. For example I asked if they had an extra adapter for an American plug so they went right then and bought one for me to use while there. They also have internet in the room if you have a laptop and it works swiftly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: y0rkshirelass56
Reviews.Content: Lovely, friendly hotel, within walking distance of the main sights and very convenient for the efficient tram system. Enjoyed dinner in the roof top restaurant, l am sure it would be wonderful in the summer when you can sit on the terrace. Bedrooms quite small, not a lot of storage space but adequate for a short break. Would definitely go again, hopefully when the weather is better, didn't expect a heatwave but also didn't expect it to snow!!

Reviews.Title: “Made my birthday very special!”
Reviews.Author: jax_46Brighton
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted at reception, we knew we had found a lovely hotel! The room, was small, but perfectly formed! everything we needed. The hotel is so wonderfully situated...walking distance from main sights, and the information and help given by the staff was invaluable. Try the restaurant on the 7th floor too! Will definitely return....in nicer weather!

Reviews.Title: “A real find; The Orient Express is the place to stay for an Istanbul City Break”
Reviews.Author: Gilly1950186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this delightful hotel and would highly recommend it for a city break. Not only is it central for all sightseeing, as a bonus you could not meet more genuinely helpful, friendly and happy staff; nothing was too much trouble.The rooms are small but spotlessly clean and cosy. Breakfast sets you up for the day and the Imbat Terrace Restaurant is excellent value (10% reduction as a hotel guest) serving a delicious range of dishes all beautifully served by happy and interested staff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: zeynep_896
Reviews.Content: I loved every minute I spent in this hotel! Great atmosphere, great employees, great service. Everybody is so friendly and ready to help with anything they are capable of. It is in a great place, lovely bedrooms. The hotel is very clean and it is such a nice place to be in. Next time I'm in istanbul, I'm definitely in orient express again! Its been a month since I'm back, but I miss it so much.. Thank you to everyone in the hotel with such great service ! :))

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: dihomin
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect. I was impressed by the kindness and hospitality of the personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: lynnph
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay in the Orient Express Istanbul, and it was as good if not better than the first time. The staff are so friendly, helpful and extremely efficient. We asked for an upgrade if this was possible, when we arrived they gave us a suite on the 7th floor at no extra charge. The food and service in the restuarant was fantastic. Nothing too much for any member of staff.The hotel is so well placed for all the places of interest, all within easy walking distance. Istanbul is a great place to visit and hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Was Agatha Christie here?”
Reviews.Author: Neptune24
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel - within a few minutes of Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, ST Sophia, the Cisterns and the Grand Bazaar. The hotel had a small swimming pool iin the basement. The lifts were small but adequate. Our room was at the back on floor 7 with a view to the Bosphorous and the Asian side. The room was clean and the bathromm had a bath with overhead shower. Toiletries provided were adequate. There was a small TV and some tea and coffee facilities in room. There was a domed dish of turkish delight left out for us as a welcome. This was delicious! Breakfast was very basic - sadly the juice was disappointing. Staff were very friendly and helpful - we needed to check out at 5.00am for return flight and they got us a cab immediately. The tram runs past the front of the hotel. One good point is the hotel belongs to Sirceki group and we were given a 10% discount card to use at their restaurants. We used the one on the top floor of the hotel and we were pleased with the meal. Really good fish dishes. Starter of ravioli and large prawns was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “If Hemmingway could have stayed here. He would say PERFECT.”
Reviews.Author: sinop66
Reviews.Content: Hotel in ideal situation for a business or toPlaced next to the historical Sirkeci train station. A must to see the original waiting rooms and platform for the orient express. See the film from Russia with love. Walking distance from the ferry ports for Kadikoy and the Most romantic place in Istanbul the Princess islands. You dont need taxis who ruin your indigestion just tram and walk.. Enjoy History.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: willemsnele
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel, everything is very clean! And the people were very nice ! It was perfect! ps: they had also delicious apple tea!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Celine1990
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best services I have ever seen in my life. All members of the staff are very helpful, if they only sense that you need help they come to the rescue right away. The restaurant upstairs has a great view and again a very friendly staff, the rooms are not very big but are very well taken care and are very clean. The hotel also has a very good location, close to plenty good restaurants and on a walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and Top Kapi Palace. Every day we left in the late morning to visit some things and came back in the late afternoon/evening, this hotel is a piece of silent heaven after a long day of (sometimes) crowdy and busy Istanbul. To make it short, me and my friends had a blast and so much fun during our trip. We had an unforgettable stay here and will certainly return to Istanbul in the future because we

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel,central,could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: angelSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Arrived home yesterday after a wonderful stay after being upgraded from the sister hotel "Erboy" owing to refurbishment work currently being carried out at that hotel,really could not fault the hotel,staff were very helpful and pleasant and could not do enough for you,really friendly,the hotel location was excellent,10minutes walk up to sultanahmet and about 8minutes walk you were on the waterside,so central for everything,head up to sultanahmet you will pass the blue mosque, and keep on that road and you will come to the grand bazzar etc ,all within walking distance,this was my 3rd time to stay in istanbul, and I would definately recommend this excellent hotel,the breakfasts had plenty of choice and I am so happy that we stayed at the orient express and will definately return in the future,

Reviews.Title: “A perfect home away from home in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: robinul
Reviews.Content: Our best hotel experience in every way. Great location -- 5 to 10 minutes from many of the main tourist sites. The most excellent staff, well informed and always helpful. Substantial breakfast. Make sure you have dinner on their rooftop restaurant, which has a great view of the city's skyline, with great food and fair prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, put us in a positive frame of mind for the entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: syed_amir
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just right. The staff were very hospitable and helpful. The location is perfect, within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, the sea front, etc. enough for a few days without travelling further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is very welcoming and accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: DeZerns
Reviews.Content: Each one of the staff was helpful! Grateful to have the kind man waiting at the airport with a sign to guide us. We didn't have our money exchanged when we arrived and the banks were closed. Because we wanted to pay cash to get the discount, the gentleman at the front desk said to just pay the next day. Our first day at breakfast, my daughter requested ketchup for her eggs and on each of the following days, the waitress brought a side of ketchup as soon as she sat down. Location was great! Front desk, concierge, bellman wait staff very kind. I did follow the earlier review and scheduled a great message at their sister hotel, Sureci Konak, around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful again in Orient Express Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RiaAmersfoort
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for the 8th time and again it was wonderful. The staff is always so very friendly and helpfull, they are always contributing to my feeling of coming home in Istanbul, the room is clean, the water is hot, the Imbat Restaurant on the terrace keeps on getting better and better. On New Year's Eve the decorations were very nice and the menu was fantastic. The location of the hotel cannot be better. Next time (I hope) again in this very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming environment”
Reviews.Author: istanbul15
Reviews.Content: value for money excellent staff excellent location nice bar incl. happy hour rate nice food

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Inqie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely hotel for 4 nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful from the first till the last minute of our stay. Room was not big, but still great value. Clean, comfortable and all the facilities we needed. Breakfast buffet offered a wide choice of foods. When we left we were even surprised with a gift, a wonderful box of turkish delight. Location is great, on walking distance from most major sights. The only thing that could be improved is the temperature in the hotel, is was a bit warm everywhere. If I ever get back to Istanbul I wouldn't hesitate for one second and return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Stoatin
Reviews.Content: Situated on a main road in the European Quarter this hotel is I would say is 3 star plus. When we arrived the staff were very welcoming and helpful and the added touch of an apple tea each was much appreciated. The rooms however are small but we found the rooms to the front of the hotel were slightly larger. Our room was clean and tidy fine but the bathroom could have done with an update. This hotel has a swimming pool in the basement. Clean and tidy with excellent changing facilities. Overall a pleasant stay with the staff excelling in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay for a special occassion”
Reviews.Author: WhitstableJill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary. We were made to feel very special and nothing was too much trouble. Our anniversary meal in the roof top restaurant was very special indeed. The hotel staff are all attentive and extremely helpful. The free afternoon tea was very welcome after a hard day of sight seeing. Cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. Will definately be going back :)

Reviews.Title: “affordable with a swimming pool and roof top restaurant, what else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: courtneytexas
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because it is a rare find, affordable with a swimming pool. Orient Express impressed me with the hospitaily, unfortunately a bit rare on the tourist trail of Istanbul. The front desk was very friendly and helpful, even had an electric plug adaptors to borrow. the roof top restaurant was very nice, and better priced than many street cafes. the best thing about my stay? besides the pool, was being treated like a first class guest as a solo traveler. too often solo travelers are put in the worst room and sat in the back corner in cafes. At Orient Express i felt was given a prefered room (full sized bed, windows with view...) and i was sat in the best table available in the restaurant. it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Service Here Rocks! A Class Act! Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: buffdawgs
Reviews.Content: I was torn on whether or not to stay at the Orient Express or the Sirkeci Konak by the same owner. Either hotel is a fabulous choice!! We were so thrilled with our experience at the Orient Express/ Sirkeci Konak Group. It exceeded our expectations. I was torn because I had read such great reviews about the Sirkeci Konak and it had so many ammentaties that I wanted to take advantage of. My husband was more concerned with price and he looks at a hotel as a place to rest your head at night. So we made the reservation to stay at the Orient. We called directly and the customer service on the phone was great...she even offered a cash discount and even upgraded us to a suite because of our family size at no additional charge. They also arranged for a transfer from the airport which was a load off our minds. When we arrived at 2:00 in the morning they helped with our bags and sent us right up to our room and allowed us to do paperwork in the morning. They were so helpful and hospitable right from the start. Now, the rooms are not large; however, you need to realize that these hotels in the old town are renovated old homes and old original buildings...so, realize this is what these hotels have to work with. However, the suite was perfect for our family with 2 adults/2 kids with a closing door b/w rooms. The customer service was impecible!!! There was not one person we came in contact with that wasn't happy and pleasant and accomodating. And Maric', the concierge was so sweet and helpful! When you arrive, there is even a letter written from the owner of the hotel chain with his personal phone number if you have any problems or concerns..."Guest Means Everything" in his eyes. And the coolest thing for me was the fact that we stayed in the less expensive, yet very comfortable hotel, but we were still able to use the ammenaties of the 5 star sister hotel around the corner... Sirkeci Konak. At that hotel they offer different activities each day that you can take advantage of free of charge. Even though we didn't stay there, we were welcomed to participate in any activity or use of the facilities. One day we went on a tour to a local bizarre with a guide and one other person. It was personal and informative and at the end we felt we had made a friend. The next night we took the Turkish cooking lesson and cooked in the kitchen with their chef and then got to enjoy the meal in the beautiful restaurant upstairs. And the next night we enjoyed the Turkish Hammam (bath) along with the foam massage, while our kids enjoyed the pool and sauna as well. The cooking was a small fee and of course the massage, which you would pay for no matter what. The breakfast was large selection and good. Service there great as well. And every day the hotel even has a happy hours with free tea and sandwiches if you happen to be there or in the area. It was also a super location right in the old town in the middle of it all and right by the tram station. I just can't speak highly enough of this hotel group. If you want elegance, great service, great location but on a better budget I recommend the Orient Express, but take advantage of all the great stuff the other has to offer. This was by far one of the best hotel we've stayed at in Europe and that's saying a lot as we have traveled for over four years living overseas to more than 22 countries!! Hope this helps your decision!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Boraxwoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel, situated on a street bustling with life and very close to many of Istanbul's main tourist attractions, is one of those you'd say has "character". Being named the Orient Express, it's themed around rail travel, which we found appropriate as we'd got there by train from the UK. There are various bits of rail memorabilia around. Although it's on a busy street with a tram going by, we didn't find it noisy. When we arrived, we were greeted very warmly and politely, and given coffee and a personal introduction to Istanbul. We learned that there are free (Turkish) tea and sandwiches in the hotel every afternoon! Our room was smaller than expected for a hotel of this calibre; this was a bit disappointing, but it was manageable. Strangely, only one side of the double bed was furnished with a bedside table and lamp. We asked housekeeping for another bedside table, and, after quite a while, they appeared with another of those large, heavy objects used to place your suitcase on. Apparently they had no spare bedside tables! The stand they gave us was far too big for the room, and the position they left it in meant that we couldn't open the wardrobe door! (However, by manouevering it sideways on to the bed, we could then get access to the wardrobe, and getting in/out of bed was only a little tricky.) Filtered water (only one bottle between us, however) was supplied in the room, as was tea/coffee-making equipment. Breakfast was good (nice yoghourt) but would have been better served in the rooftop restaurant. It would also have been better if they hadn't penny-pinched on the "juice" - which wasn't juice, but some horrid, oversweetened, undrinkable liquid. (But there's a supermarket ,which sells nice juice, just over the street.) We tried the restaurant one night. We're vegetarian, and, as most mezzes are vegetarian to a large extent, we asked if we could have a vegetarian version of the mezze platter, with any meat items replaced with extra veggie items. "Not possible", we were told. The food we did get was OK. There's a nice sitting area downstairs, and the free wifi was available in our room as well as in public areas, which pleased us a lot. There's a computer tucked in a tiny room downstairs for those who haven't brought their own. The swimming pool shocked us at first by being so much smaller than it appeared in the photos, but we enjoyed it very much none the less. It's a nice design, and we were alone when we used it. My main quibble, I would think, was the rude sign on the inside of our bedroom door. I can't remember the exact wording, but very brusquely it said something like "It is totally unacceptable to bring food or drink bought outside into the hotel". Who do they think they are?! However, whenever we asked for help we got it with a smile (including the massive non-bedside table!) so I would rate the service highly.

Reviews.Title: “nice, comfortable and well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: walterSchilde
Reviews.Content: I'd recommand this hotel to everybody visiting Istanbul. The hotel is situated on walking distance of the most important attractions of the city. The service of the hotel is excellent and the personnel is very helpful. The restaurant on the roof can be recommended for 2 reasons: its situation with a view on the Bosporus and the quality of the food;

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: newhorizons1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights recently. Brilliant stay from moment of arrival, met with complimentary drink and afternoon tea, to time of leaving. Within easy walking distance of majority of sights and would certainly recommend it to anyone. All staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was good and plentiful and though the rooms are small, everything was clean and tidy and beds were comfy. Only slight critisim make sure you take own soap as none provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plague40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel late October. It is not a hotel of North American standards and I think that's wahy some are disappointed. However, I am from North America and I found the hotel excellent. Service was top notch for me, breakfast was good, room was very very clean. Don't expect a super sized room but it is plenty big enough to stay in. Hotel is perfectly located and right on the tram line. The only problem with the hotel, and it isn't a deal breaker for me is the walls are thin and noise is annoying from other rooms. Other than that, I would not hesitate to stay here again and I probably will.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: Bustler268
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend this place highly enough. From arrival to departure the staff can't do enough for you, and it's not because they are trying to bill you for every little extra - at least it doesn't come accross that way..! The location is perfect for the walking the Old Town or heading for a Bosphorous Cruise, the swimming pool is small but has a picturesque design, the bar is reasonable (happy hour and free sandwiches in the afternoon), free internet and printing and even a complimetary tray of Turkish Delight awaiting you on arrival in your room (I don't like the stuff but a nicer more personal gesture than the apple in the Hilton...). Lovely, convenient, friendly and reasonable. Couldn't have expected more.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, helpful staff, but bar too hot!!”
Reviews.Author: muscadet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and overall were quite satisfied. Thgis was an Aimiles deal so I am not able to comment too closely on the value aspect of the hotel. The location was fantastic ad allowed us to explore a vast amount of Istanbul very easily; the reception staff were most helpful and endlessly smiling. Breakfast was more than adequate and my husband was dewlighted to see whole honeycomb on the breakfast bar ( he kjeeps bees you see!!). On the negative side, the bedrooms are rather small and dark - but also quite adequate. We found the lobby and bar extremely hot and so did not linger too long there. Overall we had a good stay and wopuld recommend this place for its location

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Location”
Reviews.Author: LuciaDel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the perfect location in Sultanment. Orient E. is close to the main sites such as: Hagia Sophia Church, Blue Mosque, The TopkapÄ± Palace, both markets, etc. The hotel has a pool; a restaurant with a nice view -their breakfast is average. The hotel has a lot restaurants and shops around it. They also have a one way free transfer if you book four days something that is very convenient. Location is absolutely perfect everything is walking distance and the area is nice. I had a nice stay at the Orient Express. The front desk is extremely helpful and nice. Since some tour companies advertise in the Hotel avoid Senkron Tours because is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean well positioned hotel, serving lovely food.”
Reviews.Author: carhomer
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at this hotel with my wife. We were made to feel very welcome with a comprehensive briefing on the hotel and Istanbul, the apple tea was a nice touch. The rooms were vey clean and cleaned dailly, the food was lovely, shame the breakfast was not served on the terrace. The bar was friendly and all queries were dealtt with promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hosts”
Reviews.Author: kafeciko
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Orient Express with a friend, it was our first visit to Istanbul. We were picked up from the airport (service included in our package, and mostly recommended for a first time visitor), and welcome at the hotel by Meric, the guest relations manager. Over a glass of apple tea she showed us on the map the surrondings, gave directions on how to get to each of the sites to be visited, and the visiting hours of the museums. She patiently answered our many-many questions, and tried to accomodate our requests to their best possibilities. Then we were showed to our room, which was very clean, though a bit small (for those who are picky), which is normal I guess since the building is in the old city; but on the other hand, we were there to visit, not to spend our days inside. Also for those who have sleep problems, walls are not sound-proof (however, it was not an issue for me). I definitely recommend the roof restaurant, the food is exceptionally tasty, the view is amazing, and service is 5*! Just to give you an idea, 3 out of 4 times we had dinner there :-). And mind that we were in Istanbul, on a very busy street, with plenty of choices. If only they had served breakfast there as well... I would have loved to wake up and enjoy my coffee looking at the Bosphorus and Ayasofya in the distance... They also have inside pool, but we didn't get to swim there, it looked clean and nice. The location is excellent to visit the historical sites, they are all either at waliking distance, just minutes away, or very easily reachable by tram. Finally I would like to thank everyone at Orient Express, Meric, the staff at the reception and at Imbat were all ready to help at any time and made our stay very pleasant. I don't want to spoil your experience by telling everything in advance, may you enjoy as well. Hope to come back again...

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Champagne212
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this hotel over the summer and we absolutely loved it! The rooms are lovely and super clean, the beds are so-ooo comfy, and a lot of attention is paid to the little details. The breakfast buffet was fabulous and we never seemed to need to eat again until dinner time. The rooftop restaurant is fantastic! Excellent service, great food, and a lovely ambience. Not cheap, but well worth it, especially if you are a couple wanting a romantic dinner out. They also make great coffee, too! Also, free Wifi was included, and it was fast. The location is great in that it's handy. There is also a handy tabac across the street, and a supermarket. The eateries in the area were not really that good, but it's an excellent area for its walking proximity to all the main sights. The staff was AMAZING! Every one of them was polite, respectful, and friendly. All in all, a beautiful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandjfirth
Reviews.Content: A Great hotel, ideal location just minutes from main sites. Excellent staff, very helpful and knowledgable. Hotel resurant excellent food and location. Rooms reasonable in size, well appointend and very clean. Recommend to any, one ideal for city break.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for all tourist attractions...”
Reviews.Author: Payneeman
Reviews.Content: Well located for all tourist attractions. Clean & tidy small bedrooms, shower/bath ensuites. Noisey in the mornings with lots of banging doors. The roof top restaurant had great views but the menu and food did not live up to our expectations. Getting a drink in bar took ages, and the buffet breakfast was limited. Best way to get around was the tram which was near by.

Reviews.Title: “Charming,central, comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Nielsine
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this lovely hotel and I was not disappointed. It is an excellent base for all the attractions in the old city and you can mostly walk or the tram station is virtually at the front door. I particularly enjoyed the roof top restaurant where you can watch and listen to Istanbul as the sun goes down. The rooms are well appointed and the staff are courteous, helpful and friendly. The breakfast is substantial and the complimentary tea and sanwiches at Happy Hour rounds out the package. I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: nuggetboy
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 7 night business trip to Istanbul. Our stay at the Orient Express was one of the highlights of the trip. As stated by others, we were greeted on arrival by a warm welcome and a cup of apple tea. We were shown a book that contained a number of tours that we might be interested in looking over later. They were not pushy in trying to sell us any tours. It seemed to be more of "we can help you with these if you like". I appreciated the soft sell. The room, though small, was very clean and well attended to each day. I had requested a quiet room and thus we were on the "backside" of the hotel away from the front street. The view was lacking (a brick wall), but it was exactly what I wanted, quiet and peaceful. The bathroom was average is size and all in tile. The shower cabinet was smallish but OK. The one problem I had was that you stepped up into the shower stall to an elevated part of the shower. This was fine, but when I was stepping out, the drop made it rather difficult. I'm a big man (6'3", 290) so rather than risk falling, I showered downstairs in the pool change area. the shower there was an easy walk-in type. Not a problem and I was usually the only person down there. My roomie, a normal size human being, had no problems. The breakfasts that were laid out were great. Some comments have said they were slow in putting everything out. This is true, but I think it is because very few people are there early. the breakfast opens at 7:00 AM. Every day I was there by 7:02. I was the first person there each day and frequently the only one until 7:30. Why put all the food out when few people show up until 8 - 8:30? In any case, what they put out was delicious. Lots of cereal, breads, yogurt, eggs, sausage, cold meats, cheeses, etc. Since we were there largely on business we were gone pretty early and returned usually around 5:00. I very much appreciated the happy hour the bar had with 2 for 1 drinks from 3-6 each day. We were able to sit a spell, enjoy a drink and review the days work with each other. The atmosphere was very nice and the service excellent. They also served free finger cheese sandwich in the bar during happy hour. Last but certainly not least i want to mention that every single member of the staff was outstanding. Everyone of them greeted you warmly and always seemed very eager to help you in any way. I hope to return to Istanbul soon for a vacation with my wife. When I do, I will be staying at the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: karlthelawyer
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express was definitely the nicest hotel we stayed in while in Turkey. Be sure to book ahead online, as the posted rates were rather pricey. The rooms were average-sized by Turkish standards (small by American standards), but very clean and you're greeted with a welcome letter and a tray of delicious Turkish delight. Our room overlooked an arterial with the metro running down it (convenient!), but despite our initial concerns about the noise, we had no troubles and slept quite soundly. The location is probably the best in the Old City area. You're out of the heart of Sultanahmet, where the restaurant employees are incessantly harassing you, but very near to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Bosphorous cruises, etc. As a tourist, you couldn't ask for a better location. While you're there, be sure to have dinner on the rooftop terrace. Though prices are higher than many restaurants, the food is excellent, as is the view. Tucked away in the basement is a small pool. Too small for laps or jumping, but good for a nice soak and very well-maintained. Staff were friendly and helpful. Not remarkably so, but absolutely adequate in that regard. Breakfast was good, but they were late putting some foods out and ran out of many dishes by the end - the key is to come in the middle of the posted breakfast hours. I definitely recommend the Orient Express Hotel to any and all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kaz2010London
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and could have easily stayed for more! When we arrived, we were given a glass of Apple Tea whilst a member of staff gave us a map of the area and offered some advice on things to do - very helpful start! The rooms were compact, but clean and had everything we needed. Breakfast was a good mix of everything so even if you don't like meat & cheese for your morning meal, there were plenty of cereals & bread to choose from as well. Our group can be quite fussy eaters but we all found something to eat! Above all of this, however, I would recommend this hotel purely for its staff. We were welcomed with a smile and nothing was too much trouble for them. It really did have the feel of family-run hotel, but with the luxury of a superb location (you could not get much better!), and great facilities. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone vistiing Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: Knulpuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orient Express for 4 nights to the 20th September. We really enjoyed our stay: Positives: Location - it is a 10 minute walk to the Topaki Palace, Blue Mosque, waterfront etc. It is also located on a tram line. Literally could not be better placed. Service - the staff were genuinely friendly without exception. Free afternoon tea and sandwiches. Breakfast - was self service - and there was something for everyone - set us up nicely for the day. Dinner - the hotel has it's own restaurant (The "Imbat") on the top floor of the hotel. Food was really good, as was the service and a view over the Bosphorus to boot. 3 courses, a bottle of wine, water, a beer for circa 45gbp. 10% discount if you are a guest. Free Wifi. Value - it was great value for money. The neutrals: Room - small but a view over the Bosphorus (in the distance!) - on 7th floor - facing the back. Some noise from the Imbat directly above and some on the Saturday night (music). We were not paying for luxury and we never got it - so we cannot moan. It was spotlessly clean and exactly as we expected. Never used the pool - but it looked nice! Overall the hotel was the perfect compliment to a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: DMW1108
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Orient Express hotel with our family to be very charming and cozy, with friendly, helpful staff and good facilities. The rooms were small, but cozy and nicely appointed. The rooms on the front all have french doors opening onto juliet balconies. There is even a "cave pool" in the basement which the kids used extensively after our days of touring Istanbul. The hotel is located in the heart of the Sultanhamet, conveniently only a five minute walk from Topkapi Palace which, in turn, is right next to the Hagia Sophya and it is just a short walk through the Hippodrome from there to the Blue Mosque. It is also only about 4 blocks from Galata Bridge on the Golden Horn, and the spice bazaar. Immediately across the street from the hotel, you find yourself in a maze of small cobblestone streets with lots of restaurants and shops. It is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel to the Grand Bazaar. There is a complementary tea (with sandwiches) every afternoon from 3-4 and a "happy hour" in the railway car bar in the lobby every day from 4-6. The hotel has a rooftop restaurant and bar, with great views of the Bosphorus--a lovely spot for an after dinner drink. We had a fabulous dinner at the restaurant on our last night and met the head of food and beverage for the Sirkeki Group, Levent Yigit , who was charming, helpful and friendly with all of the guests. The only negative thing to report about the hotel relates to a rather expensive tour we booked through one of their tour providers, Senkron Travel. According to the tour information the tour was supposed to start with a boat cruise of some sights on the Golden Horn, plus the Bosphorus. However, after waiting an hour for the people to show up, then being driven around the city for another half hour, we ended up being transferred to another bus, which then took us back to Ataturk Bridge where the boat tour began (we could have walked to Ataturk Bridge from our hotel in 10 minutes as it is right beside the Galata bridge). Then it turned out the the Golden Horn portion of the tour was nothing more than motoring under the Ataturk and Galata bridges. So, we left the tour at that point (having seen nothing but, fortunately, before we had paid) and went on one of our own, instead. We would highly recommend the Orient Express Hotel as a great location for anyone who is touring the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service, good value”
Reviews.Author: ClaireinBrussels
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Orient Express and he was right. The location is perfect, and the staff is kind, helpful and efficient. We stayed twice, once for three nights in a small room at the front - so small and a bit noisy - and the second time on our way home after a sailing trip in the southwest of Turkey, for one night, in a larger room at the back (quieter). Next time I would book directly and specify the larger back room. Also, if you pay in cash you get a discount. Good breakfast, all you could ask for, and the terrace restaurant is lovely for a nightcap overlooking the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fahaheel
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, the best is the excellent location because it only takes minutes to reach the historical places on the Europe side.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and well located”
Reviews.Author: Sumita006
Reviews.Content: The staff were probably the best thing about this hotel- very friendly and helpful. As a single mum travelling with two small children, one of them even child minded for me when I went to the nearby Turkish bath. The location of the hotel is very good for sightseeing. The breakfasts were awful and could do with improvement. I don't mind eating a Turkish breakfast in Turkey but a poor imitation of a continental or English breakfast is not good first thing in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, so friendly, well located, much enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: timbobtravels
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade from the Hotel Ilkay nextdoor (part of the same group) and so got an excellent deal on this hotel. From the moment of arrival the staff went out of thier way to be accommodating, friendly and helpful. Our room was on the top floor, and very comfortable with a nice bathroom. One flight up was a fabulous rooftop terrace where we enjoyed a drink looking out over the Bosphorus. The hotel was well located for our needs with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby, close to the tram stop and close enough to walk over Galata Bridge towards Beyoglu. Had a nice swim in the underground pool in the evening and the breakfast buffet was extensive. All in, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “good value,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lesley1314
Reviews.Content: Good location for access to most of the sights-Topkapi, Palace,Ayia Sofia,Blue Mosque.Also near ferries for Bosphorus,Princes Islands,tours etc.Rooms clean and staff were most courteous and very helpful.Trams stops very close.Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: JaygeeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in ideal position for sight seeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe base close to all the beauty of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: S2sma
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay - helpful and reliable staff - adequate room - good beds - top touristic locations nearby - easy to reach by public transport from airport and to other destinations

Reviews.Title: “Very helpfull, Excellent staff, great services with great location”
Reviews.Author: Math078
Reviews.Content: We were very happy staying in this hotel, the staff helps us alot & were very kind. Services provided by hotel were excellant & would recommend this hotel for all travellers. Maitham Nabil Zalzala U.A.E

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, helpful staff, clean rooms but with very low ceilings. Central location but located on main tram street.”
Reviews.Author: MemNY
Reviews.Content: Advantages: - This hotel was centrally located and within a 10-15min walk to the main tourist attractions and a 2 min walk to the tram stop. - Service was friendly. - Rooms were clean. - Rooms have A/C and fridge (although fridge didn't really work). - High speed wireless internet was available in the rooms for free (and it worked well). - Safe in the room. Drawbacks: - Located on the main street that the tram runs on. The lower floors in the front of the hotel might be a bit noisy if you're sensitive to the tram noise, and the back rooms face the wall of a neighboring building. - The ceilings are very low. - Pool is in the basement and is very narrow (website pictures are deceiving). Neutral: - Breakfast was included in our stay and was an average breakfast (for the most part cold foods like cereal, yogurt, ham, cheese, tomato/cucumber, a bit of fruit, croissants, bread, and on the warm side scrambled eggs and peynirli -a local phyllo pastry dough with cheese). Overall our stay was ok, however there are many other hotels located on the side streets of the main tram way (Hudavendigar Caddesi street) that seemed to offer similar amenities for a slightly better location.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff, very clean rooms, excellent location ...”
Reviews.Author: nuru67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orient Express with my two young teenagers. All the staff were extremely helpful, cheerful and kind. The rooms were quiet, clean, cool and comfortable. The food in the rooftop restaurant was delicious and the staff were very polite and friendly. The hotel is in an excellent position to see the sites. There are shops in the street (which is handy!) but it is not in the very most bustling part of town which for our purposes was perfect. It is within easy walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the river. It is also very close to the local park which is a peaceful place to rest in the heat of August. We had a fantastic four days stay there and were made very welcome by all the staff. It was a perfect base from which to see the many wonderful sites in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bepsieke
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul last week and we were very happy to stay in the lovely Orient Express Hotel. The staff was very helpful and already at the arrival we got a short explanation of the things to do. The room was o.k. and very clean. We could even look to the Belgian and Dutch television. In the cellar is a swimming-pool that could be used from 6.30 till 12.00. It was very refreshing. By our next visit to Istanbul, we will choose again for the Orient Express Hotel. Without no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_VL
Reviews.Content: We decided on celebrating our wedding anniversary with a tour of Turkey ~ our first visit. After reading many reviews on TripAdvisor, we decided on the Orient Express. We booked directly through their website. Since we booked for 3 nights, the airport transfer upon arrival was free which was great and we also took advantage of the cash discount. In the special notes section of their reservation form, we also mentioned our wedding anniversary . . . . What a WONDERFUL surprise it was to check into our hotel room to find a bottle of Turkish red wine and a BIG fruit basket filled with fresh fruit all wrapped up in festive wrap! Along with a card from the hotel management congratulating us on our wedding anniversary! Finding a bowl of delicious Turkish Delights in the silver bowl on the bed was a treat itself but the complimentary anniversary touches was such a thoughtful wedding anniversary wine and fruit basket was absolutely AWESOME! COMMENTS: - Airport Transfer : free and included if you stay 3 nights or more. Unfortunately, our Turkish Air flight arrived 1 hour late on a very busy Friday afternoon and we feared that our free airport transfer had left without us but lo and behold, he was there waiting for us! We were very happy that we were not left stranded at the airport! If you have an airport transfer with the hotel, remember to have a few liras, dollars or euros for the driver ;) - Front Desk : very helpful and always friendly. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a warm welcome and genuine hospitality at the front desk with an offer of hot apple tea. We were also given a short and very helpful introduction to Istanbul. We received a map of Old City Istanbul, brochures of suggested activities as well as a 10% discount Family Card valid at restaurants owned by the Sirkeci Group (of which the Orient Express is part of). Since it was our first visit to Istanbul, we had lots of questions and the staff was always very friendly and helpful! - Cash Discount - payment was easy and we received a receipt for our payment no problem whatsoever. - Hotel Restaurants : We took advantage of the Family Discount card and ate at both the Imbat Terrace Restaurant (roof of Orient Express) and the Pasazade Restaurant (roof of Erboy Hotel around the corner). Both were great, service was excellent as was the food and views. Recommend you make reservations if you want to secure a table at sunset as the restaurants fill up - reception will be happy to make the reservation for you. - Breakfast : delicious! Excellent buffet breakfast was included in our booking and we took advantage of it every day. Large selection of both hot and cold entrees, fruit juices, coffees, teas, pastries and fresh fruit. Service was friendly and good. No complaints! - Location : PERFECT! The tram runs directly in front of the hotel and the walk to the nearest station is 5 minutes away. Most major Istanbul monuments and sights are within walking distance as well. Tram is easy to use and navigate and extremely affordable - no need to bother with taxis. Lots of banks, ATMs, restaurants, cafes, bakeries, convenience stores (where you can buy bottled water, snacks), souvenirs shops all located up and down the street within easy leisurely stroll of the hotel. This is most probably the BEST location in Istanbul to stay for just about e-v-e-r-y-t-h-i-n-g! - Suggested Activities : as mentioned, we received a couple of brochures from the front desk upon check-in and we opted for the Orient House Dinner & Orient Show one night and the Turkish Dance Night at the Hodjapasha Culture Center. Both were worthwhile bookings and highly recommended for first time visitors to Istanbul. - Hotel Room and Amenities : our room was nice, clean and tidy. A little on the smallish side but that's to be expected at most hotels in general in Turkey. The air con worked very well, almost too well as we were quite cold after a while! - Swimming pool : located in the basement and suitable for refreshing dip after a long day sightseeing all around town! Very clean and almost never any hotel guests. There is a changing room with lockers, shower and big clean towels provided for free. (Thus, if you are looking to lounge under the blazing sun by the pool all day long, this pool is not the place for you but if you don't mind otherwise, it's perfectly fine ;) - Hotel bar / lounge area : in the ground floor of the lobby and there is a "Happy Hour" at the bar every day. Very popular! - Free Wi-Fi : fast, stable and reliable free wi-fi in our room, all throughout the hotel and also a couple of computers in the lobby where guests can use the internet. In Istanbul (and most of Turkey as we later discovered), you're never far from a free wi-fi spot or Internet cafe! In summary, we wish we could have extended our stay in Istanbul even longer as we loved it very much. When --- not if --- we return to Istanbul, we will definitely stay at the Orient Express Hotel. Thanks so much to the Orient Express Hotel for a wonderful stay and for the excellent service and hospitality. We highly recommend the Orient Express!

Reviews.Title: “nicely professional”
Reviews.Author: studiomarcone
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff particulary kindly and professional,position and location simply perfect for the visit of sultanamet.littles rooms but well cleaned.marvellousscenery from the roof restaurant !

Reviews.Title: “The Orient Express Hotel is a nice, quiet and comfortable hotel situated in an excellent quotation in the old city.”
Reviews.Author: PaulL56
Reviews.Content: A nice, quiet and comfortable hotel situated in an excellent location near the Topkapi Palace in the old city. THe modern tram is conveniently passing in front of the hotel. There is an excellent rooftop restaurant with great views over the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara. In short : excellent value for money !

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE TO LIVE WHILE IN ISTANBUL IT IS VERY COMFORTABLE AND CENTRAL TO ALL PLACES OF INTEREST”
Reviews.Author: priscilla_francisca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent part of town central to all places of interest. Transport at your door step but if you like to walk then all the places like the Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market can be accessed on foot. We did it and you see more and experience all the goings on around you. The hotel staff are second to none not forgetting the roof top restaurant which serves excellent food and the view is very good.My husband and I will definitely stay in the hotel if we do visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent short stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacqM
Reviews.Content: I'd read loads of reviews before we went, and I think a number of them were harsh. This is a great hotle for a few days. The rooms were clean - may be a little small, but your not in them that much. We had a noisy guest next door and the hotel offered to move us or upgrade us. Luckly they were leaving! The guest relations were excellen - very helpful with resturant bookings and general advice. The hotel is central to most of the attractions and the tram runs just outside. would definatly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Orient Express hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronniepf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orient Express Hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed it thoroughly. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the room comfortable. The location is very convenient to Istanbul sights and transportation--walking distance to all major activities. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BMZ2000
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with perfect location in the heart of the old town. Close to tram. VERY nice and service minded staff, clean rooms and nice breakfast. The only drawback was that the room was small. We barely had space to have our bags in the room. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home when staying abroad”
Reviews.Author: markmaria09
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in Istanbul for a week, for our trip we booked accomodation in hotel of Sirkeci group where Orient Express belongs to. When arrived we found our booked room to be for smoking which we are not. We informed reception but as this hotel was fully booked to our delight they accomodated us to the Orient Express which was an up-grade at no additional cost. On our arrival of which they only had half an hours notice they were still able to set the room and even fantastic Turkish Delights was waiting for us on the bed. The staff were very polite and always helpful, breakfasts were amazing (especially cheese pastery which we both adored), water in the swimming pool was of perfect temperature, Location of hotel let us to feel living in the heart of Turkey. Departing we left our phone in the room, after informing them by e-mail they found it and kindly organized delivery back for this we wish to thank them immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with a pool & roof-top views in a great tourist location”
Reviews.Author: averagetourist
Reviews.Content: On arrival from the airport (we used their pick up service at 25 Euro but the adventurous might use the excellent & cheap train service from the airport) at around 8 a.m. we were offered breakfast while a room was prepared for a (free of charge) early check in. The breakfast never appeared on our bill; not sure if that was intentional but thanks anyway Orient Express! The hotel is cosy and has a "small and friendly" feel about it; the staff were always smiley, friendly and helpful re directions etc. The facilities are good, after a hard day of sight seeing its nice to have a bar (very quiet during our stay) & restaurant, not to mention the lovely pool, in the hotel. The breakfast was good and varied a little every day which was nice and the hotel also put on free of charge tea and sandwiches at five in the evening; I discovered this accidentally as it coincides with happy hour in the bar! We were on the 7th floor just below the rooftop restaurant which has great views and though the food's not world class it's a lovely place to eat. Location is great, you're right in the middle of things. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Use this hotel when visiting Istanbul it is good and very helpful kind staff nothing is to much trouble”
Reviews.Author: Portia009
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very kind and helpful staff, nothing is to much trouble. Good breakfast. Great to be able to have dinner on the top floor of hotel with a fab view over the surrounding waters and city. The hotel is very well placed for visiting all the sites, shops, markets, you can walk to all of them, as well as for using public transport if you wish to do so (which is easy but staff will help you with this as well). They also provide, at reasonable cost, transport transport from the airport which is great. I would recommend this hotel for a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Excellence”
Reviews.Author: hbusby
Reviews.Content: This small, but modern hotel, situated on the tramway, close to excellent shops, restaurants and the principal tourist sites of Istanbul, fits the bill for a staging arena that leads to all points by tramway, taxi and walking. Though small, the room we stayed in, provided ample space for essentials, if you do not plan on staying inside all day. There is an excellent rooftop restaurant with great views of the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus. There is even a nice pool for relaxation and cooling off after a long day of doing tourist stuff. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: jmorris654
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated, nice amenities, clean, decent rooms, and most of all a staff who makes your stay worthwhile. A simple example...the staff noticed it was my birthday (a big one) and quietly prepared a little birthday surprise and gift without any solicitation on my family's part. Their thoughtfulness and desire to make our stay memorable goes a very long way....we highly recommend this location to others who are visiting Istanbul. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff, Great Location, a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: AMG2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express after reading reviews on tripadvisor and had a wonderful experience. The staff is absolutely exceptional. Very friendly and took care of every detail to make our stay more comfortable. The airport transfers were smooth, they were very patient and precise while helping us with directions and plans for sight seeing and with our 3 year old child. The rooftop restaurant was fantastic. The location of the hotel was perfect - very close to a tram station as well as within walking distance to most of the important tourist sights. Thank you Meric, Ediz, Ali and everyone at Orient Express for your exceptional service!!

Reviews.Title: “Greater Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: martv
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is more than beautifull and so is the Orient Express hotel. Nice room, perfect service, breakfast is beter than in most hotels in Turkey! The pool is great in the morning or in the late afternoon! Very helpfull staff! All in all - go to Istanbul, stay in the Orient Express Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Graeme W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orient Express for 4 nights in June. The location is great 6 minutes from the Blue Mosque etc one way and 5 minutes from the Bosphorus cruises the other. The other big plus is the roof top restaurant â€˜Imbatâ€™ which we absolutely loved. The staff were also very friendly and every afternoon at 4 provide free tea and snacks plus a plethora of advice. Less good was the room size - very small, or the pool size â€“ very small. However overall, and as given the location, you will not spend much time in the Hotel very good,

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express Hotel was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: susanthiele
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I recently had the opportunity to travel throught the Middle East and Europe. In Istanbul we stayed at the Orient Express Hotel in Old Town. Our accommodations were wonderful and the staff was extremely helpful . We had some difficulties when confirming travel and tour reservations. The staff at Orient Express took care of everything for us and made sure that our stay in Istanbul was nothing but the best. If I ever return to Istanbul I will definitely stay at the Orient Express again. We were able to sit in the lobby bar to enjoy a good beer and watch the World Cup tournament.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: crispy23
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a long weekend break to Istanbul & the Orient Express Hotel to celebrate a double birthday celebration and have nothing other than compliments to say about the whole experience. We booked directly with the hotel and included into this was a transfer from the airport of which they were there to meet us as promised in arrivals. At the hotel we were greeted with the obligatory apple tea and a very nice personal introduction from the staff. The bedrooms & bathrooms are not huge but were spotlessly clean. We have read on here of noisy air con units it may be that we were lucky but none of our party and we had 3 separate rooms had any issues, however if you are a light sleeper a room at the front of the hotel may cause you a problem as the trams do run quite close by. The hotel has a great roof top restaurant and we ate here on one evening and again it was excellent, the hotel had even organised a birthday cake.It was a real shame that the hotel did not make more use of this area, breakfast is served in the basement area and although the food was very good it was a little claustrophobic. To sum up this is not a 5 star establishment and has nothing to do with the Orient Express train, however it is a fantastic small friendly hotel offering real genuine hospitality in the heart of old Istanbul minutes walk from all the major sites and is tremendous value for money. We had a wonderful time and can honestly say the hotel was one of the reasons why, we hope to be able to visit Istanbul again in the future and will most certainly return the Orient Express Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, extraordinary staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnaintheWorld
Reviews.Content: Everything about my dealing with both Ilkay and Orient Express Hotel in Istanbul was just perfect. When we arrived at Ilkay, we were upgraded to the next door hotel, Orient Express. I can honestly say that I've never been treated so well in any of the many posh hotels in which I have stayed throughout the world. The staff was courteous, patient, prompt, kind,...human...I do not have enough words to express our gratitude to Ceren and her colleagues at both Ilkay and Orient Express. Hotel - very clean, close to everything (in the middle of the Old Town). Swimming pool - a big, unexpected plus. Staff - extraordinary, beyond any words. They were there for us all the time. They were very accommodating to all our requests (from changing the room a couple of times, when more members of my family joined me, to celebrating my mom with a surprise cake).

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel and you will not regret it!”
Reviews.Author: berthevh
Reviews.Content: This hotel shows true+sincere hospitality, everyone is very helpfull and speaks english very well. I lost my mobile phone and they all helped searching in the hotel with me. Unfortenately, we only stayed for one nigth but if I had known before that it is such a nice place I would have cancelled my other hotel in which I stayed the previous nights.The restaurant is not too big and good and you can sit inside and outside to enjoy your dinner with a nice view on the Bosporus and Topkapi Palace+ there is room service. The beds are separate and the rooms are cosy, not extremely huge but really big enough, it has a bit of the orient express atmosphere in the bedroom as well. The bathroom is spacious and clean + has a nice tub. The swimmingpool downstairs is very relaxing and there are also extra nextdoor changing rooms with lockers and a good shower and toilet. You can use the internet in a separate room. The luggage has a separate small depot so after checking out you do not have to take your luggage with you right away. The bar and lobby are cosy as well and the breakfast has really enough to choose from. It can be reached by tram, it is in a street with a lot of shops and restaurants. If you need a good and not too expensive way to travel to the airport Sabiha Gokcen then go to the stand of Yume at the entrance of Hagya Sophya and buy a ticket for 20TL per person. Normally, the drive is about 50 EURO by taxi (excluding toll fee) and takes about 1,5hrs. The Yume service will pick you up at the hotel and get you at the airport much cheaper. Hardly any taxi driver speaks english and some of them cannot read the maps. This info is not meant to be insulting but only to share, they really are very friendly and try to help but it is difficult if you cannot communicate even by map. The hotel is nice for groups, for family for romantic getaways or just for the city trip. I could really truly recommend this hotel for its service, its location, its atmosphere and all the facilities and its restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel I've stayed at in 44 years of travelling.”
Reviews.Author: JimAO
Reviews.Content: I can't speak too highly of this hotel. The staff are the friendliest I have encountered anywhere. At 79 euros per night if paid by cash it is amazing value for a four star hotel. The roof-top restaurant with views over the Bosphorous and up to Topkapi Palace is excellent. The location, within easy walking distance of Topkapi, the Aghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Bosphorous cruise pier and Galata Bridge is ideal. The tramway system runs right past the hotel with Gulhane station within three minutes walk. An ideal base to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “For gosh sakes: upgrade the room air conditioners!”
Reviews.Author: JohninNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, and had reserved through an internet booking service in January/February for a stay at the end of May 2010. The rate included taxes, service, and breakfast the next morning. The cost was 90 euros per night. As many others have mentioned, yes, the staff is friendly and helpful and yes, the location is convenient, although on a steep hill. It is best to walk down the hill to the next tram stop and then go uphill on the tram to the historic district. However, I was in a single room during a spell of hot weather (i.e. about 90 F, 33 C daily for the duration of my stay in town). The room air conditioner on the wall opposite the window barely worked! Moreover, the breakfast room was down in the basement. When I would arrive each morning I was always the first ... and the room was already warm! I could barely enjoy a second cup of tea; imagine the breakfast room when crowded. The reception & bar area, likewise, were charming but warm with inadequate air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel should be number 1”
Reviews.Author: fiza2
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little hotel, the location is walking distance to all the major attractions. The staff are very hospitable and helpful. The pool is an added bonus in the june heat of Istanbul. Istanbul itself is a wonderful city and we can't wait to go back. The first room we stayed in was a twin which is odd as we are a couple and was too hot the air conditioning wasn't working properly. The next day the staff were only too pleased to change the room to a more comfortable room with a double bed and cool air conditioning. The only down side in the room is the ancient TV but we were so busy sightseeing really didnt bother with the TV . The breakfast is of a good selection and catered to suit many tastes. The staff could not be any more helpful and had a vast knowledge of local information the staff is what makes the hotel stand out from the rest. There are parts of the hotel and rooms that need refurbishment however if you can enjoy the hospitality you will have a pleasant stay. I would recommend this hotel to all and am hoping to return in the near future. The breakfast was very good and the standard quality of food was

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK, but beware of reception!”
Reviews.Author: maperrin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, rooms are very comfortable, and clean. Breakfast is pleasant. Bathroom is very comfortable. However rooftop restaurant closes early, be aware of that. Only one problem: reception is not professional. They did not helped when we arrived, and when we left they overcharged a bottle of water in the frigo-bar, did not give a receipt, inform that taxi drivers were not safe and that I should take one recommended by hotel, who arrived after 20 mn and charged the double of price to airport. ALL old scams.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with delightfully helpful staff to help plan your fun!”
Reviews.Author: derekontour
Reviews.Content: Located close to all the major sight seeing spots in the old part of Istanbul. Nice comfortable hotel, offering reat value for money. How nice to be welcomed with an authentic apple tea, a map and guidance of locaion of all the places you planned to visit! Very friendly staff indeed. The Imbat restaurant on the top floor has a super view and good food. Watch out for the high price of wine everywhere in Istanbul - thank you the Turkish government!

Reviews.Title: “Special Place”
Reviews.Author: Maryistanbul
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have ever booked a hotel on the recomendation of Tripadvisor but we are very glad that we did - we usually stay in 4 or 5 star hotels - but this one is equal to any of them and in many ways better - staff in the hotel are lovely - so helpful in every way - breakfasts very good - swimming pool great after being out all day - afternoon tea in the bar is a nice little treat - and we were both given cakes on our birthdays which was such a pleasant surprise. The tram stop is just past the hotel - so it is very easy to travel about town. Restaurant in hotel is very good and we went there once - but we found that the Pasazade menue was better for us and we went there 8 times - we found that the service and food were very good also you get 10% discount as you are staying at the Orient Express Hotel. We did have an extra night in the hotel as we were held up by the BA strike but that was no problem to us what so ever - nice place to stay - we would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OLD TOWN WITH EVERYTHING: GREAT SERVICE INCLUDED”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: First- just to set things straight this Hotel is NOT directly affiliated or owned by the Mandarin Orient or Orient Express. We knew that when booking (with my business colleague)- it is owned by the Sirkeci Group. Apparently this group got into lots of financial problems but has over the last four years been given capital to renovate their properties with the Orient Express Hotel being the linch pin in this effort. The Hotel is named after the famous Oriental Express since it is right up from the old and shabby train station (with a moden edition attached). One other note on what is is NOT before I move on to WHAT IT IS (this is written to my fellow Americans). It is NOT the Marriott Asia, nor is it the Ritz Carlton (situated in New Town with incredible views and sky high prices). So what is it? It is a really classy little European style small hotel (and I mean small or quaint in every way. cozy lobby, cozy lounge, small European Style rooms- nice, well almost, but not reaching elegance in their decor and furnishings). The service is incredible, and fantastic in that "almost servile" Turkish manner which, if I can speak as an American, is sometimes close to be unnerving (close but not over the line). Whatever you want- "we can get it for you, not to worry". Lounge is really great. With rooms you have a choice...if you are on a budget then purchase ear plugs and stay in the front rooms. The Tram noise and street noise is no stop. If you can afford it get a back room for the views and peace. The place is right in the center of the tourist areas- new Mosque, Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagia, not far from the Bazaars and a 15 minute walk to new town, two minutes from the train stations and water ferries to Asia. The roof top restaurant is enough to make one want to eat every meal there- with views of Asia and the Bosphorus. Resist that temptation if you can because there are great and cheap restaurants in Istanbul Five stars for service, location, views and four stars for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A great place from which to explore the wonders of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Judie50
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was excellent and especially its rooftop restaurant. It and the hotel was such a pleasure to come back to after a busy day of walking the streets and seeing the sights. Judie Pettitt Karratha, Western Austalia

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Annchapman097
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel and could not praise it highly enough. From the moment we walked in the staff could not have been more helpful,providing us with tea whilst a member of staff gave us an overview of the city, the important sights, transport links etc. She then arranged dinner for us in the hotel's Imbat restaurant that evening. Throughout our stay the staff were attentive, helpful and cheerful. The hotel isn't huge but includes a decent breakfast lounge with a good range of food. There is also an inside pool which is small but adequate for a dip. Our room was on the small side but well furnished, clean and thankfully had air conditioning that worked. Some other nice extra's were the in-room tea facilities, turkish delight and free internet access. After one inferior meal out we dined in the 3 restaurants in the Sirkeci chain, all of which were very near. We had first rate meals and very reasonable prices. The Imbat in particular was superb with it's rooftop restaurant with views over the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kann_10
Reviews.Content: A delightful hotel located within walking distance of the main sites of interest. Our bedroom was spacious, and the buffet breakfast offered a wide range of delicious and well presented food. The staff are charming, and go to great lengths to ensure that their guests have a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Istanbul. The efficient pick-up service to and from the airport was also welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Agreeably surprised”
Reviews.Author: Marcel_47
Reviews.Content: Relaxed atmosphere, kind and helpfull, service minded staff. Well assorted breakfast . Perfect location with most historical and cultural Istanbul high lights at walk distance. Unfortunately in rooms at the front-side it feels like the tram pass your bedside. However, the reception handled our remark immediately and in no time we got a quiet room at the back side.

Reviews.Title: “30+ countries visited - best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jon5440
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express based on a recommendation from a Turkish friend and found it to be one of our most enjoyable hotel experiences ever. While it certainly isn't the very fanciest place in Istanbul, everything they do, they do right! Spotless rooms (a bit tight but very doable for two adults and one child for 5 days), great buffet breakfast, excellent location for exploring the key attractions, and, most importantly, a truly memorable staff. From the front desk people who all knew my daughter's name from check-in till departure to the smiling room maids, everyone seemed genuinely interested in ensuring that your stay was perfect. I was even tempted to try thinking up some impossible requests, just to see them make it happen! Bring a bathing suit for their unusual indoor pool. I've probably stayed at more hotels than I can count, and this one really stands out because of the people.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NapaPam
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and the hotel was recommended to us by a friend who has always given us great hotel recommendations in the past. So after checking it out on line, we booked 7 nights at the Orient Express and it was great. All of the staff; the housekeepers, the breakfast buffet servers, the front desk, the maintenance man; they were all very helpful and gracious. The hotel itself was very comfortable and clean. The only noise that we heard came from the street, 5 stories below. And closing the window took care of that, which was fine because the air conditioner worked great. The indoor swiming pool was very nice too. A breakfast buffet, which was ok, was included and there was also an in room coffee maker. I would stay at the Orient Express again and would recommend it for sure. Happy Travels! Pam

Reviews.Title: “Exellent !”
Reviews.Author: abbis
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Very helpful staff. Room was small but clean, soundproof could be better. Amazing view to the Bosphorus in rooftop restaurant. Good value for the money. It was the first time in Istanbul for us, we enjoyed and will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with all the 5 star ratings”
Reviews.Author: bruce_santarosa
Reviews.Content: Super location. Extra super staff. Wonderful restaurant on the rooftop. Very good maid service, and a really nice room. We were in the back of the building on the 4th floor, and the noise level from outside was very minimal. Also, a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful hotel staff in a great location with a wonderful rooftop restuarant.”
Reviews.Author: margelarson
