Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located in the historic area of Istanbul. It is convenient to major sites such as the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar etc. The staff was very helpful and proactive as they provided an orientation and maps complete with turkish coffee or hot apple tea as soon as you checked in. The hotel was clean and made you feel at home. As with any large city, you need more than a few days to explore, but the central location made it possible to see some of the major sites in an efficient manner.

Reviews.Title: “The warmth of the staff made this the most pleasant hotel stay I can remember”
Reviews.Author: chrisMReigate
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure all the staff we encountered, front desk, F&B and housekeeping, were warm, friendly and helpful. Our room was modest but clean, a little small but adequate for the four nights that we stayed. The room was at the rear of the hotel but what it lacked in view it made up for by being relatively quite. The location is excellent, all the major tourist attractions within a short distance as well as all the small shops and restaurants that a tourist could wish for. The hotel restaurant has superb views over parts of Istanbul, including the Sea of Marmara. We dined there twice, the food was excellent and not expensive, the service was good and the only downside was the closeness of the tables. If we return to Istanbul we would stay at this hotel again, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: mimilo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of major visiting sites. We were kindly attended by the staff of the hotel and we received an introductory explanation of sites to visit upon our arrival. Every afternoon they offered the guests tea and snacks. Breakfast was varied and abundant. We tried the restaurant on the top terrace (highly recommended and with 10% discount if you are staying at the hotel). The room was confortable, big enough and not noisy at all. I cannot generalize that to the rest of the rooms, since our room was on the highest floor (7th) and facing the back of the building. I don't know whether a room facing the faÃ§ade is as silent as the one we got. Not bothered at all by the sound of the call to pray, we didn't hear anything. I would come back to this hotel if I visited Istanbul again. It is quite expensive (above 100 euros per night) for the category of the hotel (3 stars), but I think expensive prices are common to any hotel in the center if the city. So, if I have to pay a high price for any hotel in istanbul, I better pay it for a hotel I know. The staff was always helpful and trying to make us as confortable as possible. Free internet next to the lobby. One last general advise about Istanbul: be careful everywhere about getting your money back whenever you pay something. We were often charged more than expected. So make sure, when you order from the menu in a restaurant, for example, how much your bill is going to be. Or count the money you are given back whenever you pay something.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: PerBe
Reviews.Content: great hotell with fantastic welcoming services. Always helpful to find restaurants. The restaurant on the 7th floor was ok, not fantastic, great view though

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tanjennifer
Reviews.Content: Friendly frontline & F & B staff. Room was a little small but clean and beds comfortable. Great spread of a wide variety of food for breakfast. View from rooftop terrace restaurant was awesome. Will certainly stay here again when we come back to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay with Extended Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: dundy68
Reviews.Content: From the very first beginning we felt at home in this nice hotel. We were welcomed by MeriÃ§ ÃœnlÃ¼, a very cheerful lady, who gave us a lot of information about the amenities of the hotel and its surroundings. And every word she had said was true: the room, your lounge, restaurant, bar, pool, internet, the central position of the hotel, i.e. on walking distance of the sights, park and museums, or if not the tramstop round the corner. All the members of your staff were very helpful. Breakfast a Turkish delight to start the new day. A special thank to the lady who had the daily care of our room. So whenever we go back to Istanbul, we'll certainly book your - also historic famous - Orient Express. The Netherlands - Eemnes - Nelly and Rob Meenhorst

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dohfar
Reviews.Content: This is a super hotel in the tourist area of Istanbul, on the tram route between the Galata Bridge and Sultanahmet. It's about ten minutes walk (fairly gently uphill) to the major attractions. The location is particularly convenient if (like me) you arrive by train from Bucharest/Sofia - an easy five minute walk with a wheely-case from Sirkeci station, just turn left as you leave the main concourse and follow the trams. The hotel is on a bustling street lined with fast food outlets, cafes, restaurants and tourist shops, but there is a feeling of tranquility as you enter the reception area. Next to reception is a lounge area with sofas, and a bar. All the staff I met, without exception, were genuinely warm and friendly, and were only too happy to help with any requests or problems. The rooms are well-furnished, comfortable and clean. The hotel had put a bowl of Turkish Delight in my room as a welcome. They also provided a tea/coffee tray, with a jug of filtered water for the kettle (replenished every day), which was a nice touch. My room was quite small and didn't have a lot of storage space - but in a fascinating city like Istanbul you don't spend much time inside. Breakfast is excellent, with a wide choice including cereal, pastries, fruit and fresh tea/coffee. The hotel provides a little news-sheet with interesting suggestions for the day and a weather forecast. Overall, an excellent base for a tourist visit to Istanbul, particularly if you're travelling by train.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to be staying if there is volcanic activity in Iceland!”
Reviews.Author: EithneLondon_England
Reviews.Content: I had an extended stay due to the above and was very pleased to be at the Orient Express. The staff are all lovely, calm, efficient and very helpful. I was a bit apprehensive about going to Istanbul on my own but my visit was wonderful. The pickup service was really worthwhile. I was a bit worried, because of a delay getting a visa at the airport, that the driver would be gone but was delighted to see him waiting. Returning late afternoon, the hotel was like an oasis of tranquillity away from all the hustle and bustle in the streets. As other reviewers have said, the location is perfect - between the docks where the boats go along the Bosphorus or across to the Asian side and Sultanahmet. All the major sights are very close. Breakfast was good and plentiful. The Imbat restaurant on the roof had a wonderful view and I couldn't fault the food and the service. I would gladly go back but don't feel the need to in a hurry because of being there twice as long as I should have been!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mandy3962
Reviews.Content: After many hours reading reviews of hotels in Istanbul, we finally settled on the Orient Express. We chose it primarily for it's location, the roof terrace and swimming pool. I had discovered on a hotel booking site that they also had 2 suites as well as the standard rooms, so as we were 3 sisters travelling together we requested one of these. We were on the 7th floor but sadly the room did not benefit from a view as it was at the front of the hotel, the advantage of being on this floor was that we were completely unaware of the traffic below. As we were staying for 3 nights the hotel offered a free airport transfer, and we were met on our arrival at Aturturk by the hotel's driver, and taken to the hotel. Here we were met by Meric (customer relations) and offered apple tea and turkisk delight whilst she showed us on a map where all the major sites were, and the best ways to get about. The reception staff were friendly and courteous and we never had to remind them of our room number when we returned to the hotel. My only criticism of the room would be lat there was minimal storage space for our clothes. The breakfast was plentiful, and there was a good choice available. It was also served over a longer period of time than I have previously experienced. The swimming pool, whilst small, was adequate with good changing facilities and shower, free towels were offered from the lockers. We used the pool most days and generally had it to ourselves. We chose not to eat in the rooftop restaurant, but the menu looked good and the views from the terrace towards the Bospherous Bridge were superb. One evening when we were enjoying a drink up there the waiter kindly brought us pashminas to use as the evening air was cool! The hotel met all our expectations for it's location, we were glad that we had opted for a small hotel as the service we received was extremely personal. I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends wishing to stay in an excellent location at a very reasonable price. All the major sites were easily walked to and we did not need to use the taxis or trams at all. Thank you Meric and all the team for a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary service and with a smile”
Reviews.Author: AnnieNIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, in the old city and very near to the top sightseeing sites of Istanbul.Situated conveniently to public transport such as the trams and the Bosphorus ferries. What makes this hotel different is the the excellent service provided by all the staff. My husband and I had to stay in Istanbukl for an extra five days in late April because of travel disruptions caused by the volcanic ash cloud over European Airspace. This was made infinitely less stressful by the unfailing help and support provided by all the staff particularly those who were on the reception desk. The hotel has a very nice roof top restaurant looking out towards the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus. We would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: norwayjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights over Easter. Our ride was waiting for us at the airport as promised. We were warmly welcomed at the hotel with a cup of apple tea and lots of information about sightseeing, etc. Very friendly and helpful staff and nice little swimming pool. Good breakfast buffet and the afternoon tea was also much appreciated. Don't forget to eat or have a drink at the restaurant on the roof !

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: GrannyLondon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a few days staying at 'The Orient Express Hotel' in Istanbul and I really feel that if ever a hotel deserved being recommended this is the one. from the moment of our arrival we were greeted with smiles and kindness, [ Also some apple tea and a little cheese and tomato roll! ] . Although there have been many comments on The Tripadvisor site about the size of the rooms, I have stayed in smaller and it was perfectly adequate for our short stay. Because of a bad back a requested Mattress Topper arrived straight away. My friend had a birthday while we were staying and on the day we were greeted with a birthday cake when we came back to the hotel in the afternoon. there was a candle and several staff came to sing Happy Birthday! The hotel situation is perfect. A five minute walk from the area which includes the Topkapi palace, The Hagia Sophia,The Blue Mosque, The Archeological Museum and The Underground water Cisterns. Just around the corner from the hotel is a stop for the Tram System. A ten minute walk will take you to the dock area where we picked up a Turyol Boat for a trip up the Bosphorous . [Cost L10 ] The trip lasted about 2 hours and went as far as the second bridge. The costs in Istanbul were generally reasonable. The Topkapi was the most expensive, L20 plus an extra L15 to enter the Harem Buildings. The crowds were horrendous and it was very difficult to see the various exhibits. We used a Shuttle Bus Service from the airport on the Asian side [ Sabiha Gokcen]. This was pre-booked and we were met at the airport by a rep. Cost was E10 for each person, each way. It was quite efficient but the return journey was marred as the driver arrived to pick us up from the hotel over 1 hour early. Luckily we were just checking out so were able to leave straight away. not sure what would have happened if we had not been in the hotel. Our stay was short so we did not venture far afield. However we did enjoy a visit to the Spice market and close to the Spice Market was a wonderful Mosque called the 'Rustem Pasha Mosque' decorated with the most beautiful tiles. Well worth a visit . We found everybody kind and helpful throughout our visit and i would recommend istanbul and 'The Orient Express Hotel to everybody'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: UKjohnst
Reviews.Content: L0CATION - Excellent location -easy walking distance (10 minutes) of Topkapi palace,Hagia Sophia,Blue Mosque,cistern & hippodrome.If want to go further a tram stop is about 3 minutes( cost is 1.5 euro per journey).Dolmabahce palace is 10/15 minutes by tram(well worth a visit-guided group tours only about 50/60 mins long). HOTEL - STAFF - Excellent ,friendly,very helpful (I have never met such helpful people). On arrival offerred an apple tea and the guest relations person made us familiar with the hotel and it's location in relation to the various places of interest.During our stay all questions we had were answered efficiently and happily by the reception staff. BEDROOM - excellent room ,comfortable bed and this was kept very clean every day.Good shower. BREAKFAST - Buffet style with excellent choices.Cereals,fresh fruit,dried fruit,yoghurt,boiled eggs,scrambled eggs,sausage,potato wedges.Good selection of very good bread.Jams & fresh honeycomb.Cheese & ham selection.I'm sure I have forgotten some things - it was all of a high standard and constantly being watched so that refills were made quickly. HOTEL RESTAURANT - Imbat restaurant on the top floor has a good view over the Bosphorous.It has a well earned reputation for good food.We only ate there one evening of our 4 night stay but this was only so that we could sample other places.It was excellent.The other 3 restaurants we went to were Pasazade,Neyzade and Red River Pub.By coincidence these are all part of the Sirkeci Group and were all excellent and within 4 minutes of Orient Express. AIRPORT TRANSFERS - We requested that the hotel arranged car transfers from Ataturk airport and these worked well. Visits to the Grand Bazaar (many,many small shops) and the Spice market are not to be missed. We spent three & a half days in Istanbul and saw all the major sights but wish we had stayed another 1 or 2 days which would have allowed us to visit other interesting areas of Istanbul including a boat trip or two. I have stayed at many hotels both for business and pleasure and the Orient Express is certainly one of the best and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home”
Reviews.Author: udine67
Reviews.Content: We've spent 4 nights at the Orient Express and we've found this hotel perfect in all the aspects my girlfriend and I needed. The location is great, in the heart of historical center near the main sightseeing. The hotel is in very good conditions, clean and quiet (despite of having a street side room in the night it was pretty silent). But the best is the personnel working at the front desk and assisting the customer in all his needs. They are gentle and focused on helping always in a very fast and professional way. Even strange requests can be satisfied: as an example my girlfriend needed to repair a pair of shoes and they managed to have it done immediately at a very cheap price. In the afternoon there is always the tea time, were one can relax after a tiring visit of the town and enjoy a tea with some sandwiches, obviously free of charge. We had relay the impression to feel at home. We definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfekt Hotel, perfect situated”
Reviews.Author: Franz1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in the hotel. Very friendly, very clean, perfect situated to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain four star”
Reviews.Author: jason10
Reviews.Content: Upon our return to Istanbul from Troy, Kusadasi, Pammakale, and Cappodocia, we were relieve to find that the Orient Express lived up to its reviews and more. We had been in Turkey for a week, and used to the incredibly attentive staffs at hotels and restaurants, and this one was no exception. From the moment we arrived until our departure, we were welcomed, guided, and cared for with aplomb by the wonderful staff. The room we had, even though facing the busy street, was quiet and comfortable, and cleaned nicely each day. The breakfast buffet was sumptuous, beautifully presented, the dining room was spotless with tables nicely spaced, excellently staffed. The daily afternoon tea in the lobby bar was always fresh and just right! The rooftop restaurant also has a wonderful staff, and a super view, fine food. The wireless internet worked fine in our room. The staff, particularly Ezid at the front desk, was a very helpful guide; in the concierge's absence, he made several arrangements for us with warmth and grace. Thank you! The small pool is a real luxury, as is the exercise equipment. The location was excellent as it was between two nearby tram stops and the metro, walking distance from tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The small TV was adequate to the task of providing news and weather; we were alway too tired from activities to use it much! Although the closed was small, there was enough space to hang our outer garments, but little room for clothing storage. All in all, we would definitely recommend Orient Express as a real value, with some luxurious amenities and wonderful staff, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sn0wleopard
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel for four nights and was pleasantly surprised! The staff was friendly and helpful, they arranged airport transfer, explained how to get to numerous Istanbul attractions, and treated us with delicious apple tea every evening. The location is superb within minutes from Ayasofia, Blue mosque and quayside.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: melburyMelbury
Reviews.Content: Whilst nothing to do with Orient Express, this is a clean, friendly hotel in the middle of the oldest part of Istanbul, within walking distance of the major sights. Charming and helpful staff, a really nice restaurant on the top floor, a bar (which provides free tea and sandwiches in the afternoon and much needed hard liquor in the evenings) and right on the tram line. Breakfast is ok but is subterranean and best missed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Leedsdave
Reviews.Content: As nearly everyone else seems to say, this is a great value hotel in the tourist area of Istanbul. Staff are all very helpful. The happy hour and free snacks are a great bonus when you come in from touring. Swimming pool is also welcoming. The only downside is the size of the bedroom and the limited storage space.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in Istanbul that make you happy”
Reviews.Author: MargaretaGothenburg
Reviews.Content: Orient Express Hotel is a very nice hotel in Istanbul, The friendly atmosphere with its excellent staff made us feel really special. The breakfasts could not be better and the restaurant at the top-floor, with its beautiful view, was great. Thank you for all your care. We appreciated it very much. We hope to go back to Istanbul and the Orient Express Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “-Fantastic athmosphere-”
Reviews.Author: RocioSweetDreams
Reviews.Content: During my trip in Turkey I had the great chance to stay at Orient express Hotel in Istanbul... Here my comments: 1-Very well located 2-Very nice and helpful staff 3-Good breakfast 4-Gorgeous view from the roof restaurant 5-Clean and neat

Reviews.Title: “I HAVE TRAVELLED AROUDN THE WORLD AND YOU CANT BEAT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AlisonChichester140
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived we were welcomed with a drink and such a friendly greeting, the staff were all kind friendly and helpful. I have stayed at lots of hotels all round the world as well as working in travel and you would not bet the service and friendly staff at this hotel - they are superb and a real credit to the owner. I cant say enough to rate this hotel if and I hope one day we will go back as it is such an interesting place I would not look to stay anywhere else but The Orient Express Hotel. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “From the staff to the location this hotel helped me enjoy the greatest vacation I ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Byzantium38
Reviews.Content: I spent five days in Istanbul last year while taking a course on Istanbul for my local college and when me and my wife decided to vacation there we chose to stay at the Orient Express because of the great service I recieved on two occasions at the Imbat Terrace restaurant. It is safe to say that we were not dissapointed in the least, and in fact, it was the greatest vacation experience I ever had in my life. When we arrived as soon as we entered the door we were asked to sit down so that we could be given apple tea and an introduction to the city from the guest relations manager. Taken aback at the hospitality, which we never experienced because we are full time grad and undergraduate students and don't have much money, we asked to smoke a cigarette after our long flight from New York and and ride to the hotel. The staff wholeheartedly understood and as soon as we were finished we sat on the hotel lobby sofa and experienced our first taste of the Orient Express hospitality. Being that I was in the city before and knew where the monuments were located, the guest service manager directed her introduction to my wife and even took the time to save us money by making it a point to tell her that she had to bargain in the Grand Bazaar in order to not be taken by the shop keepers, as well as giving us a card that saved us 10% at all of the Sirkeci Group restaurants in the area, including the famous Imbat Terrace on the roof. After that we spent seven days at the hotel, drank complimentary tea every afternoon in the lobby, swam in the swimming pool, ate at the superb Imbat restuarant on the hotel's roof, and enjoyed ourselves in the beautifal city of Istanbul. The staff of the hotel was more friendly and helpful than we could ever have imagined and when the shuttle driver we paid to pick us up on our last day failed to show on time the hotel staff called us a cab to get us to the airport on time. When we arrived at the airport and found our flight was cancelled due to high winds in New York the hotel gave us our room back and even set up a private car to take us to the airport the next morning. If you are planning to stay in Istanbul me and my wife highly recommend this hotel. The staff are some of the nicest people you will meet and will do every thing they can to help you. I miss their hospitality already.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, well appointed hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Damion75
Reviews.Content: You would struggle to find a better location for staying in Istanbul than the Orient Express hotel. It is such a short walk from all of the major sites and a number of very nice restaurants - not that you need to go further than the Imbat restaurant on the roof for some suprisingly well priced good food. The rooms are a little small, but plenty large enough to sleep in, which is all that we needed. The air conditioner worked well, heating for us rather than cooling and the shower was excellent. The location is reasonably noisy, but in the middle of a large city what can you expect? We enjoyed the pool a couple of times, but I imagine that in summer it is a godsend after a hot hot day trekking around town. The Turkish reputation for hospitality is well deserved and the hotel does well here too. From being greeted by Ceren on arrival with a map and some top advice about where to go and what to see, to the service on the front desk and in the restaurants, it's all good. Heartily recommended and this is where we will be staying if we head back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness, hospitality and service excellent”
Reviews.Author: chrisjlorraine
Reviews.Content: We stopped for 3 nights in February on a city break. The welcome and friendliness of the staff were simply the best we've experienced. Very useful tourist info was provided on arrival over a (free) cup of apple tea. Afternoon tea was complimentary each afternoon. The roof restaurant provided an excellent meal at reasonable value with wonderful views over the city. Breakfast was fine. Wireless internet (free) worked both in the room and in the lobby. The beds were a little firm for our taste, but that is really the only improvement I can recommend. The room was comfortable and quiet, there was plenty of piping hot water. The location of this hotel is outstanding - all the ' must see' items are within comfortable walking distance, (cheap) public transport runs past the hotel entrance. We will certainly come again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Montysmother
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express for four nights, and had a great experience. It is a good quality three star hotel, with very friendly, helpful and attentive staff. On our arrival, we were welcomed with apple tea, and an informative overview of the area, a map, and recommended sights to visit. Our room on the third floor was clean and adequate, with tea and coffee making facilities, a mini bar, hairdryer, and Turkish Delight. The room was on the small side, but this didn't matter, as we spent most of our days sightseeing. The breakfast buffet contained a wide variety of choices, such as cereals, fruits, natural yogurt, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, olives, cold meats, different types of cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers, a range of bread and jams. The location on the Hudavendigar street was excellent - it was pretty much in the centre of things, and you could walk to all of the main sights, such as The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, The Topkapi Palace, The Grand Bazaar, The Spice Bazaar and the Bosphorous River. There's also a very good tram system for getting around the city, which runs through the Hudavendigar street. The restaurant on the roof of the hotel was also very good. We enjoyed a delicious meal there one evening. We would highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in the heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: HumphreyReading
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers clean and comfortable accommodation at a great value price. The staff fall over themselves to help you with anything you wish. There is a happy hour in the bar from 3pm to 7pm and free tea and sandwiches made with the simit bread are available at the same time. The breakfast buffet offered a whole honeycomb plus a wide range of cereals and continental style buffet. The restaurant on the top floor offers a turkish/mediaterranean menu of the highest quality and yet again the service was excellent - all with a view across the rooftops to the Bosphorous. Its location, almost next door to the Topkapi Palace and within easy walking distance of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque is idea. I would definitely stay there again on any return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's restaurant with best view and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kouts
Reviews.Content: A week ago we enjoied a very festive dinner at Orent Express Hotel's rooftop. Service was excellent from start to finish. The waiters were extremely friendly, suggesting different meals and wines. Everything was tasty, and highlight of the evening was, when they turned off the lights, and came to our table, singing "Happy Birthday" - my husband had birthday this day, and information about it came from our own hotel nearby, Sirkeci Konak (Best Family Hotel in the World 2010 :)) We got big chockolate cake and they all waited, when he blew off the candles... and everybody applaused. This was a very happy moment of life in our family. Thanks for the joy and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: Billythefish1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated in the tourist part of town, directly on the tram route and just a couple of minutes from the station. (60p for any distance on the tram) Centrally located for all of the tourist attractions, Blue mosque, harbour, Topkapi, bazaars. Snowed when we there but we still got about and walked most places. The hotel welcome was excellent. A hot drink of apple tea and a small sandwich. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and explained about the various means of transport and sights to visit. Went to the Asian side of Istanbul on the ferry, 60p each way and a 15 minute trip. Great value. If you donâ€™t like being hassled everytime you look into a shop window or at a menu donâ€™t go to Istanbul. After a day we didnâ€™t bother looking anywhere but straight when we passed shops and restaurants. The number of deals I could have done for Carpets, leathers, meals, and all at discount prices was amazing! I resorted to asking if they were selling carpets, leathers etc to head them off, usually without success. Didnâ€™t get a chance to eat in the Hotel except for breakfast which was plentiful but unexciting. Choice of hot, (warm), food; egg, frankfurters (bit red for my liking) and cheese pastry. Changed slightly each day but still samey. The cold selection was good on the first day but didnâ€™t change. Plenty of choice for cereals, dried fruit but nothing to excite. The room we had was on the 7th floor, overlooked buildings at the back, bit small but adequate. Warm room and the bed was comfortable. Water and Turkish delight in room, nice touch. Very noisy at night with doors from other rooms banging loudly and other guests conversations clear when they were in their room and on the corridor. The TV was a bog standard 14â€� with only one English Channel. I donâ€™t go on holiday to watch the TV but occasionally you like to have a diversion other than the news. Picture wasnâ€™t much good either. If you are spending a week here it is ideal. Plenty of restaurants and bars only 5-10 minutes away. The North Shield pub showed all of the premier, La liga, Dutch matches and if you want beer from home they sold it. Food was okay if more continental than Turkish. All in all Istanbul was different but didnâ€™t offer much more than other cities. The hotel offers a shuttle service from the airport at 25euros for 2 each way. You can get it cheaper, we got it for 12 euros each way on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Kikujiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express Hotel from 20-26 November to our fullest satisfaction. One of the main reasons we chose this hotel is its excellent location close to many of the major historic sights in Istanbul. The Topkapi Palace, the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the Basilica Cistern, the Archaeology Museum, the Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum, The Egyptian Bazaar and the Galata Bridge are all within walking distance from the hotel. Furthermore the hotel is close to a tram stop and about 10-15 minutes from a large bus station. Service at the hotel is great. Before arrival the (beautiful!) Guest Relations Manager Ceren Ã‡ipa was already of great help to us when we were planning our trips out of town. After arrival in Istanbul, we were picked up at the airport by a taxi the hotel had arranged for us. We did not have to wait for other guests sharing our minivan and the ride to the hotel was quick and smooth. At the hotel we were welcomed with some hot apple tea in the nicely furnished lobby. If you like, the hotel can arrange trips for you. As we had already made our own travel plan in advance, we did not make use of this service. Rooms are small, but not smaller than the rooms in other European hotels of the same class in for example Amsterdam, London or Paris. I thought the free Turkish Delight on the bed was a nice touch (and could not stop eating once I had started). Our room had a shower and a bath tub and the usual anemities like soap, shampoo and a hairdryer. Also there are an airconditioner, coffee and tea making facilities and a safe in the room. Walls are a bit thin, so you can hear muffled sounds of the people sleeping in the next room(s). The breakfast buffet is excellent and offers a wide variety of (local) products. We even skipped lunch a couple of times as we ate too much in the morning! The service of the employees in the breakfast room, under supervision of the wonderful Mehmet GÃ¼ven, was great. Breakfast staff was always cheerful and in for a talk and regularly saw to it food was replenished. All in all we had a pleasant stay at the Orient Express Hotel and would probably stay there again during future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotell with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: karinpeder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in a walkable distance to what there is to see is Istanbul. Suited near several Tramstations, so it was easy to get from the AirPort to the hotell. The hotelstaff was excellent, very friendly and informed us about all kinds of stuff to do in Istanbul. The rooms was small but comfortable and there was free tea and coffe in the rooms. A bit smelly from the cleaningproducts though. The roomservice was excellent, quick and really affordable! We would really recommend this hotell. We weren't so impressed by Istanbul though, much because of the people working in restaurants and shops whos yelling and tries to force you in to there restaurants/ shops. We didn'd enjoy that, but others might!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect combination of great value for money, terrific location and awesome, genuine customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Nissar_Ariba
Reviews.Content: In 30 years of travelling we have stayed at many hotels where we remember 1 or 2 people who did something special for us. At this hotel we can list out by name SIXTEEN employees who went out of their way with almost effortless ease, to make this an extremely memorable holiday. A hotel is nothing without the right people and these 16 can easily write a text book for others in their profession. They helped with our local travel, helped arrange trips out of town, set up the breakfast buffet an hour in advance when we needed to leave early and even went and shopped for an adaptor for our laptop's power cord. The hotel itself is charming and well furnished. The walk to the core tourist sights is short and pleasant, the tram station a short walk away makes for easy local travel and if you want to get away from the tourist oriented restaurants and eat with the locals step out of the hotel and walk to the right for about 5 minutes or less. The room was cleaned well every day, the bed was very comfortable and though we could hear the people in the next room sometimes, it was pretty muffled and did not disturb. Do we sound like we are gushing? You bet we are â€“ we loved the place and know that when we head back to Istanbul, we have a home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff @ the Orient Express”
Reviews.Author: ckotadia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 10 mins to the Hagia Sophia and 5 mins to the Spice Bazaar, the staff is one of the best I have experienced, very helping, small rooms is the only problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: steamtrain1345
Reviews.Content: Would stay at the Orient Hotel anytime we go back to Istanbul. Central location Small but nice rooms, Restaurant meal was delightful. Best of all is the welcome you get from the staff and the way they can organise any trip and give sound advice in where to go and see or eat. We wish them all the best and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location in historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Middle_aged_bloke
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean; great restaurant; decent breakfast. Location was great: walk to Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia, Bridge and Bazaar (and we don't do serious walking, but this was fine). Yes: rooms are small, but not sure why anyone would expect a large room in an old building in the city centre at this price! They're perfectly adequate for sleeping and baggage storage, but somewhat restricted when it comes to cat swinging. Free limo pickup from airport (conditions apply) is great, and particualrly so if you've just had to sweat your way through the immigration sheep dip! Staff are very helpful, bt not intrusive. Nice pool; really nice after a day out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: SvenDenmark
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, really helpful staff, excellent brakfast with turkish specialties (not just the usual bland continental type), nice indoor pool. Quiet. Top Class rooftop restaurant. What more could one wish for?

Reviews.Title: “Like being at home”
Reviews.Author: GisaFreitag
Reviews.Content: Good localization, clean room, nice restaurant and the best staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location, rooms OK”
Reviews.Author: chrian
Reviews.Content: For what is a 3 star hotel it is very good. As long as you remember it is 3 stars you will have no complaints. The bedrooms are on the smaller side with not a lot of storage space. The service is 1st class and would not be out of place in a 5 star hotel, friendly, accurate, informative without being in your face. The hotel was spotlessly clean. the location is good, with all the major tourist sites very walkable. For a city centre hotel on a tram route it was surprisinlgy quiet. The range of the breakfast buffet was very good. The only niggle is the breakfast room is on the small side if everyone turns up at the same time and it was a very warm room. Remembering it is a 3 star hotel, it was fine. I can only repeat again how good the staff were.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roneiges
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express Hotel Istanbul raises the bar for other hotels wishing to match quality customer service. The top quality service stated when we were unable to obtain a cab because the Turkey Cab drivers were all after the higher fairs for customers disembarking the cruise headed to the airport. So we contacted the hotel and they arrange for a cab to pick us up and provided the number. Well a cab with a very similar number stopped by and confirmed he was sent by Orient Express. Turns out he wasn't and request $58 US in lieu of the $10-$15 for the little over a mile trip. We call Orient Express and they ask us to get the Bellboy when we arrived. The cab driver must have learned what was up and proceeded to drop us off at the corner. I went to get the bellboy as the wife guarded the bags and held off payment. The bell boy argued and took the cabs number. We still ended up paying 30 Lira. But this was much better than $58 US. They were going to file a complaint but since we were only going to be in town one night it would do no good since we would not be available once the police contacted them for our statement. None the less this service was greatly appreciated. We had booked a single room for 3 people and they offered us two rooms because of all of our luggage and I believe to compensate us for our unpleasant start in their country. It turns out the majority of the people we met during our visit were very friendly, so donâ€™t let a crooked cab driver give you a bad impression of Turkey. The rooms were small but by European standard above average and the room and entire facility were very clean and well maintained. We did not have time to try the pool, restaurant, fitness center, or the complimentary breakfast. But all of the facilities and other amenities that we utilized were trouble free. In summary itâ€™s a well located hotel that is clean and well maintained and the entire staff provides top quality customer service. The Orient Express Hotel Istanbul is highly recommended by my wife, father-in-law, and myself.

Reviews.Title: “If you could bottle and sell the fantastic service provided by the staff - you'd be a millionaire in no time.”
Reviews.Author: anythingbutIndian
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to come across a more friendly genuine staff than the staff at the Orient Express. Nothing is too much trouble for them and everybody is made to feel special. This is a lovely little hotel in a great location and while the rooms are a little on the small side, there is so much to do and see around Istanbul you spend very little time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express Hotel - Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Knaresborough_Brian
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul and had the Orient Express Hotel recommended by friends.On arrival we were greeted by Ceren, the customer relations manager, together with cups of apple tea.We were provided with maps and told about the main points of interest. Our room, although on the small side, was well equipped and very clean with views over the Bosphorus. The roof top terrace and restaurant had lovely views over the city and the Bosphorus. The staff and the food in the resaurant were excellent and the prices were on a par with those in Sultanahmet. Breakfast was also excellent with food to cover all tastes. Overall the Orient Express Hotel offered us great value for money with superb, cheerful and helpfull staff. Suffice to say we will be returning in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express and Imbat Terrace Restaurant both Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sinbad2
Reviews.Content: Dinner at the Imbat Terrace Restaurant at the Orient Express Hotel Istanbul, Turkey Nov. 3 (for Kristen and Levant) Tonight we are eating 7 kinds of Turkish cheese, 4 kinds of olives--black, green, brown and purple, drinking Ottoman Wine, grapes from 3 regions of Turkey, Asian, European and mountains, while the Bosphorous Bridge lights up with stars of blue, white sparkling patterns, with Taksim music blending into the cool night air-- no further need for flying carpets c: sam hamod nov. 3, 2009 excellent hotel, very fine staff with helpful and courteous service and advice, great location, and one of the best restaurants in all of Istanbul--you can't beat it at any price or for any reason. Sinbad

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location and a pool - the best”
Reviews.Author: AlMagG
Reviews.Content: After a day sightseeing it was a pleasure to return to the hotel to a friendly greeting, afternoon tea(free) and a dip in the pool. The Roof Terrace restaurant provides excellent food or just a pleasant place for a coffee. Having stayed at the President - also an excellent hotel - last year I was surprised just how much better this hotel was. My grandson, aged 12, who is a seasoned traveller, puts this hotel at the top of his list. Quite a recommendation! Most other hotels of this class and higher in Europe should take a lesson from the Orient Express regarding service. A really top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Isabel80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Perfect hotel for a base when sightseeing as its location is fantastic: a few minutes walk from all the Sultanahmet main sights. Staff were friendly, and helpful, with excellent English. There is a great little pool in the basement which was lovely to stretch tired legs at the end of a hard day's sightseeing! The room itself was a little on the small side and suffered with noise from the street (and the tram). There wasn't very much space to store clothes, so a problem if staying for more than a night. It was spotlessly clean however. Rooftop restaurant also excellent, with fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: FloridaDemi
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, good location, and outsyanding staff. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant friendly hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dee098
Reviews.Content: The hotel nestles below Topkapi Palace with rooftop restaurant and terrace views over the Bosphorus. Rooms all have fridge safe hairdryer and beds comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful and the hotel rated as 3 star represents excellent value for money. I thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome and taste of the Orient”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: Located just around the corner from the terminus of the original Orient Express, this hotel is located in an ideal location to explore Istanbul by foot or tram. The hotel arranged complimentary transport from the hotel, a welcome tea at the hotel with tourist debrief. Complementary afternoon drinks and snacks and some Turkish Delight in the room. A clean and good sized room, not a great view, but when paying cash in advance for a discount, I didn't expect more. Breakfast was great and included, a good sized breakfast room and lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Khurram59
Reviews.Content: Orient Express is a very nice hotel with great location. The hotel is very well kept, the staff is exceptional and extremely helpful. The Guest Relation Manager Ceren Cipa was very helpful in accommodating our family accommodation needs. In order for our family to be comfortable, she upgraded us to a suite with no extra charge. All major tourist sites such as Blue Mosque, Topika Palace, and Grand Bazar among others were all within walking distance. The hotel served a very nice buffet breakfast, along with a complimentary tea and sandwiches in the afternoon, which we thought was a very nice touch. Overall this hotel is a great place to stay, and we will definitely stay at Orient Express on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location-nice staff - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: annaboyd
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel , clean, super location and nice helpful staff. Rooms and double beds are very small though. Would recommend you ask for a twin even if in a couple as then you'll get two bigger beds you can push together anyway. Other slight criticisms - pool is a bit chesey and cloudy and the view from the rooftop restaurant is not truly as billed in the photos. Hardly a clear view of the Bosphorous- rather a glimpse! Oh and bring your earplugs if you are a light sleeper , the tram runs past the from of the hotel. Very convenient though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greystones23
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently placed hotel on tram route between Topkapi Palace and Galata Bridge. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms spotlessly clean if rather small, but functional with everything you could want provided eg water, tea, coffee, shampoos etc. We eventually got used to the trams passing very regularly and as they stop running overnight it did not disturb us. We were on the 7th floor don't know if it was noisier lower down. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. My husband used the swimming pool on floor -2 and said it was small but OK with towels provided. Bed too hard for me but OK for my husband. A faulty hairdrier replaced immediately with a new one. No complaints from us. It was very easy to walk to the Post Office, Spice Market, get a boat ride up the Bosphorus and visit Rustem Pasa Camii Mosque (a gem of a mosque) walking one way out of the hotel and Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque walking the other way. We took the train and tram from the airport, 40 mins and 4 YTL - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff -location- hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregDot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express Hotel on our way to and from Kalkan. The staff, Cihan, Fatih & Ceren were the most helpfull that we have met anywhere in the world. Nothing was ever too much trouble at any time of the day or night. they are a credit to the hotel and the tourist industry in Turkey. The hotel was very central for our explorations, we could not give it a higher recomendation. A welcome drink and snack on arrival and drinks and free snacks each afternoon, breakfast choices were very generous. Staff once again were very attentive and helpful. we had a front room facing the street, a great place to watch the colourful world go by. We wil be staying at this Hotel next time we travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Marriage_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel well situated for the touristique sites in Sultanahmet and at the same time for the nightlife in Taksim. A very warm welcome and very friendly staff. Highly recommend their roof top Imbat Restaurant, gastronomique food reasonably priced, well presented and excellent service. We were a party of 17 persons celebrating my son's following day wedding, and what a memorable time it turned out.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and great place for small children”
Reviews.Author: buttercupgirdlebuns
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in The Orient Express. All the staff were really really nice to our little boy (age 3) and gave him loads of attention. We booked a triple room and it was pretty small and the 3rd bed would only suit a child. But it was clean, in an excellent location, and the little basement swimming pool was ideal to burn off energy during the heat of the day. Good breakfast - lots of choice, and lots of fun playing backgammon with the staff in the bar. Also recommend the cafe about 100yds right out of the hotel, on the corner. Excellent tram viewing position (for small boys!) and really good fresh pizza and soup.

Reviews.Title: “The Orient Express Hotel is a great hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: Heiniger
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul so I had no idea where to stay. Tripadvisor reviews were consitently very good so we decided to stay at the Orient Express Hotel. It was as we hoped, the hotel is within walking distance to the key historic sites and has a tram going past the front door, so location really is ideal. The standard of the hotel is very good in all areas, especially the staff who are without a doubt the most friendly we have encountered anywhere in the world. My husband's birthday fell on the week were at the hotel, and the staff noticed this on his passport so they arranged through me a surprise cake and sang 'happy birthday' for him which was just exceptional. On arrival the lovely custmer liasion manager, Ceren, welcomed us and gave us a complimentary welcome lemonade drink and snack and ran through the practicalities of visiting Istanbul, this was first rate. I have noticed some people on Tripadvisor felt the room size was on the small side, we didn't feel this ourselves, the room was just fine for us. Overall this hotel provides value for money, is in the right place and has excellent staff. The sky is the limit in Istanbul when it comes to flash hotels, and you will pay dearly for them. The rates we paid at the Orient Express was lower than similar standard hotels we looked in to. This hotel had a very nice feel about it, met our needs, and we will stay there again next time without doubt. Also if you need a gym, their nearby sister hotel has one and this can be used free of charge - about a 2 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in both restuarant and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jobiKent
Reviews.Content: The staff make this hotel one of the best we have stayed in. The location is excellent for visiting the the "must see" places. The Imbat restuarant is wonderful, good food, brilliant service and stunning views. The rooms, though small, are spotlessly clean. We were treated as honoured guests and made so welcome. We would certainly recommend this hotel and restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest most helpful staff EVER”
Reviews.Author: greenhippoUk
Reviews.Content: Dont miss this hotel if you appreciate friendly helpful staff. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by Ceren we had a fabulous time - this hotel is only minutes away from the popular attractions. Dont miss eating in the hotel restaurant Imbat - lovely food and a fabulous view. The pool was a wonderful relief from the outside temperatures. All of the staff were lovely , they even waved us off as we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - good service and location”
Reviews.Author: Rach_Dad
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. Near all the touristy sites of sultanahmet and also near Eminou for visits to bosphorus and galata and near tram station. The service provided to us was excellent. We were given an orientation when we arrived - I forgot the name of the person but he was very helpful. We had taken 3 rooms - 1 of our room was facing the road and hence noisy and they shifted us to a room at the back the next day. The restaurant in the hotel - Imbat is very good too. Kids enjoyed the pool for 2 days but unfortunately left their costumes on the second day in the pool shower area and could not find it. The hotel staff was very helpful in telling us about all tourist attractions. The rooms are small but the service, location and the price make up for it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is interested in a budget stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds we slept in during our three month tour of Europe, marvelous view from the room when we awoke.”
Reviews.Author: mtjwl
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier with the accommodations, friendly, helpful staff, will stay at the Orient Express again. Two-night stay was perfect, very close to major sites throughout the Golden Horn like the Blue Mosque. Staff is superb, thanks so much to Ceren and her team, always greeted when we entered the hotel. Nice complimentary tea, tasty breakfast, good happy hour. Great value for the money. Wonderful meals while enjoying scenic Istanbul from the rooftop restaurant. We will be back in the spring, and will definitely stay at the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a city break”
Reviews.Author: ClassicWineClive
Reviews.Content: Staff both helpful and friendly. Rooms a little small-ish but smart, cool and well fitted out. Roof-top restaurant excellent value, great views, and superb food. Hotel in great location for site seeing tourists. Indoor swimming pool very welcome. We would definitely use this hotel again if we ever return to Istanbul. Free internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Accidental tourist”
Reviews.Author: Megatron-Atkinson
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friends actually booked into this hotels sister hotel down the road but due to a double booking we got moved and we could'nt have been happier, a superb hotel with great facilities (swimming pool, restaurant, bar) and welcoming, helpful staff. absolute gem, I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Central with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Warflea
Reviews.Content: I was only here for a few days, but this hotel was easy walking distance from the Blue Mosque and the plethora of things to see around there. There is a swimming pool downstairs which was clean and a lovely way to cool off after a day's touring. They have quite a breakfast spread that came included in the price. My only real complaint was that there was a rather persistant smell of cigarette smoke in the room. All in all, a good place to rest your head at the end of the day. The internet access was fast but restricted a few sites.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i have stayed in Staff very friendly and they make you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: salmaLondon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels over the years but this was one of the best. The staff were extrremely helpful and they gave a personal touch and made us feel at home. The food was great and so was the room.The locality of the hotel is very convenient for the top sights and mainly walking distance from the hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel to all the visitors.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is ditto”
Reviews.Author: Our_Man_in_Zuerich
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews are true, 100% true. Great location, lovely, friendly, down to earth, trustworthy, very helpful staff, made to feel at home and very secure, in what was, until then, a totally unknown city. This would be my port of call whenever next in the city, without question. Did not try out restaurant til the last evening, unfortunately. Once again the staff in the "Imbat" restaurant were just so nice. A special thank you to "Enver", the young guy who served us, who made the experience extremely enjoyable for my Son and me. Even if you do not stay at the hotel, try out the restaurant anyway. You will not be disappointed with the food, the service or the view.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, top location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Golbourn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short break. The location is ideal - within easy walking distance of the Tokapi, Blue Mosque etc, restaurants, and the harbour for ferry trips. Trams pass the hotel but we didn't have to use them. First impressions on arriving at the hotel are smiles all round at reception and it stayed that way until we left. The people at the hotel couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful. Ceren, the guest relations manager, was particularly helpful. The rooftop restaurant is first class, with superb service from Levent and his staff. We ate there on our first night, and returned there for our last meal. As other reviews have said, the rooms are a bit small but you don't spend much time there, and this is a feature of the old town where all the hotels are smallish in old buildings. The room was spotless and cleaned every day. You can sit comfortably in the lounge at reception and there's the bar (with happy hour) and cocktails in the rooftop restaurant late afternoon/early evening. And we loved Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Dervishswirl
Reviews.Content: The location of the Orient Express Hotel is just perfect for any one wanting to spend a short break ( or longer if you have the time!) to get to know as much of Istanbul as possible. Most things are within walking distance (eg Blue Mosque, Ferry Station and Hamams). For any sights that aren't, you can hop on a tram and you have a choice of 2 stops which are both walking distance from the hotel. The room was comfortable and cleaned every day. Fresh towels were provided on a daily basis. The roof top restaurant was a delight too - both the food and views were good. It is small so you need to book a table if you want to have a table with a view! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and found the staff extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Hilary55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here, lovely staff rooms slightly jaded but still clean and cared for. The Rooftop Restaurant may be have the best view and food in town. Excellent location within an easy walk of the Blue Mosque , the harbour, Topkapi etc.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic. Nice & helpfull people, clean rooms & an magnificent panoramic restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JackBelgium
Reviews.Content: Nice & helpfull people, clean & silent rooms. And a magnificent panoramic restaurant !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malcie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights in Istanbul at the Orient Express Hotel which we booked on TA recommendations. This is an ideal hotel for exploring the historic peninsular & pretty much all the sites on the peninsular are within walking distance. The rooms are on the small side but are clean & reasonably equipped - TV, room safe, minibar, shower (no bath) & much needed aircon (temp was mostly 30C + during our stay). Ours also had a tiny balcony. The room also seemed fairly quiet - we didn't hear the early morning call to prayer once & judging by the calls later in the day they're pretty loud when you're outside. The hotel has a bar on the ground floor, a roof restaurant, a separate breakfast room & a small indoor pool. The staff are very friendly & helpful and the very reasonable price we paid included transport to & from Attaturk airport. All in all this hotel was an excellent choice & I can thoroughly recommend it. I can also recommend Istanbul which is very impressive. The mosques and palaces are beautiful & in some cases very ancient. Transport is cheap with a mixture of trams, buses, metro & ferries, all seemingly at one set price (1.6 TRY). Yellow cabs are literally everywhere so never a problem if you want one - quite likely they will hail you. The ferries are an easy 15 minutes walk from the hotel & open up possibilites for exploring along the Golden Horn & Bospheros. We did a 2 hour boat trip one day & tried hopping on a ferry up the Bospheros on another occasion - would have liked to have done more but we ran out of time. We really enjoyed the food in Istanbul and found it reasonably priced & very often in interesting locations - we ate on pavements, rooftops, quay sides, under the Galata Bridge (much nicer than it sounds), beside mosques and one night in an ancient Roman Cistern. A few tips: If your finances will run to it stay longer than we did - the area has a lot to offer and 6 days wasn't really enough. Do have a fish roll at Eminonu where the ferries are - they're cheap & delicious (think of a burger stall but with fresh fish rolls served up by a man in traditional uniform and you'll get the idea). Do bring sensible shoes as quite a lot of the streets are cobbled. Oh - & do stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “central located hotel with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Rrummen
Reviews.Content: Pros: Pefect location, you can walk in 5 minutes (up hile) to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace and tram stop closeby to Taksim Perfect service: we arrived at 10 AM by night train..first we got an quick instruction what to see in the neighboorhood and how to get there by public transport..after that our room was already ready. Nice restaurant on top from which you can see the Bosporus Good selection of breakfast Good price: we used the cash discount option Cons: very small detail: Air conditioning in the breakfast room was a bit too cold

Reviews.Title: “good choice, great location, looking forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: megcheshire_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have really enjoyed our five night stay at this hotel. It was our first time to Istanbul, we chose this hotel after reading the reviews. Staff are lovely and the location is great. within walking distance of the sights. The room was on the small side but was comfortable and very clean. It was lovely to be able to use the pool in the evening after a long hot day. Shame breakfast is not served on the rooftop as it is a lovely view and would be a lovely start to the day. Loved Istanbul, looking forward to going back and will stay at the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Brommers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this trip in March. We made the choice because of the price, and because I have always enjoyed Agatha Christie stories, and I have worked for a railway company. We wondered what we had let ourselves in for when we arrived. The road outside the hotel is also a tramline, and at certain times of the day, the Police block off the hotel to road traffic. The taxi driver, however, carried our very heavy bag from the adjacent road, and we arrived at the hotel. It doesn't look much from the outside, but once in, the hotel has a charm and a grace that is particularly charismatic. From the first arrival to the day of the departure three days later, the Customer Service was excellent. We had to wait for a taxi one day, and whilst this happened, the hotel staff made us a cup of Apple Tea. There is 2for1 in the Hotel Bar in the late afternoon, with complimentary sandwiches and free orange juice. On the Saturday, one chap was celebrating his birthday, and the hotel staff dimmed the lights and suprised the family with a birthday cake with candles. We all got a slice, even though we didn't know the gentleman! The hotel is 100 metres away from the tram stop. Just 1.5 Turkish Lira takes you on one journey to the end of the line, and most tourist places can be reached from the tramline within walking distance (even in the heat). The hotel is also about 500 metres from the numerous ferry crossings to the other side (ie; Asia), and the ferry crossing is only 1 Turkish Lira, and well worth the experience. I wouldn't try and organise my sightseeing tours in advance in the future, because all of the locals are friendly in all parts of the city. We felt completely safe whilst we were there, and do it yourself travel is so cheap. Took me by surprise when taxi drivers refused tips, and even more by suprise when shop proprieters refused to haggle because they have to charge the same price for Turkish citizens as they do for tourists. A refreshing change. The restaurant view on the top of the hotel is superb, although the food wasn't as good as the description, but still quite palatable. The breakfast service was truly excellent. Although we were on time on all three days, some people on each day who arrived just before or even a few minutes after 10am still had a full choice of the breakfast offer. That's a first in all my time stopping at hotels all over the World! The swimming pool in the basement is small, but quaint, and the arrangements for the changing rooms are quite easy to follow. A yellow towel is provided in the locker, and you leave your key in the locker after you've put your towel in the wash basket and finished. The rooms are small, and designed to emulate a sleeping car compartment on a train. The "big bed" only just fitted in the room, and was a conventional double bed (certainly not a Queen size). Don't forget to take drinking water with you, and brush your teeth with drinking water. Tap water is definitely a no no. Oh, and if you are a train spotter, the railway station is just round the corner. Not much traffic, and more like Wigan Wallgate than the "International Station", but it has historical flavour, and is very busy when the odd train does run. Highlights of the weekend were the Grand Bazaar, the ferry trip across the Bosphorous, eating great food at various street vendours, and the Saturday night in the Muslim quarter watching the locals viewing Wimbledon and puffing away at their lemon flavoured "waterpipes". You must stay in this hotel at least once. We had a great time, but I still cannot say thankyou in Turkish without the locals giggling at my mispronounciation. Thankyou for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay For a Long Weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BillyBoyUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orient Express with my wife and two friends over the weekend to celebrate my 50th birthday and to visit the old part of Istanbul. The Orient is a super hotel, very clean and tidy and in a great location, close to all the main attractions. A great breakfast on offer together with a complementary tea in the afternoon. The roof top garden is a must for a cold beer and amazing views. The staff were very helpful and friendly, all speaking very good English. In particular Mehmet, the waiter and the reception staff could not do enough to make our enjoyable and helped with booking excursions etc and nothing was too much trouble for them. Word got out of my birthday and the staff produced a surprise birthday cake and gift one afternoon which was a really nice gesture and much appreciated. We have not visited Istanbul before and did have some reservations but we had a great time, saw lots and would recommend both a the visit to Istanbul and if you are going to stay then I would really recommend the Orient Hotel as the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: moriniman
Reviews.Content: Would endorse most of the other reviews of the Orient Express, in particular the friendly helpful staff and the standard of cleanliness as well as the excellent location in the historical quarter of Istanbul. Room was a little small but it was the low ceilings that probably emphasised the size along with the minibar/fridge that made access to the window tricky. We had a front room on to the street - not a problem as traffic (apart from trams and deliveries) is banned from the street. Only odd noise came from one very late night guest and a muezzin who seemed to think that prayer at 3.47am was essential........ The beds were a little firm - no very hard actually - in contrast to the pillows which were very good. Bathroom fine and shower worked well. Aircon controllable (remote) and effective as well as relatively quiet. Rooftop restaurant was very good and well worth eating there to take in the view and sup a beer or two as well. Reasonably priced and good quality. Not as enthused as some about breakfast - perfectly reasonable but would prefer some more fresh fruit at the expense of three choices of olives. Bread nice. Choice can be a bit limited later on. Orient Express location is excellent - walk essentially to everywhere a tourist would need to go and the tram/metro combination to Ataturk airport is very easy if you are travelling reasonably light - saves quite a bit on taxis and at busy times can be quicker. Overall good value and certainly would use again for a short tourist break in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, exceptional service from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: MIB15
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel, it is was a very pleasing experience from the minute you arrive to the time you leave. We were greated by Ceren and he introduced us to what we could do in Istanbul, he gave us maps of the local area and maps of the metro stations. This guy is fantastic, you can ask him anything about Istanbul day or night and if he does not know the answer he will find out for you. We must of asked him a million questions (in 2 days) and he did not stop smiling! The rooms are a nice size, there is a safe in the room (which you can use free of charge). There is individual air conditioning units in each room. There is also an indoor swimming pool in the hotel, it is not a massive pool but it is big enough for a decent swim. There is free internet access which is very fast. We stayed bed and breakfast and the breakfast was very nice. There were water bottles provided each day. The hotel is about a minutes walk away from the nearest Metro stop and about a 5/10 minute stroll from all of the main attractions near Sultanahmet. If you want to go for a walk along the Bosporus, this is also a 10 minutes stroll away. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the location and the service you will receive from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was all the good things in the reviews”
Reviews.Author: travelinstyleUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week recently, and I would have no hesitation at all in recommending it to anyone travelling to Istanbul. The welcome we received was outstanding from all the staff, who were exceptionally polite and welcoming and helpful throughout our stay, without exception. the hotel is beautifully located for those wishing to sightsee Istanbul as it is very centrally located in the old part, the rooms maybe a little on the small side, but one has to bear in mind that it is situated in the older part of town. the rooms are always very clean, and one other lovely feature is that the hotel has its own swimming pool whichwas a boon after a hot day's sightseeing. thanks to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have had a better place to stay for my 65th birthday”
Reviews.Author: paulannie
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 13th June to be met by Ceren, the Guest Relations Manager, as well as a very friendly receptionist. Over a welcome drink, and while the receptionist sorted out our room and paperwork, Ceren gave us a very helpful introduction to the hotel and the surrounding attractions. We then went to our room (703 on the top bedrooms floor) to unpack and found it to be very clean, nicely furnished with a nice bathroom. It was not particularly big and the view (at the back of the hotel) could have been better. On having a look around the hotel, we discovered our room was immediately below the restaurant. This was to have a bad impact on our first night! After a walk round, and being impressed by, the immediate area and having had a meal, we went back to the hotel for an early night (we'd been up since 5 o'clock). This is where our problems started. We were continually disturbed by chairs and/or tables being scraped across the floor of the restaurant (which can be open until 2am) as well as the noise of thehotel's air conditioning unit which appeared to be somewher adjacent to our room. Eventually, at 12.30, I went to reception to ask to be moved but they were unable to do it for that night, the hotel being full. However, he said we would be moved the next day. Don't hold your breath, I thought. Next morning, after we had a really nice breakfast, we went to reception and a different receptionist knew of our complaint and immediately offered us the choice of 2 rooms on the front of the hotel. We took 502, which was very nice, light and airy. The breakfast room was nicely set out & furnished and the available choices were substantial. There was always a choice of hot food as well as a good selection of fruit, meats, cheeses, cereals, breads, jams, honey, tea, coffee, etc. You certainly could start your day well fed! Each afternoon at 4 pm, the hotel provided very welcome complimentary tea and sandwiches in the Wagon Bar. The bar also had a happy hour between 4 and 6 when local drinks were 2 for 1. Apart from the very minor hiccup on the first night, I can honestly say we found this a great hotel to stay at. We couldn't fault it. The service from ALL the staff was excellent: they were extremely helpful,courteous and very, very pleasant. Nothing was too much bother for them. Our room, although not huge, was very comfortable and kept really clean by the pleasant Bulgarian chambermaids. The sparkingly clean bathroom was adequate with an over the bath shower (screen was the full length of the bath). The hotel location could not have been better: all the major sites were within walking distance or a short tram ride away. The tram system was excellent; a flat cost of TL1.5 (60 pence) for any journey. The same cost for a ferry journey so you could go from Europe to Asia for 60 pence: cheapest inter-continental travel anywhere! We found the tram especially useful as my wife fractured her foot 3 weeks before we travelled. She gamely hobbled around using a walking stick but was very wary of the somewhat uneven pavements. She always was given a seat on a tram! I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and, if we ever go back to Istanbul, (we would both like to do so) we'll definitely stay at the Orient Express. Finally, on my actual birthday, we were having afternoon tea when in walked Ceren and other staff with a birthday cake for me, singing "Happy Birthday"! They also gave me a small, but very appreciated, gift. Lovely; the 'icing on the cake' to our stay!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in our trip”
Reviews.Author: KimChrisGladigau
Reviews.Content: We booked over the internet at The Orient Express Hotel web site for 4 nights for the beginning of our independent Turkey holiday. We were met at the airport as arranged. On arrival to the hotel, we were welcomed by Ediz and Ali, and a cup of hot apple tea. Ediz gave us helpful information and maps of what to do in Istanbul. Our room was lovely and very well cleaned. We used the room safe. The breakfasts were the best in Turkey. Location to major attractions the best in Istanbul. We returned to the hotel for 2 nights after exploring the Agean Coast. Every single staff member was very friendly and helpful. Our tram ride to Ataturk airport was easy - the hotel is only 100 metres from the Gulhane tram station. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. This hotel was an oasis in our trip.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and staff”
Reviews.Author: senwei
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel and good value. We stayed in Istanbul for 3 nights. This hotel just lcoated by the train station Guhan. Although some noisy, still highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: ohiobomber
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 days at this hotel.staff were very friendly and helpfull . the hotel also has a terrace restaurant. it has a great viewpoint. You can see all istanbul from there. The location of the hotel very close to historical sites. i recommend you to stay at this hotel if you visit istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is what gives this hotel 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Acuhealth
Reviews.Content: Great staff at this hotel!! Everyone was very kind and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. One front desk gentleman even tried to help us track down the head of the Orthodox church in Istanbul!! (This was something on our agenda requested by my mother in law). This seemed to be a far fetched request, but he tried 3 times for us! I give this place 5 stars for the guy even trying to place the call that many times. Great location if you're checking the city out and decent places to eat nearby. It's a great hotel if you want to access the Spice and Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus. Rooms are small and no frills, but you don't spend that much time there anyway and the buffet is good for morning fuel up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on busy street street”
Reviews.Author: prjb
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly helpful staff. Basic double rooms a little small, but clean and reasonably priced. Hotel is situated on main street with tram line running outside the front of the hotel. Very noisy during the day but not too bad at night. Rooms on the back of the hotel probably much quieter. Well located to see all of the sights and attractions of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Mkoofer
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Istanbul, largely thanks to the friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff. The room was functional, but a little small, as one would expect for a hotel in this price range. Location was great for restaurants and all the old city attractions. The tram ran right outside. A great bonus was the swimming pool in the basement and daily refreshments at 4:30. We strongly recommend Orient Express as a moderately priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: ItsNotRocketScience
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent location for exploring the old town and near to the ports for cruises up the Bosphorus and the Galata bridge. Staff: Iâ€™ve stayed in quite a few hotels all over the world and the staff here were the friendliest Iâ€™ve ever met. Couldnâ€™t have done more for us or been nicer.
