I found in general that the Turkish people we met were incredibly helpful but the staff here went out of their way to make things easy for us. Rooms and amenities: Our room was one of the smallest they have (we actually ended up in this hotel thanks to an upgrade) but there was still plenty of room for me and my friend to spread out in. Very clean and maintained everyday by exceptionally cheery housekeeping staff. We were at the back of the hotel which didnâ€™t have a super view but was very quiet. Also there is a hotel pool in the basement and a really lovely restaurant upstairs on the roof terrace. Breakfast: Massive selection which varied day by day. They also have a complementary afternoon tea session.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit and again would highly recommend a stay”
Reviews.Author: EdJames
Reviews.Content: Excellent service levels (staff were always trying to go over and above what they needed to do), great location and rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mokhtars
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul for a 4 days 3 nights trip with my mother and booked this hotel over the net. The moment we stepped in we were greeted by warm customer service whom provided us with useful information for our travel. The location is smack in the middle of the old town within walking distance of historical places and the tram station. My mother can't walk far but we managed from the hotel to almost all those places within our plan. We walked to Hagia Sofia, The Cisterns, The Blue Mosque and Spice Bazaar. Rooms are a bit small but we spent most of the day walking about. It was neat and clean and such a friendly atmosphere. The hotel has a rooftop restaurant that overlooks the Golden Horn. It was romantic and absolutely gorgeous. The food was a bonus too. Delicious. I would recommend this to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Ruud013
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the last week of may 2009 and had a lovely time. Istanbul is a enormous nice city with many things to do and to see. The staff at the hotel was okay: fast and friendly. The room was small, but clean. The breakfast (included) was very good. The hotel was near the most important monuments / buildings etc. The restaurant on the roof has a fantastic view and you can eat there very well. Ruud Gerrits en Karin de Jonge Nederland

Reviews.Title: “ideal location from which to explore this captivating city”
Reviews.Author: Emailer
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel,Staff very friendly and helpful. This was our 38th wedding anniversary,and we couldn't have wished for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Scotfratheborder
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Orient Express from 9th May to 16th May although small hotel with clothing space in the room a bit on the small side you soon forget that as overall the hotel friendliness,cleanliness,food are second to none.We arrived on the Saturday the 9th May and were greeted with a cup of Turkish tea and given a map and very good info.on were to go and how to get around the city.The bed were change at least three time and the towels every day.The breakfasts were super plenty for all tastes and fresh they have a happy hour in downstairs bar from 16.00 to 19.00 where you buy one drink get one free also they give you afternoon tea with bagel type snacks filled with cheese & salad free of charge.The best place for me was the roof top restaurant with great views down the Bospheros where the food was superb with a nice atmosphere and good service.The cost compares very well and even better value than outside restaurants.Nothing was too much of a problem for the friendly staff even before we went I gained good info from Ceren Cipa,Guest Relation Manager she was lovely. The Hotel situation is a big asset right in the centre of old part of Istanbul close(walking distance) to all major sights Blue Mosque,boats to Asian side etc.It also has a small swimming pool in the basement with a bar which is very well kept. So would recommend this hotel to friends and associate and say you will not be let down. Jim McKie from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MaggieFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful and friendly staff in every part of hotel. Welcome tea and information in lounge which made one relax and feel at home immediately after arrival. Staff available immediately when required. Room service fast and meticulous. Pleasant atmosphere in attractive "Orient Express" bar. Good restaurant on pleasant roof terrace with flowers. Only slightly negative comment, the rooms and the double beds are a little small. The hotel is within a short walking distance to all famous sights and the boats to the bosporous and there is a tram right outside the hotel. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definitels choose it again. Sheila and Horst Schwerzel, Neu Isenburg

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DougLondon
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express Hotel is very good hotel for sightseeing. It is excellently placed - with for all the major sites within easy walking distance and there is a tram stop just outside for those just slightly further away. We were very pleased we chose this part of Istanbul as a base. We stayed for 3 days. The area is well served with restaurants and bars again within walking distance.The rooftop restaurant has great views of the Bosphorous and served the best food we had in Istanbul. It was not pricey either and is to be recommended. The only downside is the rooms are small, but can be lived with for short stays. In an area like this there is some street noise from the mosques / trams, but this did not affect our stay. Staff were friendly and the service was good and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WIMBORNE43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, spent 2 nights in the hotel and just loved it. What can I say about the hotel other than wow!!!! The staff where outstanding, freindly, helpful. The hotel was more than we expected, very clean. The room we had was great, 3rd floor, faced the street, quiet, bathroom was outstanding. Lots of room. The Trukish delight treat that we recevied on our chech-in, in our room was a pleasent treat. The restaurant, was just outstanding, great service, outstanding food, great wine, the veiw has to been seen, all of Istanbul to veiw. The location of the hotel in Sultanahmet could not have been better. You are within a 20 min walk to anywhere, Blue Mosque, Grand Bizzare, port to go to Asia. Pick a place, and you can walk there. We would stay at the Orient Express Hotel again. The hotel was just GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “The welcome and helpfulness were second to none”
Reviews.Author: pandaDevon
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived were treated like special guests and the staff were always incredibly helpful and friendly. The location was perfect, the breakfast delicious, and the extras, like afternoon (apple) tea, just made you feel at home. We stayed for a week and enjoyed every day. The room was slightly small but nothing unusual for a hotel at the centre of a major city. We used the hotel pool nearly every day and the roof-top restaurant for our last two evenings, which was very pleasant as it removed the hassle of trying to find somewhere nice to eat.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous hotel”
Reviews.Author: turkey27
Reviews.Content: We loved to stay at this hotel, staff is very friendly especially Fatih.Perfectly located to all the attractions.Excellent breakfast . We love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel situated on a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HorstHorst
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect both for position (you get to all major sightseeings within 10 minutes walk) and staff service. It has incredible terrase restaurant at the roof with Bosporus view . We were with 6 people and enjoyed our stay. It was perfect. The service was great! Very friendly staff. When we arrived we got a cup ot turkish tea and an explaination of the map and the most important sightseeings! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel feeling, great location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: antipodesLondon
Reviews.Content: Centrally located within easy 10-15 minutes walk from all the main tourist sites and the ferry boat docks for the Bosphorus and Asian side. Very close to Metro stop to visit places like Taksim Square etc. Views of Bosphorus from restaurant on top floor in the evening. Staff are very friendly and helpful making guests feel very much 'at home'. Nice touches such as free afternoon tea and snacks between 4.30 and 6.30 pm to relax after your day of activity. Rooms are good, comfortable and well appointed but tend to be on the small side; I guess that is common for the density of the area . We were there for 5 nights. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with great hospatility and warmness”
Reviews.Author: albertje
Reviews.Content: a very nice week in Istanbul.A beautiful city wth elegant atmosphere.Pleasant kind people and architectaryl very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ulysse1
Reviews.Content: Very pleasent hotel, clean and homey, with an extremely friendly personal and a great retro charm. The rooms may be a bit small, but it didn't bother us. From our room, the view wasn't particulary special but the situation was really quiet and good. Including a small but nice swimming pool and we regret not going to eat at the restaurant who seemed outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, perfect hotel service”
Reviews.Author: soloCzechRep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect both for position (you get to all major sightseeings within 10 minutes walk) and staff service. It has incredible terrase restaurant at the roof with Bospor view and swimming pool. I would definetely stay in this hotel again if return to Istanbul. Highly recommended. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: k4m4l
Reviews.Content: Orient Express We arrived here and initially were a bit sceptical as we saw how old Sulanhamet actually looked. However, the hotel was totally different once we got inside. This hotel has no driveway but that wasnâ€™t an issue. The porter was at the door instantly ready to take our bags. Check in was really easy. Reception staff is very nice. While our check-in paperwork was being finalised, we were served some apple tea and we had a customer relations lady talk us through the area, give us maps, show us where to go and explain different things to us. We found this to be really good as we have not had this service before and it is helpful to have this on first arrival. Some people say the rooms are small. This is not wrong but it is very clean, bathroom is clean and neat. At the end of the day if you will be out of the room the whole day, you only need it as a place for your bags and to sleep. Although, after a while the bags start coming in your way. Room has tea making service, in room electronic safe, and we were served with turkish delight in the room. Tv is very small. We also managed to connect to wireless network which was handy. Tram stops, ferries all nearby. You need to visit the rooftop restaurant. The views are amazing. Downfalls: The breakfast area is in the basement and therefore no windows or sunlight in the morning and so feels quite stale. Not much variety served. Very simple breakfast but has enough to fill you up. The room walls are paper thin. We were facing the main road (ask for a room at the back). There was constant traffic noise and constant tram noise. We could also hear all other room doors being opened and closed, people talking etc. Did get a bit annoying. However, we could not hear between rooms. I think for the area that it is in, it is a nice hotel with nice staff. However, due to the noise we experienced while in our room, I would either choose a different room. Location is excellent. Cannot go wrong with that.

Reviews.Title: “This is the ideal location for Sultanahmet & Bosphorus ferries”
Reviews.Author: chatoUk
Reviews.Content: The service level was excellent from the moment we arrived, with a welcome drink & a personal introduction to the hotel & Istanbul by very helpful staff to our early departure 5 days later. Of particular note was the top floor restaurant. The menu was not extensive, but the food was excellent & once again the service was friendly & attentive. The location is stunning with stunning views over the Bosphorus. It is worthwhile visiting the hotel for the restaurant alone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mags0212
Reviews.Content: The before and after service from the staff of this hotel was second to none. On arrival we were greeted with apple tea whilst the reception did the paperwork. The rooms were lovely and the breakfast was great with plenty to choose from. The staff were brilliant and they even arranged a birthday cake for one of our party purely because they noticed from her passport details that it was her birthday! They were extremely helpful with everything and we would all definitely stay there again, in fact the "boys" are now going to stay there on their Istanbul trip. It was in a perfect location, walking distance from most of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, a very friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: avalonchauffeuring
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Isatnbul was a 60th birthday suprise for my wife and being a special occasion and with so much choice of hotels in Istanbul I was a lillte nervous about picking the right place. I had looked at the other reviews on the Orient Express and along with the other couple we went with we decided that the Orient Express was a safe option. Well I need not have worried, it was equal to the good reviews and our expectations. It started with some excellent communications via email with the hotel guest relations manager, Ceren Cipa, who went out of her way to make sure the surprise for my wife was complete. She even placed a birthday cake and a gift in our room for my wife, both un-asked for but most welcome. On arrival at the hotel from the airport, via a taxi that Ceren had arranged, we were greeted by smiling faces and very curtious attention by the lobby staff who asked us to rest in the front lounge and take some rolls and apple tea, all complimentary. It all added to a very civilised start to our break. That attention to service was present thoughout our break, nothing being too much trouble for them to assist us. Their suggestions for the trips we took around Istanbul were spot on, with their booking for a private guide was the best idea, and one I would reccomend doing. The rooms were on the small size but adequate and very clean and tidy. The breakfast was very good and you were not rushed to get out if you were a little late in coming down. The rooftop restaurant offers some good views and the meal we had in there on our first night was very good and quite reasonably priced. The hotel is in a very good postion for walking to all the main tourist sites and is about 25/35 mins taxi drive from the airport. All in all the Orient Express enhanced our visit to Istanbul and we would have no hestiation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “What lovely staff at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeyutt
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our three night stay at the Orient Express. Location was great. Ten minutes walk from Haga Sophia and the Blue Mosque and in walking distance from most of the rest of the sights. The park next to the Tokapia palace is to be recommended for a stroll.Rooms were comfortable and clean and very peaceful. Food at the restaurant in the evening was not only good but very good value - no more expensive than restaurants in the surrounding area and beautifully presented and you can enjoy lovely views from the rooftop. Breakfast was not really that exciting, not enough choice of fruit, and the hot food wasn't very tasty so disappointing. However the staff made the difference between an ordinary hotel and a really good one that we would recommend to our friends. The staff at reception were so helpful (even lending us their laptop to do online check-in when the internet cafe was busy!) The waiters and bar staff were efficient and quick to serve but also warm and friendly. Really excellant service. Also found the pick-up service from the airport was so useful and good value for money. All round a really good hotel to use for a trip to Istanbul - we'd come again! Linda Utting and Di Langridge

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: PukkaParis
Reviews.Content: The Orient helped make our first trip to Istanbul a very positive experience. The staff were just lovely. Welcoming, helpful, considerate and efficient. We stayed 6 nights and all went smoothly. They surprised the both of us by bringing out a birthday cake and a present on my partners birthday! I had no idea. This all occurred in their lovely top floor restaurant that we recommend. Great views from indoors with a large outdoor terrace in good weather. The location is excellent. A short walk to most major sights and a quick tram or cheap taxi (taxis not recommended during the day) to the Taksim nightlife on the other side. The clean rooms were cozy but not large with firm but comfortable beds. The only floors that have views of the water are on the 7th at the back. The front looks over a busy street that calms down at night. Double glazing in our room was welcome. I think it is so throughout. The staff were a little bit vocal in the morning if you wanted to sleep in and the walls a little thin. Nothing a polite request couldn't solve. Our room was right under the popular restaurant but it never kept us awake. In a nutshell: great value, location and staff. Comfortable and clean with a lovely indoor pool that is open till midnight...

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TMBMadrid
Reviews.Content: Lovely people, clean and nicely located. Breakfast could be better, but it wasn't bad either. Travelled with a 2 yr. old baby and everybody treated him like a prince.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and ideal location 3night citybreak from UK”
Reviews.Author: DandA50
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly hotel staff were highlight of our stay. All the staff made that extra effort to make us feel welcome. Hotel is in a great location for walking around the historical centre of Istanbul. Spectacular views from the rooftop restaurant combined with good food and wine, reasonably priced . We particularly enjoyed the fresh fish menu. Small touches such as the complimentary tea and snacks in afternoon to relax after the walking tour were much appreciated. The free internet and print facility was helpful for on line check in and email check. Rooms were on the small side and the hotel is in a busy location , but the convenience of the location outweighed any disadvantages , since we wanted to be central and within easy distance of main city sights.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town”
Reviews.Author: HasaDelaware
Reviews.Content: My first time to Turkey and Istanbul. I found this hotel through the Internet and had contact with them before I arrived through e-mail. I stayed 7 nights and found the entire experience at the hotel outstanding. The staff were there for you from the airport to the first time you walked through the door. They offered help in many small ways. The hotel is located is a perfect place to see all that is to be seen in Istanbul by walking or tram that runs in front of the hotel. The price for the service was outstanding. I would return there without question.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice but didn't wow us”
Reviews.Author: jdotwdot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my wife and was more or less happy with our stay. The hotel is well located, close to Topkapi Palace and along a tram line. Most elements of the hotel were very nice...good service, , a nice pool and an excellent rooftop restaurant which was our favorite part of the hotel. A few little things kept it from being a great hotel in our minds. First, the scent of cleaning products or air fresheners knocks you out in the hallways, our television was so old that there were no numbers left on the remote and the screen was tiny, and the regular cost of rooms just doesn't seem appropriate after staying in other hotels in Istanbul. If you can get a good deal on a room (as we did) I would recommend staying here but I would also add that if you don't care about a pool and are more concerned with a nice view and good value then you could do better with a smaller hotel. As an aside, other the restaurant at the hotel, I would encourage avoiding all the nearby places and venture into Beyoglu for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: LindaFors
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and the Orient Express played a large part in making it a wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived and were greeted with apple tea and lots of information about the city till the time we left we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. As other people have said the room are not the biggest but our room was very comfortable and we spend very little time there anyway. The turkish delight was much appreciated. As for Istanbul- we loved it and cant wait to return. we are hoping to visit again in October and take out two teenagers with us next time. I hope we can stay in the Orient Express again.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location”
Reviews.Author: supergrannyCheshire
Reviews.Content: On a recent short 3 night stay in Istanbul we stayed at the Orient Express Hotel. We were met on arrival by friendy helpful staff and checked into our clean twin bedded room on the 7th floor, easily accessed by a lift. As we arrived after dark we opted to eat in the Imbat terrace restaraunt and had a superb meal, with wine which was very reasonably priced. The fish of the day was excellent and we dined every night in the restaurant. On the 2nd evening we had to book as the restaurant is obviously a very popular venue. The rooms are clean and serviced daily with towels replaced each day. The location is central for all the main attractions and the Topkapi, Blu Mosque and Grand Bazaar all within walking distance and the excellent tram service which operates all over Istanbul stops almost outside the hotel. We would certainly stay here again if or when we return to Istanbul, a magical city where the people make you feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: EndaCoyle
Reviews.Content: The Orient express provided one of the best travel experiences I've had. Courteous and helpful staff, beautiful surroundings, excellent restaurants and bar. The hotel is ideally placed for sightseeing and is only a ten minute walk from the major attractions. We were greeted on arrival with Turkish tea and bites followed by a detailed guide as to how to get the best out of Istanbul. My travelling companions birthday was spotted on his passport by the staff who then surprised him with a cake the following evening. If you decide to stay in Istanbul I recommend you view their website. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tea70
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel, helpful stuff. The restaurant on the top floor was our favorite place. The cuisine and service were exceptional.Thank you for the wonderful time in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Touristy Stuff”
Reviews.Author: superrod
Reviews.Content: Service: Staff was professional. However, I felt there was something holding them back from being unprofessional and waiting for the moment to not be. They'll help you get to the sites and guide your way with a map Rooms: The standard rooms are TINY and OVERPRICED. There are not many suites so you'll probably get stuck with a standard rom. Make sure they don't face the main street because, starting at 5am, trolleys roll down the street every 5 minutes. They are loud and the drivers over-ring those bells. Bathrooms fit the room: small. You're gonna stub a toe and bump knees and elbows on things trying to maneuver around in there. I think these standard rooms (even with a double bed) are for one person. I had my girlfriend with me and I don't like hearing her having a #2 in the bathroom. Location: Great Location. Right down the street from Old City sites: Palace, Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, etc... Restaurant/Breakfast: Mediocre and for europeans watching their weight. They play Turkish music during your meal. It's great for 2 days and then starts getting annoying with the same 3 songs played repeatedly. Bar: Overpriced drinks like any other hotel bar. Overall: Mediocre but for those who want to be central to all the sites. You're paying over $100 for the location. If this hotel was in Uskudar, it've been $40/night at best.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Personal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LELEVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient express after a 9 day tour of Turkey with Sun Island/ Neon tours (who are amazing!) The Orient Express is in a fantastic location! Right in the heart of every where you want to be! The furthest place you have to walk is the Grand Bazaar and that only took about 10 minutes! The hotel itself is very pretty and personal, the staff are wonderful and helped us with everything (especially when our transport to the Airport showed up an hour late!) Lovely people. I would highly recommend this hotel for everything and if your staying a while it might be worth booking the 7th floor suite, which has a seperate sitting/ lounge area so you can spread out more as the rooms aren't huge (but thats Istanbul in general). 5/10 mins from the hotel is the old Orient Express Train station where you can watch the Prayer ritual of the Whirling Dirvishes and 5 mins up the street is the Underground cistern, Blue mosque, St Sophia the list goes on! Would definately stay again. Only one small fault with the hotel and that is the walls internally are very thin i could here everything that happened in the next room... everything. But the type of people who stay here are very quiet well travelled people that like something out of the ordunary I think, as all the other guests seemed lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ginge67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location for visiting all the sights. It is very easy to get your bearings. I didn't get lost once! The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Ayasofya Museum, Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar are all within walking distance. There is a tram stop right outside to get around the city - they are very easy to use. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and very helpful. They were always ready to give directions & recommendations etc. We didn't use the restaurant for a meal, but had the breakfast every morning. The breakfast was more than sufficient. Plenty to get you started for a busy day sight-seeing. They had a varied selection of foods, including things that I wouldn't normally have at home, but that's half the fun of travelling abroad and trying the local food. The hotel has complimentary tea & bread in bar during the afternoons which was a nice touch. The rooms are small, but very clean and had everything we needed. If I was returning to Istanbul, I would definitely stay at the Orient Express again. I would recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Toys_with_Time
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with Orient. Staff friendly and very helpful (from the cleaners to the front desk), location excellent with tram stop only 50m away or an easy walk to the main attractions (Topkapi, Hagria Sofia etc) or down to the ferries. Lots of local restaurants, shops etc to choose from. Had rear room so very quiet, no view but fine, smallish but clean and enough room to move around. Swimming pool not big but very usable and well heated for winter use. Breakfasts typical Turkish hotel but with some condescension to Western tastes and enough variety to keep us happy. Free internet use (get staff to show you the minor keyboard differences else you will have difficulties). I have been to Istanbul many times and would be happy to stay at Orient again. It is definitely a Turkish not an American hotel but if you want to experience Istanbul not transplanted USA then recommend it - it's a good 3 star hotel. Chris & Marian, Sydney January 2009

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Cookiematron
Reviews.Content: We have just reurned from four nights at the Orient Express. I have to start off by saying that all of the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. The location is great. It's right next to the #38 tram which goes to Sta. Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, and the Cisterns. If you want to walk, it's about ten minutes from all of these. The street where the hotel is located is lined with shops and reasonably-priced restaurants. There are two supermarkets nearby. The hotel has a very good, reasonably-priced rooftop restaurant. All very positive....Now, the negative points. The rooms, though very clean, are the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel, even by European standards. There is very little closet space and the only drawers are in the night-table (one night-table with one drawer for two people) and in the desk. (Two small drawers for papers.) The closet was not big enough for two. We had to leave clothes in our suitcases. (That's OK for a couple of nights, but I wouldn't want to do it for a week.) The bed was as hard as a rock, and we have a hard bed at home. It was impossible to get comfortable after a long day of touring. The heat was unbearable. We had to turn on the A.C. to be able to even be in the room. I had been told that the breakfast was wonderful, but I found it adequate, at best. The scrambled eggs (when there were eggs) had no taste. There were boiled eggs, but it would've been nice to have had a more tasty alternative. The yoghurt was excellent, and the assorted pastries were good as well. For those who like fruit, the selection was limited. My husband likes cheese and cold cuts for breakfast. The selection was poor. We didn't use the pool, but we did look at it. It did not appear to have been cleaned for quite some time. In short, this is not a bad hotel if you're prepared for a very normal three-star establishment. I would probably look for something else in the neighborhood of Sultanamet if I were to return to Istanbul. We weren't exactly unhappy, but we found the Orient Express too basic for the price and for its rating.

Reviews.Title: “A&P - Very Friendly Staff - Super Location!!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaPaulo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location. Close to all sites and transportation. Staff was very friendly and helpful to us with our daily questions about places to eat and how to get to places of that were out of the traditional sightseeing. Always on top when indicating buses, local ferries, tram. Also, upon arrival the staff have you sit at their cafe with a cup of tea and bagel (turkish one) while a really nice young lady explains to you your location, local of interest, day that sites are closed, etc. Loved it! Cons: I wish they had a electric tea pot/coffee service in the room. Also, we stayed in the 7th floor, which has a restaurant on the top. It got noisy sometimes at night. If you stay at the 6th floor down you may have a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiaAmersfoort
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for the third time. It is a very nice hotel, not to big, with very friendly staff. The restaurant on the top floor is very good and the view of the Bosporus beautiful. I was here with the new year and there was a very good menu. The food was wonderful. The rooms are not big but clean. So is the bathroom with every day clean towels. The location is perfect. All the important buildings are on walking distance, the blue mosk, the Topkapi palace, the Haya Sofia, the Galata Bridge, the spice bazar, the grand Bazar, you can all go there on foot. Breakfast is also good. In march this year I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more - wonderful hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: JohnLup
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful stay! Because we booked the room through the hotel website and stayed for 6 nights, the hotel arranged transport to and from the airport. We arrived late at night and the hotel transport was there and waiting. The staff was excellent - very friendly and always willing to help. The room itself was fairly small but perfectly comfy and clean for 2 people. The shower was incredible - probably one of the highlights of our stay. Breakfast was great - fresh bread and cheese, yogurt, cereals, fruit, eggs...we stuffed ourselves everyday. Finally - and perhaps most importantly - the location was perfect. The tram runs right in front of the hotel (and it's not loud at all - our room faced the street and we barely noticed), so it's a great landmark if you get turned around AND it's so easy to get around town. As far as walking goes - the hotel is about 10 minutes from Topkapi palace, Ayasophia and the Blue Mosque. It's also right around the corner from the train station and just a bit further on is the bus station. The whole trip went so smoothly and was so comfortable - we highly recommend the Hotel Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZDAZ
Reviews.Content: really good hotel location is great ( 100 m from nearest tramway station, close to sultanahmet, topkapi, ayasofia...) rooms are a little bit small but perfectly clean. the staff is smiling and very helpful ( yunus, the bartender was very helpful and helped me configuer the internet connection on my laptop :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RicciLondon
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel in a very convenient location. The hotel was extremely clean and attractively decorated. The restaurant had fabulous views and an interesting menu. Breakfast offers continental as well as Turkish cuisine. The staff were exceptionally helpful and sent someone with us to make sure we didn't get lost when going to see the Whirling Dervishes (highly recommended too). This hotel is ideal for a short sightseeing trip and gives great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel vastly underated”
Reviews.Author: milothedogg
Reviews.Content: we are so happy we stayed at the orient express hotel, the staff were fantastic and went out of there way to service us, the rooms were fantastic with nice touches that included turkish delight in the room and lavender on the pillows, the bed was super fantastic, and the room itself was spotless, we ate at the hotels rooftop restaurant and had fantastic food and service, the reception staff spoke great english and went out of there way to help us with any requests, as a 30 something couple who travel the world we know a great hotel, and this hotel lives up to all the reviews.. we would like to add a comment about the view from the room, as discussed by a previous review we were offered a choice of rooms front or back of the hotel and we chose the twin room on the back mentioned as the twin bedded rooms give you a full size american kingsize bedd and not a queen bed as in the front rooms with french windows, but we didnt go to istanbul to sit in a hotel room and complain about views you go to istanbul to enjoy the street life and fantastic dining options and a real melting pot of culture.... we have already booked our flights for istanbul again and we will be returning to the hotel orient express ... thank you for your great service sirckezi hotels ......

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: LPKLAS
Reviews.Content: We would not have such a great time in Istanbul if we did not stayed at Orient Express Hotel! I and my husband enjoyed staying there very much. Our room was on the 7th floor with the view of Bosphorus. As you have or will experience, Istanbul at night is very beautiful. The room was very warm, armed with all kind of facilities. Breakfast was delighting, many kind of things to eat for the breakfast. Moreover, service provided was excellent! No language barrier and people with smiley faces. Having restaurant on the terrace gives it competitive advantage and allows customers to feel comfortable at the hotel. We even did not go out when it was rainy cause we did not have to, everything was right there. I hope this helps you to make right choice and consider to experience Istanbul with the help of Orient Express Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel like family at the Orient Express!”
Reviews.Author: Anna P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express for 4 nights at the end of November. After the easy and very reasonable trip by train and tram from the airport we were delighted to discover that a tram stop was a minute walk away from our hotel and that the Blue Mosque was just a 5 minute walk away, plus many of the other tourist attractions of Sultanahmet. We arrived late in the evening; the Reception staff were so welcoming and friendly and our room, though small, was perfect for a short break, spotlessly clean, quiet, though facing the main road and the complementary Turkish Delight was indeed a delight! After a good night's sleep in our no-smoking room, the breakfast was fantastic - so much choice and the waiting staff were as friendly as the reception 'boys'. We had a very good meal in the rooftop restaurant with a view of the Topkapi Palace and a few very enjoyable swims in the lovely basement pool to ease our sightseeing-weary bods. Ask at Reception about good places to eat - for my birthday they recommended a great place, off the tourist trail, which was very reasonable, with great food and not another tourist in sight. On our return the reception staff presented me with a birthday gift souvenir of Istanbul. For a friendly, good value, central hotel in Istanbul, don't hesitate to book the Orient Express! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Auditor54
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for business, which was interupted by a week long national holiday. Rather than return home to England, I decided to say the week in Istanbul. I chose the Orient Express because of its closeness to the sights and also the transport links (Train and ferry). I was not dissapointed. The things that made my stay great were as follows: the friendliness and helpfulness of staff; the cleanliness of the room; a nice swimming pool, which I seemed to be the only person using whenever I went; The breakfasts were fantastic; The complementary apple tea on arival was appreciated, as was the free eats during happy hour in the Bar; there was also a good range of TV channels to watch and free WiFi Internet (signal could have been a little stronger). Next time I go to Istanbul, I will take my wife and we will definitely stay at the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Mick ( Wales )”
Reviews.Author: Mick38
Reviews.Content: A small hotel, very well run and conveniently situated within easy walking distance of most of the major attractions. The easy access to the tram and the ferry was a big plus. I liked the friendly welcome on arrival and the excellent briefing by the charming and efficient Guest Relations Manager, Ceren Cipa, who was ever helpful and good humoured despite my constant stream of questions ! All the staff were polite and cooperative, and were pleased to organise the highly interesting excursion to Gallipoli. The breakfast was fine and the waiting and bar staff carried out their duties in an exemplary manner. The view from the rooftop restaurant was first class and the dinners were top notch. The bedroom was smallish but comfortable and clean. The swimming pool walls needed a lick of paint. The price was very reasonable and, in view of the high grade service and outstanding friendliness, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: LondonHoratio
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located (just a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque etc.) and incredibly friendly, helpful staff. The room we stayed in wasn't the most tastefully decorated, but was very clean and the bathroom was fine. Breakfast was buffet style and fantastic - just what you need to set you up for full days of sightseeing. Didn't use the pool but it looked inviting. The bar is good and had some cheap drinks deals on when we were there. Would definitely recommend this place - it is as well located as any of the big-name international hotels (and much better located than some of them) at a fraction of the cost. Save your money and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and Friendly Hotel near the places everybody wants to see”
Reviews.Author: BSTM
Reviews.Content: Booked via British Airways website all I knew was that it was near the historical sites and places we wanted to see and a good price. It turned out to be a little gem and we would unhesitatingly use again. Clean, quiet, very helpful staff, it proved just the comfy base we needed. This is the first time I've felt I wanted to say anything about a hotel, but I felt well served during our 3 days and I hope others discover the place (and the city!) too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: catrunner
Reviews.Content: The cheerful friendly efficient staff of this delightful hotel made my short holiday very special. I particularly liked the welcome on arrival (tea and pastries, useful info and maps) ,the bowl of turkish delight in the room, the daily tea and delicious snacks (free), the two-for-one beer at 'happy hour' with the smiling barman, and the wonderful view from the very good value restaurant at the top. But it was the staff that made this the best value hotel I have ever stayed in....so helpful and kind...booking trips , early breakfasts,even showing how to buy a tram ticket (just round the corner)...and always welcoming. The room was smallish, no view , but very comfortable and very clean...perfectly adequate for needs. The buffet breakfasts covered a vast range of tastes...no chance of hunger. And although I didn't use the swimming pool it looked very attractive. The hotel is excellently located.....all the sights of Sultanahmet, the Galatine bridge ,and the ferry for the Bosphorus, in walking distance .....but if tired hop on a tram! And if lost , follow the tramlines! My particular thanks go to Ceren (guest manager) and all the rest of the staff who were not only excellent in every way but courteous and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Clearly under-rated”
Reviews.Author: WelshieWalks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem. What made it sparkle was the staff. They were superb, all of them were so polite with beaming smiles. it made our holiday so enjoyable. The bedroom was a little on the small size but quite adequate for what we paid. The attention to detail and cleanliness could not be faulted. Breakfast was a grand affair and the choice was quite extensive, including a fresh honeycomb! My husband celebrated his 60th birthday whilst we were away and the staff went to the trouble of organising a birthday cake and gift. Unfortunately we misunderstood their intentions and failed to turn up for the surpise afternoon tea they had organised, however they presented the cake to us as we left the hotel for our evening meal. It was so thoughtful. What this hotel fails to tell you on its review site is that they offer afternoon tea free of charge. This is a delightful time of the day to unwind with a choice of snacks and drinks. For the Â£25 per person a night we paid I could not fault the service and would definitely have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone. It is centrally located and only a few minutes walk to the train station, the tram line, the harbour at Eminonou and the Topkapi Palace. The Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia and less than a mile away. Their 7th floor restaurant overlooking the Bospherous is intimate and the food was of a high standard. As we were visiting in November we could watch all the night time activity plying back and forth. We look forward to returning, hopefully in a warmer season when we can sit on that 7th floor terrace and enjoy the hustle and bustle of this vey exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent city, excellent hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: snowman777
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in every aspects Location is GREAT for all the historic sites. The hotel offers you free transfer if you make your reservation directly from the website and stay 3 nights or more than 3 nights with themtransfers Breakfast was good and in the afternoons they supplied free refreshments from 4:30 to 6:30 pm.Topkapi. Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern. They are must to see. This city is one of the city which A tram stop is 30 seconds away and that takes you to all the main tourist spots in the city. We could walk everywhere from this hotel and i should say ALL THE STAFF ARE WONDERFUL. tthey are always willing to help you and they make sure that you are enjoying your time in istanbul especially the guest relations manager. She is so heplful. I will definately come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: megan2050
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and her husband in October. The location is very handy, their staff were incredibly helpful; the breakfast buffet and restaurant outstanding.We highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Istanbul- especially if you havent been to Istanbul before.

Reviews.Title: “A visit to remember”
Reviews.Author: BastienCambridge
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Istanbul in what proved to be a magical experience. The Orient Express is a great place to stay in the centre of Old Istanbul. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly and answered all our queries quickly and gave a clear sense of enjoying their job. We stayed in a back room and I would imagine this would be much quiter than staying in the front of the hotel as trams pass directly in front. We dined in each night and the quality of the food and the service was excellent. This is a good hotel to stay, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, worth recomending”
Reviews.Author: Old_Gypsies
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express Hotel, Istanbul, Turkey Date: From 24/9/2008 to 29/9/2008 Reviewer: Meg and Frank Stratico Perth Australia. Booking made directly by us with the hotel via internet. On arrival at airport we were picked-up promptly by the hotel arranged transfer - whilst the transfer was shared with another traveler staying at another hotel, this was not inconvenient. At the hotel we were met by a good 'front Desk' team, who not only made us feel welcome, but appreciated that we had just spent several hours in a plane and a further hour battling Istanbul notorious traffic - all check-in formality were done speedily and efficiently. The room was clean and spacious. The continental idea of pushing two single bed together to make a double, although odd at first, did not faze us too much - it just took a night to get used to it. The Waggon bar at happy hour, was always welcoming and by day two most of the staff recognized us and were prepared to chat (or not depending on our mood). We did find that the TV volume control was a little too available to patrons which meant that on occasions individuals would turn the noise up with little regard to other patrons. The restaurant provided magnificent views over both city and the city water ways. We never had difficulties in getting the best seat in the restaurant, as long as you booked early enough. The Hotel location is perfect for walking just about to everywhere in the old city, no mean feat when you are 65. The tram to the other side of the Golden Horn is right at the front door and easy to use. The harbour, with its ferries to all parts of the Bosporus, is also within walking distance from the hotel (and again accessible by tram if you feel a little slack) â€¦ and so is the railway station. On departure the front desk arranged for a cab to our next destination As already said, all staff were fantastic, but Ms Zerrin Kanat needs to be singled out for a special mention. Ms Kanat not only assisted us with making several changes to our original, self-made, on-line booking, but also provided us with copious information which enabled us to navigate around the all too mysterious Turkish Railways on-line booking system â€“ she was fantastic. Would we recommend this to others? Yes without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in the World”
Reviews.Author: sunshine8523
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express Hotel has been rated #10 in Istanbul by Trip Advisor contributors and, after staying at this superb hotel for 9 days , it is not to easy to see why it is not rated #1. The breakfast buffet is fabolous . Staying at the Orient Express puts one within very easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palce and The Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market and the Bosphorus ferries, while a bit farther, can be reached by foot in about 15 minutes. As a big bonus tea sandwiches were available every afternoon to allow tired tourists to refuel prior to dinner and you can also have some suggestions from Guest Relations Manager Ceren Cippa she is a very polite, intelligent and pleasent lady. She knows everything about the area. Please go and talk to her if you are not sure of anything. The staff at the Orient Express was very friendly and helpful well above the call of duty. Especially big thanks to ESAT, Bahri, Tarik and Ediz. They treated me like their friends. They are so professional. exceptional hotel in a world class city. We recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but avoid room 701!”
Reviews.Author: Dussans
Reviews.Content: Great service, good location, very noisy room at night. Almost impossible to sleep. The kids enjoyed the swimming pool. Istanbul is great!

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express? Why stay anywhere else is Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ozay_ali
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Location is super for all the historic sites and it is clean and well run. What really made it for us was the wonderful staff who were friendly, hospitable and always on hand with advice and help. They organised our airport transfers, gave tips on sightseeing and did it all with a smile. Breakfast was good and in the afternoons they supplied free refreshments from 4:30 to 6:30 pm. We had a top floor room with great views over the Bosphorus and we were a few minutes walk from Topkapi, Agia Sophia, Blue Mosque, The Basilica Cisterns and a major ferry point at Eminoglu. The main bazaar and spice market are both about 15 minutes walk A tram stop is 30 seconds away and that takes you to all the main tourist spots in the city. There will be many more luxurious hotels in Istanbul, but I doubt there is any better hotel than this for a short city break. We could walk everywhere from this hotel and this is what made it such a memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there!”
Reviews.Author: Rakaposhi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October with my wife and 2 children (4 year old and 1 year old) Would never go there again! After waiting for an hour at the airport for our pre booked transfer, had to phone them to send the hotel transfer service. Hotel staff didn't keep their word and provided us with a double room instead of the triple that we had booked weeks in advance. Couldnt help but wonder if they had intentionally double booked the triple room that we wanted in the hope that we would just stay in the double room regardless. didnt even have a proper double bed - just two single beds pushed together. completely unacceptable - my 4 year old son, wife and me had to sleep on this bed - not much fun for the person sleeping in the middle on the gap between the two beds. Hotel room furniture outdated and old, with only 14 inch television! The hotel i moved to the next day had 26' lcd screen (Prince hotel by the way). awful view of ugly construction site from the window. Dining room staff were not friendly - had to ask for a high chair and then carry it to our table ourselves. Reception staff were Ok but didn't give me any discount on the room provided even though it was not what we had asked for and was unacceptable for two adults and two children to sleep in. Only stayed for one night instead of 6 booked nights. Keeping in mind that I was travelling with 2 small children, the hotel didn't provide what they promised and caused us a lot of inconvenience. I would rate this hotel as 2 star instead of their claim of being 3 or 4 star. Wouldn't recommend this hotel particularly not for families with infant or toddlers.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: brookesAustralia
Reviews.Content: My sister, husband and neice, and my husband and myself stayed at this hotel for around a total of a week in October 2008. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to be of assistance. They were considerate and responsive to any queries and to provide assistance for any issues. The rooms were clean, the facilities good and breakfast excellent. The location is terrific and within walking distance to most of the major attractions. The rooms are three start standard and some have better views than others so it is worth checking re views when booking. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and will recommend it to friends. Alison Stanley

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: WernerandAns
Reviews.Content: Hello! We informed us before about the city and knew it was full of history. But the reality was extra and super! Suleymani could never think it would be like this in 2008. In the hotel, we loved the room. The service was excellent by very friendly people, the roof restaurant was beautiful and the food excellent. Continue like that. We will be back for sure... Greetings from Antwerp, Father and daughter (Werner and Ans)

Reviews.Title: “Beware the taxi drivers”
Reviews.Author: Jollow
Reviews.Content: We (My parents, sister, husband and our 3 year old son)stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The hotel and staff were lovely and extremely helpful. They could not do enough to accomodate any requests. Our rooms were small but well equipped and reasonably comfortable. The no smoking policy in rooms was abit of a joke but that was down to guests and not the hotel. The roof top resteraunt was great served lovely fresh food and very reasonable. The pool was fab for our son and the hotel was in a great location for sightseeing. Always always book a taxi through a hotel because the meters mean nothing and unfortuntaely we had a couple of bad experiences. Also the driving is the worst we have ever experienced and we have travelled alot!! Seat belts dont tend to work and it often seems like a theme park ride. Learn Turkish for please slow down or close your eyes!! Istanbul is a wonderful chaotic cultural place to visit and although very child friendly best visited without a three year old!!

Reviews.Title: “City trip”
Reviews.Author: BerryHerrie
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and myself stayed at this hotel for four nights. We planned a city trip to Istanbul for nine days and we agreed to book this hotel for four nights via the internet. In that time we would search for a hotel in another part of Istanbul. We liked it so much in this hotel that we wanted to book five nights extra. They have a great swimming pool in the basement. Good breakfast and the restaurant on the roof is also very good. Nice people and clean rooms. What else do you need! Unfortunately the hotel was fully booked and we had to find another hotel. We did find another hotel, but it wasn't quite as good as the Orient Express Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orient Express”
Reviews.Author: Ingravallo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Orient Express Istanbul and found they offer a really very good service. Our room was rather small; however, it was clean, quite and confortable. The hotel has a beautiful terrace overlooking the Golden Horn, where they serve drinks and meals, and is conveniently located in the city center. The hotel staff has been always very nice and helpful with us; they provided us with both assistance on the best way to get to places we wanted to visit, and recommendations as to where it was better to go for dinner (and we always appreciated their suggestions). Finally, we found the Orient Express hotel offers a very good value for money; it is the kind of hotel where we will go back if we will have the opportunity to go to Instanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnydays050
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in October 2008 and can highly recommend it. The staff are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The location is ideal being only a few minutes walk from most of the attractions such as the blue mosque. The hotel offer snacks and soft drinks free between 4 and 6pm along side a happy hour. They also have free access to the internet. We used the light railway and tram to get from the airport to the hotel and this worked very well and was by far the cheapest option. For each trip it costs 1.4 Turkish Lira and you buy a token from the booth before entering through the barrier. We would recommend the 1.5 hour boat trip of the Bosphorus but make sure you by your tickets from the booth at the end of the dock it only costs 7.5 turkish lira.

Reviews.Title: “OE as a business hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: melvinr
Reviews.Content: Check-in to non-smoking room (2 of 7 floors) trouble free. Staff friendly and helpful. Room and en suite compact but adequate. AirCon problematic, but wi-fi trouble-free. Excellent breakfast buffet (except disgusting OJ) starts at 7 - very adequate for Istanbul. Roof restaurant reasonably priced, with good, fresh, fish. Convenient location on tram route and close to central 'sights'. Downside is somewhat noisy street - but given the chaotic traffic in Istanbul it is probably relatively quiet! Avoid taxis ordered through reception - seemed more likely than others to charge >double the true metered rate - though still managed to use the meter! Total for stay was exactly as indicated at booking. Summary: good value, clean and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location”
Reviews.Author: andrew0
Reviews.Content: I would like to give my opinion on a cracking location in a brilliant city. The Orient Express is located very centrally, 10 minutes walk to the main sites {topkapi, blue mosque, aghia sofia, etc} in one direction, and the spice bazaar and galata bridge in the other. We had a front facing room, which was a little noisy, but no problem. The room was fairly small, with one smallish wardrobe, the bathroom incorporated a shower , but no bath, probably not what i would want to spend a week in, but plenty for our 3 nights. The breakfast was ok.. Enough to get us going for the day, however the restaurant on the roof top was very good, with a spectacular view over the Bosphorus. We ate there twice{ the steak was excellent}. The Wagon room {bar and lobby}, was very relaxing, especially during happy hour {4-6}, when a free selection of rolls and half price drinks were on offer. Just one tip, go to the bar yourself or you will pay an extra service charge for your drinks. Istanbul was a delight, massive amounts of history and all served in a friendly way, try the Dolmabache palace, catch the tram from near the train station to the end of the line, just a 5 minute walk from here.The topkapi palace and blue mosque are spectacular also. If you like shopping, go to the grand bazaar and get very lost amongst the 1450 shops covering 63 streets, mostly selling the same things, but great fun haggling, or the many shops that offer fixed prices if you don't feel confident. Overall I cannot recommend Istanbul highly enough, and look forward to going back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly efficient staff, immaculate rooms”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTrail_runner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in the Orient Express Hotel, and we were very satisfied. The staff accomodated our every request and were very friendly and polite, but professional. We were very impressed. I liked the location, we've been to Turkey a couple of times before and I really enjoy the Rastum Pasha mosque, the spice bazaar and the Sulimaniye Mosque and we were close to all those. The main attractions, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque are also in easy (5 minute) walking distance. The breakfast was very good, a wide selection of western and eastern food (I love olives, cucumbers, and tomatos for breakfast, but eggs, cereal, toast, cheese, ham etc., were there for those who don't). We intentionally left some items behind when we checked out (near the end of our trips we try to free up some space for souvenirs) and housekeeping called the front desk to let us know.

Reviews.Title: “We're definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: SRBPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in October 2008. Fantastic location and very nice staff. Walking distance to all the main attractions in Istanbul - Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, St Sofia, Cisterns etc etc. Lots of eateries nearby. The hotel's Rooftop restaurant has a great view and if you want to splash out a little more. Tram station is very near and easy to use. The room was clean and more than adequate. We have noticed some reviews have commented on the smallness of the rooms, but believe me, we have been in much smaller rooms and bathrooms in Europe. Free internet is a nice bonus (but there is only one computer). Cost-wise it was very good value and we would readily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: Tedkim
Reviews.Content: We and another couple (both 60+) spent 6 nights in Hotel Orient Express non smoking double and twin rooms looking to the street. The noise of the trafic could be heard - of course - as the hotel is in the heart of Istanbul. However, the noise was not at all disturbing although both couples have their homes in extremely silent countryside and thus not used to noise. None of us had any difficulties to sleep in the comfortable beds of the hotel. The hotel and the rooms were very clean and the towels were changed every day. The rooms were rather small but on the other hand it didn't bother as we spent all the days in the town. The only drawback (in theory) at least in the rooms inhabited by us was the wall to wall fitted carpets. On the other hand this didn't bother as the floors were kept very clean (the rooms were not at all stuffy). The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent, versatile and substantial. The location of the hotel was excellent. The vast majority of the sights and places to be visited of Istanbul are within less than 20 minutes walking distance. It takes only less than Â½ an hour to reach the centre of Istanbul (Taksim) by foot via KarakÃ¶y and Galata. Thus we needed no taxi, bus or tramway during our visit in the hotel. The only public transportation used by us were the boats which were very easily attainable just by walking to the nearby landing places (EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and KarakÃ¶y).

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected honesty”
Reviews.Author: helenb31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express from September 16-19 2008. The location was ideal with the tram stop around the corner and within walking distance of the Grand Bazar ,Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque just to name a few. The room was modest and clean and served its purpose. We enjoyed the free internet facility and the courtsey of the staff and the biggest surprise of all was their honesty. When we checked out they arranged a cab to take us to the airport. Half way to the airport they called our cab informing the driver to return as we had left something behind. Although we hadn't realised it my husband had left his wallet ( full of australian currency) and his watch in a drawer and the cleaning staff had found it. We turned around and when we arrived at the hotel the staff were waiting at the door with the wallet and watch in their hand! Now that was honesty which is rare in this day and age. We were very greatful.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: saoire1978
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Orient Express for 4 nights. very good location and friendly staff. Literally a few minutes walk to Topkapi Palace and a little further to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The very frequent and convenient tram line runs straight past the hotel if you want to travel to other parts of the city. we had a room on the 7th floor at the back of the hotel. smallish but spotless and very comfortable. the hotel also has a pool which is an added bonus. great view from the roof top restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: AuntiBBB
Reviews.Content: We were expecting to stay in a sister hotel but were moved here for our 3 nights instead. The staff could not have been more helpful, all were courteous, smiling and went out of their way to make you feel welcome and assist you in every way. Breakfast was plentiful and morning coffee was a definite plus. The room was small but clean, and the beds were comfortable. The Orient Express is in an ideal location for seeing the major sights, all just a short walk away. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: papaTurnhout
Reviews.Content: A very good and clean hotel on an ideal location. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant on the roof top also very good. If you want to visit Istanbul , I will certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The real taste of classic oriental style”
Reviews.Author: nanny_ro
Reviews.Content: I've been at Orient Express Hotel for 3 nights. It was a very nice experience and I could not tell what I liked more. The only thing that I did not like it was the fact that our room has the window oriented to a wall. But the people from the stuff where very nice, the services very good and the food excelent. I will recomend to everybody to go to this hotel but to ask for a room with view.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityBob
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an excellent tourist class hotel in a fine location in the old city near Topkapi, St Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Staff are very helpful and rooms reasonable size, clean and well-equipped. Rooftop restaturant was quite good. Breakfast very fine too. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Above avarage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMKBudapest
Reviews.Content: This is a well run, clean and reasonably priced hotel with very very helpful and reliable staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. jeanmarie, Budapest

Reviews.Title: “For Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cmjo417
Reviews.Content: Staff from arrival to departure couldn't have been more weloming, helpful,or efficient. International Hotels around Taksim would do well to follow this Hotel's example. Superb views over Golden Horn and Bosphorous, especially at sunset from Terrace restaurant. Service and food quality here matches views. The rooms may be a little on the small size, but who comes to this vibrant City to stay in their room all the time. Amenities in room well provided for. Very efficient laundry service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: amybalto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Orient Express and had a very good stay there. The room was a bit smaller than it seemed in the photos but that was no problem for us. It was clean and pleasantly decorated and best of all, had a good view of the water. It had all the regular amenities of a hotel - mini-bar, mini-safe, A/C, satellite TV, etc - so it was very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was a big variety and very good. There's a basement pool (which is also smaller than it seems in the photos) but it's still nice - the water is kept warm so it's a perfect way to end the day relaxing a bit in the pool before going to bed. We didn't get a chance to see the rooftop terrace restaurant but if I go back I'd definitely like to try that out. The staff members were always courteous and patient with all our questions, and one of them recommended a great (non-touristy!) restaurant in the area. When we arrived they gave us hot apple tea and sat down with us to give us a map, make suggestions, and let us ask any questions we had. It's a nice, if pretty typical, hotel and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: zchar
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. Stayed there 2 years ago, and returned again this time as we'd liked it so much. Not disappointed second time round. Courteous, clean, elegant, affordable, the list goes on... OK the rooms may not be the biggest but then again, you shouldn't spend too long in them when visiting such a fantastic city as Istanbul. Oh and they've now added free Wi-Fi, both in the lobby downstairs and in all the rooms (a router is on every floor). Breakfast always of high quality and variety. And don't miss out on the rooftop restaurant for dinner. Not the cheapest and the variety is not huge, but dinner overlooking the Bosphorous more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: stella017
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the the Orient Express Hotel six times. It is a great hotel with a great location and comfortable rooms. The staff is very professional, polite and helpful. The roof top restaurant serves very good food and has a fantastic view. I will definitely stay in this hotel next time I go Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travellerPisa
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Sultanhamet, near the hystorical sites and far away from the noisy Taksim area, this is the perfect hotel. Moreover, it is very close to the ferryboat station (10 min.), to the train station (3 min.) and to the tram stop (just in front of the hotel). The hotel is very clean, the rooms are clean and large enough for a couple of people. Bathrooms are clean and well equiped. Breakfast is perfect. The bosforo view from the terrace restaurant is breath-breaking! Staff is friendly and willing to help for everything. Pick up service from the airport is included in the room rate, but you will have to pay to be brought back to the airport at the end of your stay; you will find cheaper solutions with local agencies and with public transportation (tram + bus). Very good ratio price/services and quality! I will be back in this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DurhamDave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orient Express for 4 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. The staff were friendly and obliging. The room was clean and we enjoyed good views over the Bosphorus from our 7th floor room. Breakfast was very good with a good selection. Hotel is excellently situated within walking distance of Tokapi Palace and mosques at Sultanahamet. Great to have the pool to relax and cool off after a hot day of siteseeing. In fact we had it to our selves on all three occasions we used it. I definitely recommend this hotel David Welsh Durham

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Old Town Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cuspid11
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul at midnight. A shuttle service met us at the airport and took us to old town and actually dropped us off at the wrong hotel. They called the Orient Express and the bell hop came and got us and carried our bags to our hotel. We stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel was in a perfect location to walk or ride the tram to all the sights from old town to the new district to the ferry terminals. The room was small to medium size; don't bring tons of luggage. The room was clean with a nice bathroom and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was perfect with breads, pastries, fruits, juices, coffee, tea etc. If you are looking into Istanbul we reccomend it. We just loved walking around in the evenings and enjoying the sights. The Orient Express made it all come together. After checking out we caught the public tram out to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JonathanFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel in safe area with all attractions in walking distance. Friendly, professional and helpful staff, clean and well-maintained, nicely furnished room. Beautiful roof restaurant. I had a great time and would always return to the Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel twice: one in the beginning of August for 3 nights and one week later, after we came back from Kusadasi, for 2 nights. The street is very noisy and you should ask one of the back rooms despite they have no view. The rooms are small but very clean with nice beds. Best location to visit Topkapi Palace, Ayasophia, the Blue Mosque and Galata bridge just 5 minutes away walking. The tram takes you to all the other places that matter. The breakfast is average: almost no warm food, the rest was good. The staff, I agree with all other reviews, is very friendly and professional. Nothing to point out. The swimming pool is small but very nice when you have kids considering you're in a city that doesn't have places to play with them. And now the better thing: the restaurant in the terrace. Very good food, beautiful views and affordable prices: I never payed more than 90 YTL (about 45â‚¬) for a meal for three persons. If I would stay here again? Of course!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excelent service”
Reviews.Author: Maria76Porto
Reviews.Content: The best thing in this hotel is the staff - very very nice and worried about the guests. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but a little bit small. Location is excellent. If I come back to Istanbul, I would repeat the choice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in bustling Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mikelancaster
Reviews.Content: Hotel very comfortable and the staff very friendly and attentive. Location very central for the heart of the city. We had an excellent meal in the Roof Restaurant-food vauthentic and tasty, and good value; and the views out over the city great. Room very comfortable-but a bit of street noise; still, we were so tired after walking it didnt keep us awake. We'd stay there again if back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amblesidebeach
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation at a reasonable price. Staff friendly and professional. Rooms clean and comfortable. Great breakfast. Excellent location. Can walk or take the tram everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: carolin99
Reviews.Content: I make hollydays about 4 days in this hotel and it was the perfekt hotel. bevore i visit istanbul more than 10 x but this hotel is the best of all. all is clean and the service was perfect. i eat in the imbat terrace restaurant every day. the meals are very special and at this place i will give a special thank to Mr. Haner Yunus for the quick and prefect friendly service. I will come back in my next hollydays. Greetings from Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but small beds and street noise”
Reviews.Author: Thefall
Reviews.Content: 1/ Location Very good. In a walking distance from Sultanahmet Mosque, Agia-Sophia, Topkapi Palace etc, right in the heart of the Old Istanbul. The street itself is a bit noisy due to the railways, with restaurants, hotels and shops on both sides. No great views, but very convenient for city walkers. 2/ Rooms Very small in size, with french balcony (that means no balcony at all :)), aircon and bathroom (with bath, not shower cabin). The beds are a bit small for anyone taller than 185 cm, so keep it in mind. The other thing is if you've got a room which faces the street - you'll hardly sleep at night, so beware of rooms 601-602, 501-502 and so on. Everything else is good. 3/ Breakfast Sorry, we missed it :). But they say it's quite good and tasty, although you've got lots of places around to have your morning coffee (try John's Cafe&Restaurant near Kabatas train station - you can get there by tram which stops near the hotel and goes to Kabatas, get off on the stop just before the Kabatas itself - they have the best Kenyan coffee in town! Sadly, noone there speaks English, but the food and drinks are delicious!) 4/ Price $280 for 2 nights. A little higher than it deserves, but normal if you compare it with other hotels in the center of the city. One of the best hotels in area (the second one is Sirkeci Konak). 4/

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, super service!”
Reviews.Author: ewaldo007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice hotel for a week at the end of July, 2008. The style of the lobby, restaurants etc. is inspired by the legendary Orient Express train, which is a nice touch (the old Istanbul station where the Orient Express used to stop is a two-minute walk away). It is very conveniently located, at walking distance from virtually every major touristic sight (beware of the tramway thouogh, which runs right in front of the entrance! I have noticed that some travelers have complained of street noise in the rooms, I had no such trouble but then my room (4th floor) was not located at the streetside. On arrival we were received in a very friendly manner with a complementary tea and a snack, and were given some information on Istanbul and its attractions by the hotel's guest relations manager (who spoke excellent English BTW), while the front desk personnel took care of the adminstrative details. The room was not very large, but very clean and nicely furnished, with good beds. The airconditioner wasn't working very well, but this was promply taken care of as soon as we mentioned it. The TV featured programmes in English and French as well as in Turkish. The free safebox was also very convenient. (Minor) weaknesses: relatively small (but adequate) room size; and limited wardrobe space. Small detail: only one drinking glass was provided in the bathroom (for a double room). The indoor swimming pool is rather small but clean. Towels are provided. Breakfast was good, not the largest selection I've come across in a four-star hotel but certainly sufficient, and of good quality. The rooftop restaurant is a big plus, it has a great view, a good selection of Turkish and international cuisine. Room service is available and the personnel was also very friendly. The bar on the ground floor, directly behind the lobby, is nice but it was very quiet at all times we visited. There is a 'happy hour' in the afternoon, but in my opinion it might be a good idea to do this in the rooftop restaurant instead. as I suspect a considerable proportion of the guests don't realize how nice the roof terrace is. Finally let me reiterate that the service is superb. You can really tell that the hotel staff enjoy their work and take pride in making the guests feel at home. Every request was promptly taken care of, and with a smile! Overall, an excellent experience with the great service easily outbalancing a few minor shortcomings. I'd certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandJohn
