Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel for anyone wishing to visit the major tourist sites in Istanbul. It is within easy walking distance of all the major tourist attractions, the staff are friendly and efficient and the accommodation is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottishWildcat
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a week's stay in Istanbul, mostly as a result of the TripAdvisor reviews. We weren't disappointed, especially as we were able to take advantage of a couple of offers (7 nights for the price of 6, and a further 10% discount for settling in cash on check in). Because we booked online and stayed for a week, we were also given free transport to and from the airport-- when we booked, we were only told about the free transfer *from* the airport, so this was a handy bonus. On check-in I was originally shown to a room on the second floor, but the guy on the desk explained he didn't really work on reception and I should come back down in five minutes when his colleague returned. When I did so, I was offered a welcome drink, and as well as pointing out all the local attractions, his colleague offered me the option of a slightly better room, which I took. Although it was right on the main street above the main entrance, the only real noise was from the trams, and they certainly didn't disturb our sleep. Otherwise it was big enough, clean and well-maintained, and had a bath as well as a shower, which is always nice. Free wireless internet is available (as well as a PC in the lobby if you don't have your laptop), and proved to be pretty reliable by hotel standards, although it did go down for a few hours one day. The access points aren't secured, though (i.e. no WPA or WEP password required to connect), if that sort of thing bothers you. All the staff were friendly and very helpful, and the ones on the desk all spoke good English. Our only slight disappointments were the lack of the advertised bar beside the swimming pool (we didn't ask why), and the fact that breakfast is served in the basement rather than on the terrace (which, in fairness, probably just isn't big enough). Also, I don't know what was coming out their beer taps-- it was supposed to be the local Efes beer, but it tasted foul compared to the Efes we were served everywhere else. I think they probably needed to change their barrels and clean their pipes!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: elstrach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on the final leg of our honeymoon. The hotel was in a great location and the staff were very friendly and helpful. However there was nothing really to set it apart and we'd probably look to stay somewhere else if we went back to Istanbul. The room was the smallest we stayed in on our trip - the two of us plus luggage really filled it and we were stepping over each other at times. That said, it was clean and well enough furnished. We had a room facing onto the street but the double glazing was effective enough at keeping the noise out. On the plus side, the staff were extremely helpful. They booked restaurants for us and helped with tourist information when we asked for it. Even the cleaners said a breezy hello in the corridor as we passed. The helpfulness and friendliness of the staff made it a quite acceptable hotel (which it wouldn't have been based on the rooms alone). We also ate at the hotel restaurant and really wouldn't recommend this to anyone. The view from the terrace is great but that's par for the course in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: Vernon3
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days at the Orient Express and found it to be a great experience. The location is perfectly situated and walking distance to all the main sites in the Sultanahmet district. The Hotel is clean, comfortable and covers all the basics including a very good Turkish breakfast each morning which is included. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. In fact, they made my first visit to Istanbul more enjoyable by pointing out important things in the area and assisting with everything from dinner reservations to getting clothes drycleaned. Would highly recommend this very personal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hindistan
Reviews.Content: Made my reservations directly online. Bookings were a breeze and Ceren Cipa- Guest Relation Manager was very prompt in confirming the bookings and requests. The rooms are rather small compared to say a Hilton but Linen and Bathroom is very clean. I stayed for 6 nights and room was cleaned throughly every day with towels changed. It is located very well, near to all places of interest and public transport. Breakfast served was very sumptuos but they could give an option in eggs like fried or omlette. The staff is very very helpfull and respect your privacy. I read some other travellors comments that the staff asks too many questions but that is all wrong. Since I stayed for 6 nights the hotel gave me two way airport transfer without my asking. Overall a great hotel and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: AthensFanny
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a magnificent view from the terrace and a very nice swimming pool. The staff was really friendly and in the reception I would like to thank Tarik in particular for his help and advice on how to move around Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place with lovely staff : a wonderful trip thanks to ORIENT EXPRESS”
Reviews.Author: LAMIAA
Reviews.Content: I spent one week in ORIENT EXPRESS HOTEL in Istanbul...and the only thing i can say about my stay there is that everything was STAGGERING :) The rooms are vey nice and clean, the breakfast and the terrass are very good with a very nice sight....everything made our trip EXCELLENT The staff is very helpful and enabled us to discover istanbul by giving us advices and helping us manage our time to see the best places there.... i would like to give a special thank to: BAHRÄ°, SEMÄ°H ,ESAT , FATÄ°H,EDÄ°Z,TARIK,SEDAT,ALÄ°,CEREN I hope that i will meet such helpful and nice people in all my next trips.

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express Hotel: A Jewel in the Heart of the Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: SL-Chicago
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Orient Express Hotel for four nights in early July. We received a prompt pick-up at the airport the evening we flown into Istanbul as well as a very warm welcome upon our arrival. The rooms were fantastic, very clean, good size, all within walking distance of the main sights of Topkapi, Ayasofya, and the Blue Mosque. The restaurant with its terrace overlooking the Bosphorus is a great place to enjoy dinner after a busy day of sightseeing. The complimentary breakfast was great too. The one thing that I will get me to return though is its fantastic staff; they were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Architect_8
Reviews.Content: In the Orient Express we had a very pleasant stay. The staff is nice and helpful. The rooms are clean; the bed is comfortable; the breakfest is generous. The location is also an advantage: only five minutes walk from the main turist attractions. On top of the hotel there is a terrace-restaurant, with good food and a great view to the Bosphorus. It is really worthy to have dinner up there. If we once go back to Istanbul, we will for sure stay in the Orient Express again. I recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Orient express - best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: JefScotland
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nights at the orient express hotel in Istanbul. We were there as a family - two adults and two teenagers. We could not rate the hotel more highly - in terms of great location for seeing the sights, wonderful helpful and nice staff, very clean, great breakfast, roof top restaurant and they organised a reliable transfer to the airport. Possibly the nicest hotel we have stayed in - highly recommended. Jennifer & Peter and family, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: ssmumbai
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online after reading reviews on tripadvisor and we were very satisfied with our stay at the hotel. The location in the old city is excellent. Its walking distance from the Hagia Sophia and historical area. Its very close to the tram station and ferry station too which will get you around most of Istanbul. the room was a bit smaller than what we expected from the photographs but it was very clean and excellent value for money. the staff was very friendly and helpful. they gave us directions to all the tourist destinations and helpful recommendations. the hotel had all the facilities we needed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's Gem”
Reviews.Author: mn_yigit
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express is a highly enjoyable accommodation, which is conveniently located next to some of Istanbulâ€™s top historical sites such as Sultan Ahmet (Blue Mosque), Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia. Itâ€™s also located next to a number of wonderful restaurants and cafes as well as being located next to some grand museums and the beautiful Guhane Park. Transport from the hotel is also very convenient with trams passing by every few minutes, and the train and ferry services are nearby. I would also recommend that you visit the Grand Bazaar and Dolmabahce Palace which are only a few tram stops away. The staff were kind and informative and we were very satisfied with the cleaning staff also. The breakfast was top notch with fresh ingredients used and once again considerate staff in the Ottoman/breakfast room. (Only problem was that most staff support Sekistas/Besiktas not Galatasaray :() I (Sevket Sinan) was very happy to celebrate my 18th Birthday with the staff and would like to thank them for organising my birthday surprise (see photos). We enjoyed our stay at the Orient Express immensely and we would certainly consider returning there when we come to Istanbul next time. Munevver and Sevket Sinan Yigit (Sister & Brother)

Reviews.Title: “A "Turkish Delight" in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PikiLima
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport by the hotel staff and taken to the hotel where we were welcomed with a delicious apple tea! The hotel staff was more than friendly, giving us always tips on the best places to go, nice restaurants and even arranged a wonderful private tour for us. The hotel boasts an excellent location, the best in my opinion, close to Haya Sohia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar; walking distance to the tram and ferrie stations. The room was nice, a bit small but still comfortable. We had turkish delights delivered in our room! I can highly recommend this hotel for its good price/revenue relation. Cecilia and Enrique form Lima, Peru.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMCornwall
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within walking distance of historic sites. Welcoming staff and excellent service throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice locatin but....”
Reviews.Author: rodrigues57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location, away from the main tourist areas, but within short walking distance of all the major attractions and markets. But...the swimming pool is too small, the rooms are very small, the breakfast is served in the -1 floor rather than at the terrace. They gave us a room ground floor facing back a dirty old wall where all airconditioning were noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in an Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: dubaisheikh
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express is a great "value for money" hotel. As others have already mentioned, it is an ideal location close to the main Sultanhamet attractions, It is also very close to the metro/tram/ferry systems that allow you get to around Istanbul fairly quickly. It is an excellent base from which to explore Istanbul. The hotel itself was fine. It has a pleasant lobby area, clean and tidy rooms but the main thing for me was the assistance provided by the staff before and during the trip. I must thank Ciren and the other staff for providing very helpful infornation even before we arrived in Istanbul. I was very impressed with the response times to e-mails and the quality of the information provided. For those planning to visit Istanbul, do contact the hotel beforehand if you have any queries as it will make planning your trip a lot more easier. I would strongly recommend this hotel if you want a comfortable base at a good price from which to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GigiMT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express Hotel for 4 nights. We are a family of 4 with 2 kids aged 6 and 1. We stayed in a 'triple room' which was actually like 2 small connected rooms, one with a double bed and the other a single pull out bed and a baby cot which was supplied by the hotel. The room was nice and very suitable for a family as the kids had a seperate place to sleep. My only complaint would be that there was only 1 air con unit on the kids' side which meant that their room was very cool while ours was only just comfortable. The location was great as the major sights were an easy walk away. There were also several shops/restaurants/cafes around the hotel. There was some noise from the street below (particularly after Turkey beat Croatia in Euro 2008!), also from the trams constantly going by. That said, with the windows closed it really didn't bother us that much. We used the pool almost every day. It was not huge but very clean and well organized (lockers, towels supplied by the hotel) and was great for the children after a day of sight seeing. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I would stay at the Orient Express again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ace04
Reviews.Content: Good location, good staff, all round great hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Edwardknows
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a real surprise and a great place to visit. Whilst there the Orient Express Hotel is a clean, well-priced hotel in which to stay and it's in an excellent location for all the historic sites. The welcome, and the attitude of the staff in general, was exemplary. The rooms are good although a little short on storage space and the bathroom was not big enough to accommodate a full bath. In its place was one of those showers with a step in it that means you can sit down but not stretch out your legs. Our room looked out over the backyard of the hotel which, whilst not terribly glamourous, meant that we weren't bothered by the noise of the street early in the morning. Breakfast is buffet-style and was very good with a huge variety of things to try. The Wagon Bar next to reception was pleasant enough but, in the period we were there, never had many people in it. If you choose to stay here, try to eat at the rooftop restaurant on at least one occasion. The food is pretty good (if a bit on the expensive side for Istanbul) but the view over the Bosphorus is worth the money alone. Location-wise, you can't get better. Turn left out of the hotel and within 400m you are at the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia; turn right and it's 400m to the Bosphorus. Being British I did wonder whether the fall-out from Iraq might cause us some trouble but, other than the occasional "Oh", the Istanbulis were all tremendously friendly and always eager to try to sell you something that you know you'll never use. You get used to smiling and saying "No", or just ignoring people - no-one takes offence! Note that you can eat very cheaply in Istanbul but, because booze isn't as freely available as it is in other European cities, the price of drinks varies tremendously. Best place we found was the Nezih Bar (turn right out of hotel and after about 100m it's on a small street on the right) where Efez beer (the local 5% lager) was 3 Lira a pint. We were charged 9 Lira a pint in another local bar for the same stuff so take care. Before we went to Istanbul whenever I mentioned it at work I got asked: "why there?". It really is a fantastic place to visit and, whilst busy, it isn't yet as packed with tourists as many other cities. Go there... and stay at the Orient Express! Simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nanatrala
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, nice rooms - clean and cosy. quiet area but in the heart of the old city. i've made some friends here; and if you are lucky you will get to discover in turkish people only the best qualites. i highly recomand this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireIngo
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at the Orient Express hotel to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday. We were recommended this hotel by a work colleague and I can't thank him enough. We were met from the Sabiha Gokcen airport by a hotel representative arranged prior to our arrival. This is quite a long journey and the hotel sorted everything for us I recommend doing this if you are flying into this airport. On our arrival we were met by Ceren the guest relations manager who could'nt have done enough for us. The reception staff also came over and joined us and made us feel very welcome. They also helped us with sights to see and to answer any other issues we had. We were given complimentary Apple Tea on arrival and we were then shown to our room which was on the top floor at the rear of the hotel overlooking the Bhosphorus. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. All of the staff were amazing. We also ate in the terrace restaurant whilst we were there and the food was excellent along with the views. On our anniversary we returned to our room after a long day out sightseeing to find a letter from the hotel staff and a bottle of Cherry wine and 2 glasses and then the following day on my birthday the staff gave me a real surprise and I was called to reception where the staff presented me with a fantastic gift and a cake. I can safely say that we have travelled all over but I have never found a hotel with staff so friendly and helpful. They made our stay very special and I will definitly recommend this hotel to anyone. We will be going back. The staff at this hotel are Simply the best. In particular i must mention Ceren, Metin in the Wagon Bar and Restaurant and also Mehmet who looked after us in the Terrace Restaurant. Thank you to everyone at The Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Haagsetijden
Reviews.Content: For anyone wanting to be close to the historical sites of Istanbul, the Orient Express is very conveniently situated. Hotel staff are extremely friendly, never pushy. Rooms are comfortable, sometimes a bit noisy. Being somebody who suffers from chronic back problems, I must say I slept wonderfully well. Pool was smaller than expected and could have done with a touch of ''chloride''. On the whole, I would really recommend this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “The prettiest hotel in Istambul!!!”
Reviews.Author: scarlettCordoba
Reviews.Content: Well,i will try to be short although much good things are to say about this hotel. We arrived to istanbul on may 8 and were picked up in airport by people from the hotel at the time and place accorded, wich was our first concern due to the fact we are both young girls and coming from soo far away as Argentina. About the hotel instalations i can only say good things...the beds,my god those beds!!! were awsom! incredibly confortable.........although rooms were not huuuuuge,they were cousy and always clean.Breakfast is crowded with food, for any taste and is fresh and tasty,wich is a fact thats not comon in hotels we were after. The restaurant on terrace deserve the extra paragraph,people from the kitchen cooked for us although they were almost closing for a couple of times....and food was incredible speacially pasta...thanks to both cooks,Mehmet Guven and Junus Atabet....you are great guys thank u really!! Location is great, just around corner with main turistic atraction,as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia...the tram way in front of the hotel did not couse any trouble at all with the noise , and we were just a few steps away from the train stop wich made it easier and safe to reach any part of istanbul we wanted. Andthe best for the last part, .........the CREW IN RECEPTION..........they took care of us always in all time and were constantly telling us were we should go and what to do to be safe...in all time servicial and kind...i have no words to thank u guys...ESAT,TARIK,BAHRI, FATIIIIII and the guy who has a lovely girlfriend of blue eyes jaja i cant recall his name...thank u really from botom of my heart,we carry u in our hearts... This hotel made our stay in Istanbul great and will return there for sure...loved istanbul, loved Orient Express.... With much, much love;take care of our mate....Anita and Cesi greetings from CÃ³rdoba, Argentina

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donaldboese
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a great place to start your Turkey-Istanbul trip. Very central and close to highlights. Staff are more than helpful with always a smile and always help with any travel questions I had.A welcome apple tea and plate full of Turkish delight on the bed in our room. Beds were comfortable and clean. Rooms had plenty of space and we had a room with a view..Safe and secure..excellent AAA+++ Don Boese

Reviews.Title: “First time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Leondelon
Reviews.Content: We have booked 3 nights throught hotelÂ´s web sites. We were there in Orient Express Hotel from May 15 and it was a very pleasant stay with an excellent service. The terrace restaurant is great, donÂ´t forget to go there to see Bosphorus bridge when day ends and night is coming. Hotel is situated at the historical city center just few minutes far from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkaki Palace, you can visit all important sights walking. DonÂ´t hesitate to ask hotel staff for anything, they are very friendly. Unfortunately we were not in the hotel swimming pool - we had no time for that cause town exploring but I hope I will do it during my next trip to Istanbul! :-) Alan, Prague

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubble41
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 7 nights, directly with hotel thus benefitting from the 7% discount for cash payment AND a free night, though these offers would have been more appreciated had it not been for the fact that we had to pay 186 euros extra, for each room, for 4 of the nights, due to the fact that our holiday coincided with Formula one - a blatant money-making exercise, though it has to be said, all the other hotels did the same. In my opinion the hotel appears to be over-staffed, although friendly and helpful as they were, each time we came in for the evening, the lobby seemed crowded with bar staff, reception staff and porters - all mingling around the front door and desk area. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is in a great location for sights and transport. The hotel is clean and attractive. The beds were surprisingly comfortable which are not something Turkish hotels are known for. The rooms badly lacked storage space - (wardrobe was miniscule - i suppose it could be described as a "capsule wardrobe" ) :) Breakfast (07.00 to 10.30),was excellent - lots of choice of freshly prepared fare. Unless you are a very heavy sleeper, ask for a back room, as even though the trams seem to cease around 01.00, the tram lines are repaired after that time and the line workers hammer away at the lines until the trams start again around 06.00. Disregard the website's photo of the swimming pool - it's actually a whole lot smaller than the photo would have you believe - it's basically a "splash" pool. Didn't use the bar or terrace restaurant, though the restaurant has a view of the Bosphorus, it has to be said, it has suberb views of building sites and neighbouring roof tops and run-down buildings also. All in all, a decent, basic hotel in a wonderful metropolis that is Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJ39
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said about this lovely hotel. It's in possibly the best location you can find - if you are in a muddle for choice of hotel don't look any further. All the sites to visit are within a walking distance of 10-15 mins. The staff are very attentive, helpful and hard working. A very special mention to Esat, Bahri and Ceren who were extremely good to us over our 4 night visit. From the airport - If there are 4 or more people in your party I would recommend you get the hotels airport transfer, it is more reasonable than the airports own taxi. For getting about locally - there is a pretty good tram system around but again if there are a few of you a local taxi is better as you can split the fare, especially if you are going across the river to taksim. All in all a fantastic base for doing your city break. Best wishes to the above 3 mentioned from the 5 boys from Blackburn.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alanNorwich
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orient Express for 3 nights and found it a charming hotel, very well situated and with helpful and friendly staff. From the moment you arrive and are offered a complimentary apple tea through to storing your cases before leaving the staff do all the can to make sure that your stay is as enjoyable as possible. Breakfast is excellent and the views from the rooftop restaurant really impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: fuhok
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April and we were not dissapointed. The hotel was well situated and very clean. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The hotel is family freindly and they welcome young children. I took my 7 month old daughter with me and we had no problems. As many previous reviews have stated the staff were very freindly and went out of their way to make you feel welcome. Overall a very good experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonb88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Dersaadet in Sultanahmet and 3 nights at the Orient Express (metro stop is GÃ¼lhane), so I will do a comparison of the two. They are about 10 Euros difference in price and both offer cash discounts: LOCATION: ORIENT EXPRESS (because I personally don't like the touristy aspect of Sultanahmet) Sultanahmet is where all the main attractions are, Aya Sofya, Sultanahmet Camii, KapalÄ± Ã§arÅŸÄ± (Grand Bazaar), etc. so it's great for all that. The thing I don't like is that Sultanahmet is incredibly touristy, so someone will try to sell you something every 2 minutes walking in that area. There's a bunch of restaurants by the metro station. Within a few short blocks of the hotel there are some decent restaurants too, so you don't have to always walk over to the main drag. Orient Express is one metro stop away from Sultanahmet. It's literally right on the metro path (you walk out of the hotel a few steps and you could get hit by the metro). That street has restaurants and usual shops, but they don't grab you as much as they do in Sultanahmet. In fact, rarely. Being on the metro path and a busy street, you will hear some street noise but it wasn't too bad at all. ROOM / HOTEL: ORIENT EXPRESS (edged out slightly due to room size) Dersaadet is an independent, small hotel. The rooms are smaller and older, but very clean and absolutely adequate. Bed is comfortable and bathroom is very clean. There is free internet at the lobby, and there is a laundry shop a few doors down. There's a restaurant at the rooftop but we only had breakfast there. Orient Express is part of a hotel group, so it has more of a standard hotel feel. The room is more standard Hilton'ish, decent size and there's more room for luggage and stuff. Bed is also comfortable and bathroom is also very clean. There is also free internet and printer by the lobby, but the printer was broken at the time. There's a rooftop restaurant and a cafe/bar downstairs. They have laundry service but I imagine it'd be on par with the price at a regular hotel, which is expensive. They serve welcome Elma Ã‡ay (fake apple tea) and zimit when we checked in. Both hotels offer free airport pickup if you stay a certain number of nights. To go to istanbul airport, you actually could take the metro if you don't have too much luggage and it'll save you money (about 2.6 YTL vs. 25 Euros). Just remember that during busy hours the metro cars get crowded and it may not be comfortable for a few stops, but it was fine for us. STAFF: DERSAADET All the front desk staff at Dersaadet is awesome - incredibly polite, friendly, and helpful, and I'd say more personable than OE. We mostly talked to Umit and he's just great. Really friendly and try to help with everything. More people work at OE, and the staff we met were also very polite and helpful, but just slightly more "standard" overall. When they were recommending things to do, it was more to the tune of generic packaged tours. If you ask about other specific things, they may not know. There's really nothing I can fault the staff at OE, but Dersaadet's smaller, more close-knit staff gives a more personal feeling to our stay. BREAKFAST: Sort of tied. Both have good selection of cereal, cold cuts, breads, dried fruits, etc. OE has a larger selection that includes sausages and scrambled eggs, different cheeses, etc. But really, how much can you eat at breakfast? So both are adequate. BOTTOMLINE: They're both good for different reasons so it's really your personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Istambul a great experience - thank you Oreint express”
Reviews.Author: tophane
Reviews.Content: Very warm and cordial welcome given to us by Hotel staff starting at the Airport - Nicely located and good accomodation for the price - Hotel was able to arrange excellent tours for us throughout our stay in Istambul, I especially want to mention Mr Sadat Bey who helped me find my Mobile phone which i had left behind in a public park- we are impressed with honesty and humbleness of Turkish people in general would like to stay with them again if in Istambul

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: valerieEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located for the main mosques and Topkapi, and within walking distance of the tram, the spice market and many shops. The staff are not only welcoming upon one's arrival but remain totally helpful throughout the entire stay. They are committed to assisting you each and every day recommending transport, restaurants, tour guides and shops. Nothing seemed too much trouble. Rooms are made up each day. The lifts work. The hotel restaurant, located on the top floor with a view of the Bosphorus, was more than adequate. Service was polite, quick and unobtrusive. It was a joy to stay in this hotel and if I ever return to continue seeing the sights in Instanbul I would definitely return there. V & J (England)

Reviews.Title: “Warm receiption to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSwede
Reviews.Content: It felt very good to be picked up by very friendly hotel driver since it was our first time in Turkey. The personal presentation we received upon arrival to the hotel was excellent. Before we got our clean and nice room we already knew what we had to expect from Istanbul - the cross road of cultures, languages, people, continents and food ! We will be back ! Peter , Stockholm Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: WifeMotherSherpa
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long journey and were met with a warm friendly greeting. From the moment of arrival to departure the staff did everything to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable and we cannot commend them enough. We stayed in a suite and although the rooms were a little small they were clean and comfortable - the price that we paid was extremely competitive. Given the hotels facilitites, its location, the quality of the breakfast and most of all the genuine hospitatility and charm of the staff we felt that we got extremely good value for the money that we paid. The roof top restaurant serves good food at competitive prices and the views are magnificent. We were a mixed group ranging in ages from 12 to 65 and we all thoroughly enjoyed the stay - we would have no hesitation in recommending the establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKChris82
Reviews.Content: The Orient Express has a great location, a short walk to any of the main attractions, close to restaurants and bars and local transport. The staff were very efficient and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable and non-smoking. Unfortunately it was on the 7th floor, right below the restaurant, which was a bit noisy the first night (an early one), but it had closed by the time we got in the remaining nights. I give it 5* due to the staff, otherwise it would be 4* for the money that we paid - which is how we should be rating hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff @ Orient Express Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ribbons-and-bows
Reviews.Content: First, we were greeted by the car service (which was arranged by the hotel)at the airport and given a map showing us the route that would be taken to the hotel & then various points of interest was pointed out along the way. Upon arrival we were greeted by the front desk representative (Esat)) and were invited to experience â€œTurkish apple teaâ€�. Ece Sermet, Guest Relations Manager, then introduced herself and immediately began giving us information about the hotel & the many things to do while staying in Istanbul for two nights. She is VERY charming and knowledgeable answering many questions we had since this was our first time to Turkey. The entire staff from the front desk, cleaning ladies, as well as breakfast buffet servers were all very kind to us. We highly recommend this hotel and commend everyone on staff for being friendly & efficient! The hotel was very clean & located within walking distance to many places. We found the price to be very fair and it included breakfast which was nicely displayed with many selections. The restaurant on the 7th floor had very good food and a spectular view of the city. Because of the suggestions from Esat & Ece, we were able to see a lot of sites within a short period of time & even had time to shop too! We travel all over the world & have NEVER been treated so special upon arrival. Check it out for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolfanDubai
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Orient Express for 5 nights in March with my husband and his parents. Great stay, fantastic staff. Food in the hotel was great. Rooms are a little small as prople have mentioned, but with so much to see you don't really spend much time in them. The pool was a added bonus great to have a quick swim after a day site seeing. I would recommend the hotel and Istanbul to everyone. This was my third trip and by far the best hotel I have stayed in service and loaction wise.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: Angel1968
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 4 night stay at the Hotel Orient Express over the Easter weekend. The staff couldn't do enough to help us and the room was lovely - spotlessly clean and reasonably sized. The bathroom was a little small, but adequate - and also beautifully clean. The hotel was within sight of Aya Sofia and within easy walking distance of all the major tourist attractions - handy as the weather was not good. The breakfast was very nice, with plenty of variety and good service. The meal we had in the rooftop restaurant on the first night was also very good - fresh fish is clearly a speciality. We would definitely stay at the Orient Express on another trip to Istanbul and would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “it was sooooo great being there!”
Reviews.Author: treesfromtilburg
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Little, cosy hotel in the center of all the "must have seen's". Everything is at walking distance, even for my little daughter. HOTEL The rooms are not really big, especially with an extra bed, but how much time do you spend in a hotelroom when you are in a great city like Istanbul? Just to rest! So the beds are perfect! Nearly new boxsping, and the nice cleaning lady looks after it, every day! Very, very clean. The bathrooms are small but clean. Some have a douche, some of them have a small bath. The swimmingpool is smaller then it looks like on the photo's at their site and I missed the sauna... STAFF The staff is really great, always helpful and interested. They are also great with kids and spend some time with our daughter (3) running and playing hide and seek in the large Lobby and bar. She loved it! Even the cleaning lady, who only speaks Turkish, let us feel like a king and a queen. FOOD The breakfast was overwhelming in choices. Dinner at the top-restaurant of the hotel (being there twice) is realy worth to try. A marvelous view over the city and a great meal (fresh fish!!!). Next time, same place!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Whitecappy
Reviews.Content: Already the first contact had been very friendly. Booking for 7 days went well despite peak season, hotel offered us free airport pick-up and free night. Upon rainy arrival late in the evening the welcome at hotel was very kind, professional & personal with all basic information for a good stay in Istanbul. Nice decoration. The tram in front of the hotel does not disturb in the night as it stops operation. All is clean and well maintained. The nice pool is a real advantage, the restaurant on top has a wonderful view and the service is excellent. A fine birthday cake was offered at my partners birthday. All employees are always very kind, very helpful, very efficient. Rooms are a little bit small, but well equiped with safe box. TV picture quality could be better. We had been really happy to have chosen this hotel well placed. Everything you need is in walking distance or easy to find with tram, train, boat. We would immediately go again into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with friendly smiles!”
Reviews.Author: dxffm
Reviews.Content: Really good location to go sightseeing in the old town and near a tram station. From the airport, it takes less than one hour by tram & subway. All hotel people were friendly and helped alot for sightseeing. Free PC for internet on the ground floor and also free WIFI is avaraible in a room. Only one thing: walls between rooms are thin. I could listen to TV on the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Smoothie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orient Express for 4 nights in early March 2008 and it proved to be a good choice. Having booked directly with hotel, we used the complimentary airport pick up which was very useful and efficient. Arrived at hotel where staff were very friendly and provided apple tea during check in. Rooms/bathrooms were spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Our rooms were at the back of hotel so no noise. Rooms not particularily big but perfectly adequate. Also had copy of Istanbul Time Out which was useful in identifying some of the latest "in" restaurants. Breakfast was standard fare, had a wide range of items and we had no complaints. We found the location to be excellent - everything within walking distance. - Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market. 10 minutes walk to Galata Bridge / Eminou for boat trips. Also very close to tram stop if you want to go further. We used the bar beside the lobby and it had a good range of drinks at ok prices. Didnt use the restaurant or swimming pool. As mentioned above staff very friendly and helpful - quickly resolved a minor problem we had with safe and provided the bath plug which for some reason was only available on request. Overall a good place to stay and we found it to be very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place - Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: mariaPiraeus
Reviews.Content: Maria, Greece I visit Orient Exress almost every month. It is a warm and friendly hotel. Although it is in the centre of historical side of the town it is so quite. Rooms are always clean and room service excellent. People are so friendly that you feel you are at home. You can visit Imbat Restaurant to have a romantic dinner with the panoramic view of Bosphorus. According to me this hotel highlights the beauty of Istanbul and the hospitality of Turks

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: l_s_ferguson
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. Not far from all the main attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Good area for public transport so easy to get anywhere! Hotel itself very nice. Staff very helpful, rooms big enough and always spotless. Restaurant on the top floor very nice and resonably priced. Overall I would reccommend this hotel to those visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect accomdation”
Reviews.Author: LeoDeWijk
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a mid-week at the Orient Express Hotel in Istanbul. We stayed with four people in two double rooms. The staff was kind an very helpfull. The guest Relation Manager ( Miss. Ece Sermet) did her job very well. She was always nearby to answer our questions. Even far after her working day, she gave us quality time to tell about Istanbul and the special places, bars and restaurants. The dinner and breakfast was excellent and served in a buffet way, the quality and quantity was outstanding. During the afternoon we received for free turkisch tea and other drinks were 50% discount. The pool is lovely, not so big, but clean and luxurious. The Hotel is not expensive and has a good position in the hart of Istanbul. Overall I would recomend this hotel to everybody because of the price-quality level , the super kindly and helpfull staff and the central position to visit all the highlights in Istanbul. Regards, Leo and Anita from Holland

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Tural_Huseynov
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days with my girlfriend in Orient Express Hotel located just a walk distance away from Blue Mosque, St.Sophia & Topkapi palace. The staff at front desk and guest relationship manager were very friendly and helpful, turkish breakfast purely delicious, cosy rooms, I felt like at home! Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alishafqat
Reviews.Content: Our stay for 3 nights at Orient Express,Istanbul was one of the best hoteling experience. Excellent location, friendly and patient staff with good spoken english especially guest relationship manager who made moving around such a massive city really easy. Highly recommended for people who want to explore historical treasures of the city. 5 star for everything. The only criticism can be that the rooms are a little small but definitely worth the money charged.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed almost a week in the Orient Express Hotel and every day it felt more like home. The staff was very friendly and obliging. Also our room (incl. bathroom) was clean but a little bit small since there were three of us in one room. I guess it was a double room and they built up an extra bed. Worth mentioning is the breakfast with a large choice so everybody can find something. Every morning you could fine something new... Overall I can say that the price-performance ratio was more than good =) We would stay in this hotel again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: nikolas_from_greece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orient Express hotel for one week in a double room, in the beginning of January 2008. Our staying there was more than average. The hotel is close to the main attractions of Istanbul (Aghia Sofia, Blue Mosque), that is the Sultanahmet area. The staff was extremely polite with us and was keen to help us whenever this was necessary. We opted for a double room on the upper floors at the backside because it was more quite from the rooms at the front side (thank you fellow travelers from tripadvisor for this information). Nevertheless, I cannot say that there was not any noise from the neighboring rooms, although this was manageable. The mattresses of the beds are really excellent and the heating superb. The inconvenient of the room was its tiny wardrobe. The only thing you could put was just a coat, a suit and a couple of trousers. This is really a problem if you think that the space was intended for 2 persons and not a child.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Istanbul / Sultanahmet and Warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: ALANYA07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Orient Express Hotel in December 2007 and loved the warm welcoming. The Hotel personels friendly and very warm people started from airport the hotel transporter picked us up and all hotel staffs been helpful and kind to us 24hrs/7. Top class service and breakfast. We travel allot and stayed in all good Hotels which I will recommend specially and willing to stay in Orient Express again with my family Hotel located in a key area, 10 min walk to any places important for travelers. I have searched on line 3 weeks to find this hotel in Istanbul and as a result is the best one overall. We wish we had more time to stayed. Recommended with all the stars. KInd Regards, Cigerci Family / England

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: viajero_ESP
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located in the center of Sultanahmet area, excellent, reasonably-priced cuisine on its spectacular terrace restaurant, rooms clean (bathrooms too small, though). Best value for money in Istanbul. But, foremost, the friendly, caring staff members are the definite plus of this hotel; the guys at the reception desk add the human touch to a wonderful stay. It advertises as gay-friendly, and it lives up to its reputation. Keep up with the good job :)

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but quite nice overall”
Reviews.Author: rjb872
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but a very nice overall experience. Breakfast buffett was quite nice and the staff at all times were helpful and friendly. Good location in Sirkeci with cobble stone street, although not many restaurants in the area. Good value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just go and enjoy....”
Reviews.Author: snoow
Reviews.Content: It's not the first time for me, going to Istanbul, one of the most famous cities in the world...but I never went to a hotel like the Orient Express.... I have been in Istanbul for work things, so it was very important for me, staying in a comfortable hotel with excellent service and staff....and this is fact at the Orient Express Hotel.... The rooms are not so big but very cute and comfortable, and also the front desk staff was very very friendly. I would like to thank everyone of them..they allways take care of their guests, so I felt like I was at home....... If you are planning to go to Istanbul, than you have to choose the Orient Express Hotel....you will not regret it....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of the dreams”
Reviews.Author: AristotelesDeventer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a week in Istanbul at this hotel. It was very beautiful. The service was excellent. The breakfast is wide choice out of Turkish specialities. From the terrace restaurant of the hotel have you an beautiful outlook on the sea and the Golden Horn. The workers of the hotel were very friendly and hospitable. They can speak many languages. The guestmanager Mrs. Ege can you inform very well about the peculiarities of Istanbul. Hotel is near to all historical and cultural places of Istanbul (Topkapi palace, Sultan Ahmet, Hagia Sophia, Golden Horn, Galata Bridge, tower, Grand Bazar and many others). You don't nead any taxi, but with the railway are you in few minuts in the new centre of the city. From hotel to the harbour is possible to walk two minuts. You can also travel with boat across the Bosporous. Any thing what do you need is in yours reach. I'll summarize my impressions with the following words: silence, hygienics, hospitable and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: cathana
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - Staff very friendly and helpful especially, Bahri, Esat ,Tarik and Ediz. Would definitely recommend to friends and family. Breakfast not so nice, a bit basic and not much choice, but overall we had a lovely time. Istanbul is a beautiful City..

Reviews.Title: “Superb and frieendly service”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Forecast
Reviews.Content: In so few hotels in the world You get customer relationship person, who spends so much time with You. Not only giving good overview of historical places, but also shopping possibilities, books the best restaurants in the city and gives adequate ninghtclub recommendations. So very helpful in big city. Two thumbs up!!! We enjoyed a lot in Istanbul due to hotel services. Ms. Ece Sermet was our helpful guide in this Hotel and in whole Istanbul. Hotel locates in old city, very close to historical Istanbul railway station (London-Istanbul Orient Express train..), Central Bazaar, main historical spots. Good choice for a bit different city break.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: judyhk
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but comfortable. The hotel is in front of the light-rail tracks so it is convenient to travel on trams. I like the restaurant on the 7th floor. Good food and warm hospitality. Staff are friendly and helpful. Good location for shopping and sight-seeing.(review from a Hong Kong tourist)

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional welcoming service”
Reviews.Author: eylon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the historic center. The lobby and bar are decorated in the "orient express train" style. The restaurant is located on the terrace and offers a magnificent view and a very good choice of food. Breakfast room is very pleasant and the buffet is royal: variety of hot and cold plates. What makes this hotel specific is the warm and friendly welcome of all the staff. I would especially insist on Miss Eceâ€™s, in charge of customer care, always available to provide us with advises and information on culture and traditions, who amazed us by her smile and her good mood. Bravo! (Dany from Paris)

Reviews.Title: “Orient Express Hotel Istanbul review”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaBroomeWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Orient Express and loved it. Great location, friendly, helpful staff - all the staff from the house keepers, reservation staff, porters, waiters to the Guest Relation Manager. When we arrived we couldn't un zip our suitcase. One of the staff was determinded to help and succeeded. Luckily for us - I could imagine having to cut open the bag buy a new suitcase etc. Happy hour with nibbles, free internet. Overall the best assetts about this property location, location, location and fantastic staff. Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for a Great City”
Reviews.Author: AussieSpike
Reviews.Content: The service and friendly people at the Orient Express Hotel in the heart of Istanbul made me feel most welcome. The great location enabled me to enjoy the cities attrations both by a pleasent walk or by using the light-rail network just out side the door. The Hotel breakfast was first class and the roof top restaurant offered excellent views of the Bosphorus. Thanks to all the staff for providing a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holidays”
Reviews.Author: Val_Da_Roma
Reviews.Content: I like to travel so much.And this time decided to go to Istanbul. It was not my first trip to that wonderful city. And first of all I wanted to choose a hotel that is located close to the main historical places. It is one of the advantages of Orient Express. It is located only in 5-10 min. far from such great places as Topkapi Sarayi, Gulhane Parki, Sultanahmet Camii,Ayasofya, Yerebatan etc.. At the same time the hotel is situated very close to the Bosphorus. The hotel is very clean, comfortable. Also I'd like to add few words about hotel staff: everybody showed a very warm reception, if I had any problems and questions the personnel was always happy and ready to help me. In short, that hotel is worth to stay in. It is great in all meanings,I loved it and will come there again and again.Thanks to Orient Express for my amazing holidays in Istanbul!

HotelInfo.Name: Orient Express Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hudavendigar Caddesi 34 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
